 23257                                  
 23258                                  ;	TITLE	DIR - Directory and path cracking
 23259                                  ;	NAME	Dir
 23260                                  
 23261                                  ;Break	<FINDENTRY -- LOOK FOR AN ENTRY>
 23262                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23263                                  ;
 23264                                  ; Procedure Name : FINDENTRY,SEARCH
 23265                                  ;
 23266                                  ; Inputs:
 23267                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 23268                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 23269                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Starting directory sector number
 23270                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster of directory
 23271                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 23272                                  ;	[NAME1] = Name to look for
 23273                                  ; Function:
 23274                                  ;	Find file name in disk directory.
 23275                                  ;	"?" matches any character.
 23276                                  ; Outputs:
 23277                                  ;	Carry set if name not found
 23278                                  ;	ELSE
 23279                                  ;	Zero set if attributes match (always except when creating)
 23280                                  ;	AH = Device ID (bit 7 set if not disk)
 23281                                  ;	[THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters
 23282                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 23283                                  ;	ES = DOSGROUP
 23284                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer into directory buffer
 23285                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI = Pointer to First Cluster field in directory entry
 23286                                  ;	[CURBUF] has directory record with match
 23287                                  ;	[NAME1] has file name
 23288                                  ;	[LASTENT] is entry number of the entry
 23289                                  ; All other registers destroyed.
 23290                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23291                                  
 23292                                  ;hkn; called from rename.asm and dir2.asm. DS must be already set up at
 23293                                  ;hkn; this point.
 23294                                  
 23295                                  SEARCH:
 23296                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23297                                  	; DOSCODE:7C90h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23298                                  
 23299                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23300                                  	; DOSCODE:7CCA (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23301                                  
 23302                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23303                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 45B3h 
 23304                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 23305                                  
 23306                                  	;entry	FindEntry
 23307                                  FINDENTRY:
 23308 00003DFE E84804                  	call	STARTSRCH
 23309 00003E01 A0[6B05]                	MOV	AL,[ATTRIB]
 23310                                  	;and	al,9Eh
 23311 00003E04 24DE                    	AND	AL,~attr_ignore		; Ignore useless bits
 23312                                  	;cmp	al,8
 23313 00003E06 3C08                    	CMP	AL,attr_volume_id	; Looking for vol ID only ?
 23314 00003E08 7503                    	JNZ	short NOTVOLSRCH	; No
 23315 00003E0A E87501                  	CALL	SETROOTSRCH		; Yes force search of root
 23316                                  NOTVOLSRCH:
 23317 00003E0D E80601                  	CALL	GETENTRY
 23318 00003E10 7303                    	JNC	short SRCH
 23319 00003E12 E99500                  	JMP	SETESRET
 23320                                  
 23321                                  	;entry	Srch
 23322                                  SRCH:
 23323 00003E15 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 23324 00003E16 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 23325                                  
 23326                                  ;	(DS:BX) = directory entry address
 23327                                  
 23328 00003E1A 8A27                    	mov	ah,[BX]
 23329                                  	;MOV	AH,[BX+dir_entry.dir_name] ; mov ah,[bx+0]
 23330 00003E1C 08E4                    	OR	AH,AH			; End of directory?
 23331 00003E1E 743A                    	JZ	short FREE
 23332                                  
 23333                                  ;hkn; SS override
 23334 00003E20 363A26[7F05]            	CMP	AH,[SS:DELALL]		; Free entry?
 23335 00003E25 7433                    	JZ	short FREE
 23336                                  	;test	byte [bx+0Bh],8
 23337 00003E27 F6470B08                	TEST	byte [BX+dir_entry.dir_attr],attr_volume_id
 23338                                  					; Volume ID file?
 23339 00003E2B 7405                    	JZ	short CHKFNAM 		; NO
 23340                                  
 23341                                  ;hkn; SS override
 23342 00003E2D 36FE06[7B05]            	INC	BYTE [SS:VOLID]
 23343                                  CHKFNAM:
 23344                                  ;	Context ES
 23345 00003E32 8CD6                    	MOV	SI,SS
 23346 00003E34 8EC6                    	MOV	ES,SI
 23347 00003E36 89DE                    	MOV	SI,BX
 23348                                  
 23349                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 23350 00003E38 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 23351                                  ;;;;; 7/29/86
 23352                                  
 23353                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 23354 00003E3B 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	BYTE [SS:NAME1],0E5H	; special char check
 23355 00003E41 7506                    	JNZ	short NO_E5
 23356 00003E43 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	BYTE [SS:NAME1],05H
 23357                                  NO_E5:
 23358                                  ;;;;; 7/29/86
 23359 00003E49 E86100                  	CALL	MetaCompare
 23360 00003E4C 7428                    	JZ	short FOUND
 23361 00003E4E 1F                      	POP	DS
 23362                                  
 23363                                  	;entry	NEXTENT
 23364                                  NEXTENT:
 23365 00003E4F C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 23366 00003E53 E86600                  	CALL	NEXTENTRY
 23367 00003E56 73BD                    	JNC	short SRCH
 23368 00003E58 EB50                    	JMP	SHORT SETESRET
 23369                                  
 23370                                  FREE:
 23371 00003E5A 1F                      	POP	DS
 23372 00003E5B 8B0E[4803]              	MOV	CX,[LASTENT]
 23373 00003E5F 3B0E[D805]              	CMP	CX,[ENTFREE]
 23374 00003E63 7304                    	JAE	short TSTALL
 23375 00003E65 890E[D805]              	MOV	[ENTFREE],CX
 23376                                  TSTALL:
 23377 00003E69 3A26[7F05]              	CMP	AH,[DELALL]		; At end of directory?
 23378                                  NEXTENTJ:
 23379 00003E6D 74E0                    	je	short NEXTENT 		; No - continue search
 23380 00003E6F 890E[DA05]              	MOV	[ENTLAST],CX
 23381 00003E73 F9                      	STC
 23382 00003E74 EB34                    	JMP	SHORT SETESRET
 23383                                  
 23384                                  FOUND:
 23385                                  ; We have a file with a matching name. We must now consider the attributes:
 23386                                  ; ATTRIB	Action
 23387                                  ; ------	------
 23388                                  ; Volume_ID	Is Volume_ID in test?
 23389                                  ; Otherwise	If no create then Is ATTRIB+extra superset of test?
 23390                                  ;		If create then Is ATTRIB equal to test?
 23391                                  
 23392 00003E76 8A2C                    	MOV	CH,[SI] 		; Attributes of file
 23393 00003E78 1F                      	POP	DS
 23394 00003E79 8A26[6B05]              	MOV	AH,[ATTRIB]		; Attributes of search
 23395                                  	;and	ah,9Eh
 23396 00003E7D 80E4DE                  	AND	AH,~attr_ignore
 23397                                  	;lea	si,[si+15]
 23398 00003E80 8D740F                  	LEA	SI,[SI+dir_entry.dir_first-dir_entry.dir_attr]
 23399                                  					; point to first cluster field
 23400                                  	;test	ch,8
 23401 00003E83 F6C508                  	TEST	CH,attr_volume_id	; Volume ID file?
 23402 00003E86 7409                    	JZ	short check_one_volume_id ; Nope check other attributes
 23403                                  	;test	ah,8
 23404 00003E88 F6C408                  	TEST	AH,attr_volume_id	; Can we find Volume ID?
 23405                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ		; Nope, (not even $FCB_CREATE)
 23406                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23407 00003E8B 74C2                    	jz	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 23408                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23409                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ
 23410 00003E8D 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Set zero flag for $FCB_CREATE
 23411 00003E8F EB11                    	JMP	SHORT RETFF		; Found Volume ID
 23412                                  check_one_volume_id:
 23413                                  	;CMP	ah,8
 23414 00003E91 80FC08                  	CMP	AH,attr_volume_id	; Looking only for Volume ID?
 23415                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ		; Yes, continue search
 23416                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23417 00003E94 74B9                    	je	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 23418                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ
 23419 00003E96 E8C403                  	CALL	MatchAttributes
 23420 00003E99 7407                    	JZ	SHORT RETFF
 23421 00003E9B F606[7E05]FF            	TEST	BYTE [CREATING],-1	; Pass back mismatch if creating
 23422                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23423                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ		; Otherwise continue searching
 23424 00003EA0 74AD                    	jz	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 23425                                  RETFF:
 23426 00003EA2 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 23427                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23428                                  	;MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]  ; mov ah,[es:bp+0]
 23429                                  	; 15/12/2022
 23430 00003EA6 268A6600                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP]
 23431                                  SETESRET:
 23432 00003EAA 16                      	PUSH	SS
 23433 00003EAB 07                      	POP	ES
 23434 00003EAC C3                      	retn
 23435                                  
 23436                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23437                                  ;
 23438                                  ; Procedure Name : MetaCompare
 23439                                  ;
 23440                                  ; Inputs:
 23441                                  ;	DS:SI -> 11 character FCB style name NO '?'
 23442                                  ;	    Typically this is a directory entry.  It MUST be in upper case
 23443                                  ;	ES:DI -> 11 character FCB style name with possible '?'
 23444                                  ;	    Typically this is a FCB or SFT.  It MUST be in upper case
 23445                                  ; Function:
 23446                                  ;	Compare FCB style names allowing for ? match to any char
 23447                                  ; Outputs:
 23448                                  ;	Zero if match else NZ
 23449                                  ; Destroys CX,SI,DI all others preserved
 23450                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23451                                  
 23452                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23453                                  	; DOSCODE:7D3Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23454                                  
 23455                                  MetaCompare:
 23456 00003EAD B90B00                  	MOV	CX,11
 23457                                  WILDCRD:
 23458 00003EB0 F3A6                    	REPE	CMPSB
 23459 00003EB2 7407                    	JZ	short MetaRet 		; most of the time we will fail.
 23460                                  CHECK_META:
 23461 00003EB4 26807DFF3F              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1],"?"
 23462 00003EB9 74F5                    	JZ	short WILDCRD
 23463                                  MetaRet:
 23464 00003EBB C3                       	retn				; Zero set, Match
 23465                                  
 23466                                  ;Break	<NEXTENTRY -- STEP THROUGH DIRECTORY>
 23467                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23468                                  ;
 23469                                  ; Procedure Name : NEXTENTRY
 23470                                  ;
 23471                                  ; Inputs:
 23472                                  ;	Same as outputs of GETENTRY, above
 23473                                  ; Function:
 23474                                  ;	Update BX, and [LASTENT] for next directory entry.
 23475                                  ;	Carry set if no more.
 23476                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23477                                  
 23478                                  NEXTENTRY:
 23479                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23480                                  	; DOSCODE:7D4Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23481                                  
 23482                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23483                                  	; DOSCODE:7D88h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23484                                  
 23485                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23486                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 4671h 
 23487                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 23488                                  
 23489 00003EBC A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 23490 00003EBF 3B06[DA05]              	CMP	AX,[ENTLAST]
 23491 00003EC3 7422                    	JZ	short NONE
 23492 00003EC5 40                      	INC	AX
 23493                                  	;ADD	BX,32
 23494 00003EC6 8D5F20                  	LEA	BX,[BX+32]
 23495 00003EC9 39D3                    	CMP	BX,DX
 23496                                  	; 21/11/2022 - MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS (DOSCODE:7D5Dh)
 23497                                  	;JB	short HAVIT ; MSDOS 6.0 src (dir.asm)
 23498                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23499 00003ECB 751C                    	jne	short HAVIT ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:7D97h)
 23500 00003ECD 8A1E[7305]              	MOV	BL,[SECCLUSPOS]
 23501 00003ED1 FEC3                    	INC	BL
 23502 00003ED3 3A1E[7705]              	CMP	BL,[CLUSFAC]
 23503 00003ED7 7215                    	JB	short SAMECLUS
 23504 00003ED9 8B1E[DC05]              	MOV	BX,[NXTCLUSNUM]
 23505 00003EDD E80A17                  	call	IsEOF
 23506 00003EE0 7305                    	JAE	short NONE
 23507                                  	; 23/07/2019
 23508 00003EE2 83FB02                  	CMP	BX,2
 23509                                  	;JB	short NONE
 23510                                  	;JMP	short GETENT
 23511                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23512 00003EE5 7332                    	jnb	short GETENT
 23513                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23514                                  	;JB	short NONE
 23515                                  	;JMP	short GETENT
 23516                                  NONE:
 23517 00003EE7 F9                      	STC
 23518 00003EE8 C3                      	retn
 23519                                  HAVIT:
 23520 00003EE9 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 23521 00003EEC F8                      	CLC
 23522                                  nextentry_retn:
 23523 00003EED C3                      	retn
 23524                                  SAMECLUS:
 23525 00003EEE 881E[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],BL
 23526 00003EF2 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 23527 00003EF5 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 23528 00003EF6 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 23529                                  	; 19/05/2019
 23530                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23531                                  	;mov	dx,[di+8]
 23532 00003EFA 8B5508                  	MOV	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]	;AN000; >32mb
 23533                                  ;hkn; SS override
 23534 00003EFD 368916[0706]            	MOV	[SS:HIGH_SECTOR],DX 		;AN000; >32mb
 23535                                  	;mov	dx,[di+6]
 23536 00003F02 8B5506                  	MOV	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]	;AN000; >32mb
 23537                                  	;inc	dx ; MSDOS 3.3
 23538                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23539 00003F05 83C201                  	ADD	DX,1				;AN000; >32mb
 23540 00003F08 368316[0706]00          	ADC	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0 	;AN000; >32mb
 23541                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 23542 00003F0E 1F                      	POP	DS
 23543 00003F0F E82BF8                  	call	FIRSTCLUSTER
 23544 00003F12 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX
 23545 00003F14 EB23                    	JMP	short SETENTRY
 23546                                  
 23547                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23548                                  ;
 23549                                  ; Procedure Name : GETENTRY
 23550                                  ;
 23551                                  ; Inputs:
 23552                                  ;	[LASTENT] has directory entry
 23553                                  ;	ES:BP points to drive parameters
 23554                                  ;	[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[ENTLAST] set for DIR involved
 23555                                  ; Function:
 23556                                  ;	Locates directory entry in preparation for search
 23557                                  ;	GETENT provides entry for passing desired entry in AX
 23558                                  ; Outputs:
 23559                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer to next directory entry in CURBUF
 23560                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:DX = Pointer to first byte after end of CURBUF
 23561                                  ;	[LASTENT] = New directory entry number
 23562                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS] set via DIRREAD
 23563                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 23564                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23565                                  
 23566                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23567                                  GETENTRY:
 23568                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23569 00003F16 A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 23570                                  
 23571                                  	;entry	GETENT
 23572                                  GETENT:
 23573 00003F19 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 23574                                  ;
 23575                                  ; Convert the entry number in AX into a byte offset from the beginning of the
 23576                                  ; directory.
 23577                                  ;
 23578 00003F1C B105                    	mov	cl,5			; shift left by 5 = mult by 32
 23579 00003F1E D3C0                    	rol	ax,cl			; keep hight order bits
 23580 00003F20 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 23581                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23582                                  	;and	ax,0FFE0h
 23583                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23584                                  	;and	ax,~(32-1)		; mask off high order bits
 23585                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23586 00003F22 24E0                    	and	al,0E0h ; ~31
 23587 00003F24 83E21F                  	and	dx,1Fh
 23588                                  	;and	dx,32-1			; mask off low order bits
 23589                                  ;
 23590                                  ; DX:AX contain the byte offset of the required directory entry from the
 23591                                  ; beginning of the directory. Convert this to a sector number. Round the
 23592                                  ; sector size down to a multiple of 32.
 23593                                  ;
 23594                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+2]
 23595 00003F27 268B5E02                	MOV	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 23596 00003F2B 80E3E0                  	and	bl,0E0h
 23597                                  	;AND	BL,255-31		; Must be multiple of 32
 23598 00003F2E F7F3                    	DIV	BX
 23599 00003F30 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX			; Position within sector
 23600 00003F32 53                      	PUSH	BX
 23601 00003F33 E8AEF7                  	call	DIRREAD
 23602 00003F36 5B                      	POP	BX
 23603                                  	;retc
 23604 00003F37 72B4                    	jc	short nextentry_retn	
 23605                                  SETENTRY:
 23606 00003F39 8B16[E205]              	MOV	DX,[CURBUF]
 23607                                  	;add	dx,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 23608                                  	;add	dx,20 ; MSDOS 6.0 
 23609 00003F3D 83C214                  	ADD	DX,BUFINSIZ
 23610 00003F40 01D3                    	ADD	BX,DX
 23611                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+2]
 23612 00003F42 26035602                	ADD	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]  ; Always clears carry
 23613 00003F46 C3                      	retn
 23614                                  
 23615                                  ;Break	<SETDIRSRCH SETROOTSRCH -- Set Search environments>
 23616                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23617                                  ;
 23618                                  ; Procedure Name : SETDIRSRCH,SETROOTSRCH
 23619                                  ;
 23620                                  ; Inputs:
 23621                                  ;	BX cluster number of start of directory
 23622                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 23623                                  ;	DI next cluster number from fastopen extended info. DOS 3.3 only
 23624                                  ; Function:
 23625                                  ;	Set up a directory search
 23626                                  ; Outputs:
 23627                                  ;	[DIRSTART] = BX
 23628                                  ;	[CLUSFAC],[CLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC] set
 23629                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 23630                                  ; destroys AX,DX,BX
 23631                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23632                                  
 23633                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23634                                  SETDIRSRCH:
 23635 00003F47 09DB                    	OR	BX,BX
 23636 00003F49 7437                    	JZ	short SETROOTSRCH
 23637 00003F4B 891E[C205]              	MOV	[DIRSTART],BX
 23638                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 23639 00003F4F 268A4604                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 23640 00003F53 FEC0                    	INC	AL
 23641 00003F55 A2[7705]                	MOV	[CLUSFAC],AL
 23642                                  
 23643                                  ; DOS 3.3 for FastOPen	F.C. 6/12/86
 23644                                  	;SAVE	<SI>
 23645 00003F58 56                      	push	si
 23646                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 23647 00003F59 F606[3A0D]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 23648 00003F5E 7507                    	JNZ	short UNP_OK
 23649                                  
 23650                                  ; DOS 3.3 for FastOPen	F.C. 6/12/86
 23651                                  	;invoke	UNPACK
 23652 00003F60 E89E16                  	call	UNPACK
 23653 00003F63 7302                    	JNC	short UNP_OK
 23654                                  	;RESTORE <SI>
 23655 00003F65 5E                      	pop	si
 23656                                  	;return
 23657 00003F66 C3                      	retn
 23658                                  
 23659                                  UNP_OK:
 23660 00003F67 893E[BC05]              	MOV	[CLUSNUM],DI
 23661 00003F6B 89DA                    	MOV	DX,BX
 23662 00003F6D 30DB                    	XOR	BL,BL
 23663 00003F6F 881E[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],BL
 23664                                  	;invoke	FIGREC
 23665 00003F73 E82F0F                  	call	FIGREC
 23666                                  	;RESTORE <SI>
 23667 00003F76 5E                      	pop	si
 23668                                  	
 23669                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23670                                  
 23671                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23672                                  	;PUSH	DX			   ;AN000; >32mb
 23673                                  	;MOV	DX,[HIGH_SECTOR]	   ;AN000; >32mb
 23674                                  	;MOV	[DIRSEC+2],DX		   ;AN000; >32mb
 23675                                  	;POP	DX			   ;AN000; >32mb
 23676                                  
 23677                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23678                                  	;push	dx
 23679                                  	;mov	dx,[HIGH_SECTOR]
 23680                                  	;mov	[DIRSEC+2],dx
 23681                                  	;pop	dx
 23682                                  	;MOV	[DIRSEC],dx
 23683                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23684 00003F77 A1[0706]                	mov	ax,[HIGH_SECTOR]
 23685 00003F7A A3[C005]                	mov	[DIRSEC+2],AX
 23686 00003F7D 8916[BE05]              	MOV	[DIRSEC],DX
 23687                                  
 23688                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23689                                  	; cf=0 (at the return of FIGREC)
 23690                                  	;CLC
 23691 00003F81 C3                      	retn
 23692                                  
 23693                                  	;entry	SETROOTSRCH
 23694                                  SETROOTSRCH:
 23695 00003F82 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 23696 00003F84 A3[C205]                	MOV	[DIRSTART],AX
 23697 00003F87 A2[7305]                	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],AL
 23698 00003F8A 48                      	DEC	AX
 23699 00003F8B A3[BC05]                	MOV	[CLUSNUM],AX
 23700                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+0Bh]
 23701 00003F8E 268B460B                	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_SECTOR]
 23702                                  	; 19/05/2019
 23703                                  	;;mov	dx,[es:bp+10h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 23704                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+11h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 23705 00003F92 268B5611                	MOV	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.DIR_SECTOR]
 23706 00003F96 29D0                    	SUB	AX,DX
 23707 00003F98 A2[7705]                	MOV	[CLUSFAC],AL
 23708 00003F9B 8916[BE05]              	MOV	[DIRSEC],DX		      ;F.C. >32mb
 23709                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23710 00003F9F C706[C005]0000          	MOV	WORD [DIRSEC+2],0	      ;F.C. >32mb
 23711 00003FA5 F8                      	CLC
 23712 00003FA6 C3                      	retn
 23713                                  
 23714                                  ;============================================================================
 23715                                  ; DIR2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 23716                                  ;============================================================================
 23717                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23718                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 
 23719                                  
 23720                                  ;	TITLE	DIR2 - Directory and path cracking
 23721                                  ;	NAME	Dir2
 23722                                  
 23723                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 23724                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23725                                  ;
 23726                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 23727                                  ;
 23728                                  ; Inputs:
 23729                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23730                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 23731                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23732                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23733                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23734                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 23735                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 23736                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 23737                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 23738                                  ; Function:
 23739                                  ;	Crack the path
 23740                                  ; Outputs:
 23741                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 23742                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 23743                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 23744                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 23745                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 23746                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 23747                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 23748                                  ;	   Zero set
 23749                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 23750                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 23751                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 23752                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 23753                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 23754                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 23755                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 23756                                  ;	   Zero reset
 23757                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 23758                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 23759                                  ;	ELSE
 23760                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 23761                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 23762                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 23763                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 23764                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 23765                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 23766                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 23767                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 23768                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 23769                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 23770                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 23771                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 23772                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 23773                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 23774                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 23775                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 23776                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 23777                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 23778                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 23779                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 23780                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 23781                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23782                                  
 23783                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 23784                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 23785                                  
 23786                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23787                                  GETPATH:
 23788                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 23789 00003FA7 C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 23790                                  
 23791                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 23792                                  
 23793                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 23794                                  GetPathNoSet:
 23795                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2	
 23796 00003FAD C606[2303]02            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 23797 00003FB2 C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 23798                                  
 23799                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 23800                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 23801                                  
 23802 00003FB8 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 23803                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 23804                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 23805 00003FBC 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'
 23806 00003FC1 7438                    	JZ	short CrackIt
 23807                                  
 23808                                  ; Let ChkDev find it in the device list
 23809                                  
 23810 00003FC3 83C703                  	ADD	DI,3
 23811                                  	; 18/08/2018
 23812                                  	;MOV	SI,DI			; let CHKDEV see the original name
 23813                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23814                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23815                                  	;mov	si,di ; not required ! (it is written in CHKDEV proc already!)
 23816 00003FC6 E8B000                  	CALL	CHKDEV
 23817 00003FC9 722E                    	JC	short InternalError
 23818                                  
 23819                                  Build_devJ:
 23820 00003FCB A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 23821 00003FCE A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 23822                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 23823 00003FD1 C606[2303]01            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; In the particular case of
 23824                                  					; "finding" a char device
 23825                                  					; set LOCUS to Unknown. This makes
 23826                                  					; certain idiotic problems reported
 23827                                  					; by a certain 3 letter OEM go away.
 23828                                  
 23829                                  ; Take name in name1 and pack it back into where wfp_start points. This
 23830                                  ; guarantees wfp_start pointing to a canonical representation of a device.
 23831                                  ; We are allowed to do this as GetPath is *ALWAYS* called before entering a
 23832                                  ; wfp into the share set.
 23833                                  ;
 23834                                  ; We copy chars from name1 to wfp_start remembering the position of the last
 23835                                  ; non-space seen +1.  This position is kept in DX.
 23836                                  
 23837                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 23838 00003FD6 16                      	push	ss
 23839 00003FD7 07                      	pop	es
 23840                                  
 23841                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 23842 00003FD8 BE[4B05]                	mov	si,NAME1
 23843 00003FDB 8B3E[B205]              	mov	di,[WFP_START]
 23844 00003FDF 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 23845 00003FE1 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; 8 chars in device name
 23846                                  MoveLoop:
 23847 00003FE4 AC                      	lodsb
 23848 00003FE5 AA                      	stosb
 23849 00003FE6 3C20                    	cmp	al," "
 23850 00003FE8 7402                    	jz	short NoSave
 23851                                  
 23852 00003FEA 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 23853                                  NoSave:
 23854 00003FEC E2F6                    	loop	MoveLoop
 23855                                  
 23856                                  ; DX is the position of the last seen non-space + 1. We terminate the name
 23857                                  ; at this point.
 23858                                  
 23859 00003FEE 89D7                    	mov	di,dx
 23860 00003FF0 C60500                  	mov	byte [di],0		; end of string
 23861 00003FF3 E8D302                  	call	Build_device_ent	; Clears carry sets zero
 23862 00003FF6 FEC0                    	INC	AL			; reset zero
 23863 00003FF8 C3                      	retn
 23864                                  
 23865                                  InternalError:
 23866                                  InternalError_loop:
 23867 00003FF9 EBFE                    	JMP	short InternalError_loop	; freeze
 23868                                  
 23869                                  ; Start off at the correct spot. Optimize if the current dir part is valid.
 23870                                  
 23871                                  CrackIt:
 23872 00003FFB 8B36[B605]              	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]	; get current directory pointer
 23873 00003FFF 83FEFF                  	CMP	SI,-1			; valid?
 23874 00004002 7503                    	JNZ	short LOOK_SING		; Yes, use it.
 23875 00004004 8D7503                  	LEA	SI,[DI+3]		; skip D:\.
 23876                                  LOOK_SING:
 23877                                  	;mov	byte [ATTRIB],16h
 23878 00004007 C606[6B05]16            	MOV	byte [ATTRIB],attr_directory+attr_system+attr_hidden
 23879                                  					; Attributes to search through Dirs
 23880 0000400C C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 23881 00004010 B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1
 23882                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+73]
 23883 00004013 268B5D49                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+curdir.ID]
 23884 00004017 8B36[B605]              	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 23885                                  
 23886                                  ; AX = -1
 23887                                  ; BX = cluster number of current directory. THis number is -1 if the media
 23888                                  ;      has been uncertainly changed.
 23889                                  ; SI = offset in DOSGroup into path to end of current directory text. This
 23890                                  ;      may be -1 if no current directory part has been used.
 23891                                  
 23892 0000401B 39C6                    	CMP	SI,AX			; if Current directory is not part
 23893 0000401D 7440                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; then we must crack from root
 23894 0000401F 39C3                    	CMP	BX,AX			; is the current directory cluster valid
 23895                                  
 23896                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 23897 00004021 743C                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; no, crack form the root
 23898                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],1
 23899 00004023 F606[3A0D]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ; for fastopen ?
 23900 00004028 7442                    	JZ	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER	; no
 23901 0000402A 06                      	PUSH	ES			; save registers
 23902 0000402B 57                      	PUSH	DI
 23903 0000402C 51                      	PUSH	CX
 23904 0000402D FF74FF                  	PUSH	word [SI-1]		; save \ and 1st char of next element
 23905 00004030 56                      	PUSH	SI
 23906 00004031 53                      	PUSH	BX
 23907                                  
 23908 00004032 C644FF00                	MOV	BYTE [SI-1],0		; call fastopen to look up cur dir info
 23909 00004036 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 23910                                  
 23911                                  ;hkn; FastOpenTable, Dir_Info_Buff & FastOpen_Ext_Info are in DOSDATA
 23912 0000403A BB[300D]                	MOV	BX,FastOpenTable
 23913 0000403D BF[460D]                	MOV	DI,Dir_Info_Buff
 23914 00004040 B9[3B0D]                	MOV	CX,FastOpen_Ext_Info
 23915                                  	;mov	al,1
 23916 00004043 B001                    	MOV	AL,FONC_Look_up
 23917 00004045 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 23918 00004046 07                      	POP	ES
 23919                                  	;call	far [BX+2]
 23920 00004047 FF5F02                  	CALL	far [BX+fastopen_entry.name_caching]
 23921 0000404A 7208                    	JC	short GO_Chk_end1 	;fastopen not installed, or wrong drive.
 23922                                  					; Go to Got_Srch_cluster
 23923 0000404C 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0		;fastopen has current dir info?
 23924 0000404F 7404                    	JE	short GO_Chk_end	;yes. Go to got_search_cluster
 23925 00004051 F9                      	stc
 23926 00004052 EB01                    	jmp	short GO_Chk_end	;Go to No_Curr_D
 23927                                  GO_Chk_end1:
 23928 00004054 F8                      	clc
 23929                                  GO_Chk_end:				; restore registers
 23930 00004055 5B                      	POP	BX
 23931 00004056 5E                      	POP	SI
 23932 00004057 8F44FF                  	POP	word [SI-1]
 23933 0000405A 59                      	POP	CX
 23934 0000405B 5F                      	POP	DI
 23935 0000405C 07                      	POP	ES
 23936 0000405D 730D                    	JNC	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER ; crack based on cur dir
 23937                                  
 23938                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 23939                                  ;
 23940                                  ; We must cract the path beginning at the root. Advance pointer to beginning
 23941                                  ; of path and go crack from root.
 23942                                  
 23943                                  NO_CURR_D:
 23944 0000405F 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 23945 00004063 8D7403                  	LEA	SI,[SI+3]		; Skip "d:/"
 23946 00004066 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 23947 0000406A EB3C                    	JMP	short ROOTPATH
 23948                                  
 23949                                  ; We are able to crack from the current directory part. Go set up for search
 23950                                  ; of specified cluster.
 23951                                  
 23952                                  GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER:
 23953 0000406C C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 23954 00004070 E8D4FE                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 23955                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 23956                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 23957                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23958 00004073 7344                    	jnc	short FINDPATH ; 17/08/2018
 23959                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23960                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 23961                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 23962                                  SETFERR:
 23963 00004075 30C9                    	XOR	CL,CL			; set zero
 23964 00004077 F9                      	STC
 23965 00004078 C3                      	retn
 23966                                  
 23967                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23968                                  ;
 23969                                  ; Procedure Name : ChkDev
 23970                                  ;
 23971                                  ; Check to see if the name at DS:DI is a device. Returns carry set if not a
 23972                                  ;   device.
 23973                                  ; Blasts CX,SI,DI,AX,BX
 23974                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23975                                  
 23976                                  CHKDEV:
 23977 00004079 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 23978 0000407B 8CD7                    	MOV	DI,SS
 23979 0000407D 8EC7                    	MOV	ES,DI
 23980                                  
 23981 0000407F BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 23982 00004082 B90900                  	MOV	CX,9
 23983                                  TESTLOOP:
 23984 00004085 E87F10                  	call	GETLET
 23985                                  
 23986 00004088 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'
 23987 0000408A 740E                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 23988 0000408C E8CE10                  	call	PATHCHRCMP
 23989 0000408F 7407                    	JZ	short NOTDEV
 23990 00004091 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 23991 00004093 7405                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 23992                                  
 23993 00004095 AA                      	STOSB
 23994 00004096 E2ED                    	LOOP	TESTLOOP
 23995                                  NOTDEV:
 23996 00004098 F9                      	STC
 23997 00004099 C3                      	retn
 23998                                  
 23999                                  TESTDEVICE:
 24000 0000409A 83C102                  	ADD	CX,2
 24001 0000409D B020                    	MOV	AL,' '
 24002 0000409F F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 24003 000040A1 8CD0                    	MOV	AX,SS
 24004 000040A3 8ED8                    	MOV	DS,AX
 24005                                  	;call	DEVNAME
 24006                                  	;retn
 24007                                  	; 18/12/2022
 24008 000040A5 E9C201                  	jmp	DEVNAME
 24009                                  
 24010                                  ;Break	<ROOTPATH, FINDPATH -- PARSE A PATH>
 24011                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24012                                  ;
 24013                                  ; Procedure Name : ROOTPATH,FINDPATH
 24014                                  ;
 24015                                  ; Inputs:
 24016                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but,
 24017                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path which is assumed to start at
 24018                                  ;		the root (no leading '/').
 24019                                  ; Function:
 24020                                  ;	Search from root for path
 24021                                  ; Outputs:
 24022                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but:
 24023                                  ;	If root directory specified, [CURBUF] and [NAME1] are NOT set, and
 24024                                  ;	[NoSetDir] is ignored.
 24025                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24026                                  
 24027                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24028                                  	; DOSCODE:7F47h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24029                                  
 24030                                  ROOTPATH:
 24031 000040A8 E8D7FE                  	call	SETROOTSRCH
 24032 000040AB 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0
 24033 000040AE 7509                    	JNZ	short FINDPATH
 24034                                  
 24035                                  ; Root dir specified
 24036 000040B0 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 24037 000040B3 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 24038 000040B6 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Sets "device ID" byte, sets zero
 24039                                  					; (dir), clears carry.
 24040 000040B8 C3                      	retn
 24041                                  
 24042                                  ; Inputs:
 24043                                  ;	[ATTRIB] Set to get through directories
 24044                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Set to find last element
 24045                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 24046                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path (no leading '/').
 24047                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 24048                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Phys sec # of first sector of directory
 24049                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Cluster # of next cluster
 24050                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors per cluster
 24051                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 24052                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 24053                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 24054                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 24055                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 24056                                  ;	[CREATING] and [DELALL] set
 24057                                  ; Function:
 24058                                  ;	Parse path name
 24059                                  ; Outputs:
 24060                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 24061                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 24062                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 24063                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
 24064                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 24065                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 24066                                  ;	   Zero set
 24067                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 24068                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 24069                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 24070                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 24071                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 24072                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 24073                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 24074                                  ;	   Zero reset
 24075                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path
 24076                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 24077                                  ;	ELSE
 24078                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 24079                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 24080                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points to fcb_FIRCLUS field for entry
 24081                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 24082                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 24083                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 24084                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 24085                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 24086                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 24087                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 24088                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it,
 24089                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 24090                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 24091                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 24092                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 24093                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 24094                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 24095                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 24096                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 24097                                  ; Destroys all other registers
 24098                                  
 24099                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24100                                  	; DOSCODE:7F58h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24101                                  
 24102                                      	;entry	FINDPATH
 24103                                  FINDPATH:
 24104 000040B9 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 24105 000040BA 56                      	PUSH	SI
 24106 000040BB 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 24107 000040BD 8B0E[C205]              	MOV	CX,[DIRSTART]		; Get start clus of dir being searched
 24108 000040C1 833E[B605]FF            	CMP	word [CURR_DIR_END],-1
 24109 000040C6 740E                    	JZ	short NOIDS		; No current dir part
 24110 000040C8 3B3E[B605]              	CMP	DI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 24111 000040CC 7508                    	JNZ	short NOIDS		; Not to current dir end yet
 24112 000040CE C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 24113                                  	;mov	[es:di+73],cx
 24114 000040D2 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX	; Set current directory currency
 24115                                  NOIDS:
 24116                                  
 24117                                  ; Parse the name off of DS:SI into NAME1. AL = 1 if there was a meta
 24118                                  ; character in the string. CX,DI may be destroyed.
 24119                                  ;
 24120                                  ;	invoke	NAMETRANS
 24121                                  ;	MOV	CL,AL
 24122                                  ;
 24123                                  ; The above is the slow method. The name has *already* been munged by
 24124                                  ; TransPath so no special casing needs to be done. All we do is try to copy
 24125                                  ; the name until ., \ or 0 is hit.
 24126                                  
 24127 000040D6 8CD0                    	MOV	AX,SS
 24128 000040D8 8EC0                    	MOV	ES,AX
 24129                                  
 24130                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 24131 000040DA BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 24132 000040DD B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  ' ; 2020h
 24133 000040E0 AA                      	STOSB
 24134 000040E1 AB                      	STOSW
 24135 000040E2 AB                      	STOSW
 24136 000040E3 AB                      	STOSW
 24137 000040E4 AB                      	STOSW
 24138 000040E5 AB                      	STOSW
 24139                                  
 24140                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 24141 000040E6 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 24142 000040E9 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; bits for CL
 24143                                  GetNam:
 24144                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24145                                  	;INC	CL ; ?*! ; MSDOS 6.0	;AN000; KK increment volid count
 24146                                  
 24147                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 24148                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24149                                  	;inc	cl ; not required !	
 24150                                  	
 24151 000040EB AC                      	LODSB
 24152 000040EC 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'	; 2Eh
 24153 000040EE 7412                    	JZ	short _SetExt
 24154 000040F0 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24155 000040F2 7424                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 24156 000040F4 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 24157 000040F6 7420                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 24158 000040F8 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'	; 3Fh
 24159 000040FA 7503                    	JNZ	short StoNam
 24160 000040FC 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 24161                                  StoNam: 
 24162 000040FF AA                      	STOSB
 24163 00004100 EBE9                    	JMP	short GetNam
 24164                                  _SetExt:
 24165 00004102 BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,NAME1+8
 24166                                  GetExt:
 24167 00004105 AC                      	LODSB
 24168 00004106 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24169 00004108 740E                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 24170 0000410A 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 24171 0000410C 740A                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 24172 0000410E 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'
 24173 00004110 7503                    	JNZ	short StoExt
 24174 00004112 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 24175                                  StoExt: 
 24176 00004115 AA                      	STOSB
 24177 00004116 EBED                    	JMP	short GetExt
 24178                                  _GetDone:
 24179 00004118 4E                      	DEC	SI
 24180 00004119 88E1                    	MOV	CL,AH  ; ?*!
 24181 0000411B 80C980                  	OR	CL,80H
 24182 0000411E 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of this element
 24183 0000411F 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 24184 00004120 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 24185 00004122 7503                    	JNZ	short check_device
 24186 00004124 E9EA00                  	JMP	_BADPATH		; NUL parse (two delims most likely)
 24187                                  check_device:
 24188 00004127 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Start of next element
 24189 00004128 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 24190 0000412A 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24191 0000412C 7508                    	JNZ	short NOT_LAST
 24192                                  
 24193                                  ; for last element of the path switch to the correct search attributes
 24194                                  
 24195 0000412E 8A3E[6D05]              	MOV	BH,[SATTRIB]
 24196 00004132 883E[6B05]              	MOV	[ATTRIB],BH
 24197                                  
 24198                                  NOT_LAST:
 24199                                  
 24200                                  ; check name1 to see if we have a device...
 24201                                  
 24202 00004136 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 24203                                  
 24204                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24205                                  	;context ES
 24206 00004137 16                      	push	ss
 24207 00004138 07                      	pop	es
 24208 00004139 E82E01                  	call	DEVNAME 		; blast BX
 24209 0000413C 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 24210 0000413D 720B                    	JC	short FindFile		; Not a device
 24211 0000413F 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; Test next char again
 24212 00004141 7403                    	JZ	short GO_BDEV
 24213 00004143 E9CF00                  	JMP	FILEINPATH		; Device name in middle of path
 24214                                  
 24215                                  GO_BDEV:
 24216 00004146 5E                      	POP	SI			; Points to NUL at end of path
 24217 00004147 E981FE                  	JMP	Build_devJ
 24218                                  
 24219                                  FindFile:
 24220                                  ;;;; 7/28/86
 24221 0000414A 803E[4B05]E5            	CMP	BYTE [NAME1],0E5H	; if 1st char = E5
 24222 0000414F 7505                    	JNZ	short NOE5		; no
 24223 00004151 C606[4B05]05            	MOV	BYTE [NAME1],05H	; change it to 05
 24224                                  NOE5:
 24225                                  ;;;; 7/28/86
 24226 00004156 57                      	PUSH	DI			; Start of this element
 24227 00004157 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 24228 00004158 51                      	PUSH	CX			; CL return from NameTrans
 24229                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 24230                                  
 24231 00004159 E89C02                  	CALL	LookupPath		; call fastopen to get dir entry
 24232 0000415C 7303                    	JNC	short DIR_FOUND		; found dir entry
 24233                                  
 24234                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 24235 0000415E E89DFC                  	call	FINDENTRY
 24236                                  DIR_FOUND:
 24237 00004161 59                      	POP	CX
 24238 00004162 07                      	POP	ES
 24239 00004163 5F                      	POP	DI
 24240 00004164 7303                    	JNC	short LOAD_BUF
 24241 00004166 E9D100                  	JMP	BADPATHPOP
 24242                                  
 24243                                  LOAD_BUF:
 24244 00004169 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 24245                                  	;test	byte [bx+0Bh],10h
 24246 0000416D F6470B10                	TEST	BYTE [BX+dir_entry.dir_attr],attr_directory
 24247 00004171 7503                    	JNZ	short GO_NEXT 		; DOS 3.3
 24248 00004173 E99F00                  	JMP	FILEINPATH		; Error or end of path
 24249                                  
 24250                                  ; if we are not setting the directory, then check for end of string
 24251                                  
 24252                                  GO_NEXT:
 24253                                  ;hkn; SS override
 24254 00004176 36803E[4C03]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:NoSetDir],0
 24255 0000417C 7423                    	JZ	short SetDir
 24256 0000417E 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI			; Save pointer to entry
 24257 00004180 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 24258                                  
 24259                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24260                                  	;context DS
 24261 00004182 16                      	push	ss
 24262 00004183 1F                      	pop	ds
 24263 00004184 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 24264                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24265                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24266 00004185 F606[3A0D]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ;only DOSOPEN can take advantage of
 24267 0000418A 740B                    	JZ	short _nofast			; the FastOpen
 24268 0000418C F606[3A0D]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success ; Lookup just happened
 24269 00004191 7404                    	JZ	short _nofast			; no
 24270 00004193 8B3E[660D]              	MOV	DI,[Next_Element_Start]	; no need to insert it again
 24271                                  _nofast:
 24272 00004197 803D00                  	CMP	BYTE [DI],0
 24273                                  	;;JNZ	short NEXT_ONE		; DOS 3.3
 24274                                  	;;JMP	_SETRET  ; retn		; Got it
 24275                                  	;retn	; 05/09/2018
 24276                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 24277                                  	;jmp	_SETRET
 24278                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24279 0000419A 7421                    	jz	short _SETRET
 24280                                  
 24281                                  NEXT_ONE:
 24282 0000419C 57                      	PUSH	DI			; Put start of next element back on stack
 24283 0000419D 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 24284 0000419F 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX			; Get back pointer to entry
 24285                                  SetDir:
 24286 000041A1 8B14                    	MOV	DX,[SI] 		; Dir_first
 24287                                  
 24288                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 24289 000041A3 1E                      	PUSH	DS		      ; save [curbuf+2]
 24290                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24291 000041A4 16                      	push	ss
 24292 000041A5 1F                      	pop	ds		      ; set DS Dosgroup
 24293                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 24294 000041A6 F606[3A0D]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 24295 000041AB 7411                    	JZ	short DO_NORMAL	      ; fastopen not in memory or path not
 24296 000041AD 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX		      ; not found
 24297 000041AF 8B3E[BC05]              	MOV	DI,[CLUSNUM]	      ; clusnum was set in LookupPath
 24298 000041B3 50                      	PUSH	AX		      ; save device id (AH)
 24299 000041B4 E890FD                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 24300 000041B7 58                      	POP	AX		      ; restore device id (AH)
 24301 000041B8 83C402                  	ADD	SP,2		      ; pop ds in stack
 24302 000041BB EB3E                    	JMP	short FAST_OPEN_SKIP
 24303                                  
 24304                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24305                                  _SETRET:
 24306 000041BD C3                      	retn
 24307                                  
 24308                                  DO_NORMAL:
 24309 000041BE 1F                      	POP	DS			; DS = [curbuf + 2]
 24310                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 24311                                  
 24312 000041BF 29FB                    	SUB	BX,DI			; Offset into sector of start of entry
 24313 000041C1 29FE                    	SUB	SI,DI			; Offset into sector of dir_first
 24314 000041C3 53                      	PUSH	BX
 24315 000041C4 50                      	PUSH	AX
 24316 000041C5 56                      	PUSH	SI
 24317 000041C6 51                      	PUSH	CX
 24318                                  	;push	word [di+6]
 24319 000041C7 FF7506                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]	;AN000;>32mb
 24320                                  	; 19/05/2019
 24321                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24322                                  	;push	word [di+8]
 24323 000041CA FF7508                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]	;AN000;>32mb
 24324 000041CD 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX
 24325                                  
 24326                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24327                                  	;context DS
 24328 000041CF 16                      	push	ss
 24329 000041D0 1F                      	pop	ds
 24330                                  	;invoke	SETDIRSRCH		; This uses UNPACK which might blow
 24331 000041D1 E873FD                  	call	SETDIRSRCH		; the entry sector buffer
 24332                                  	; 19/05/2019
 24333                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24334 000041D4 8F06[0706]              	POP	word [HIGH_SECTOR]
 24335 000041D8 5A                      	POP	DX
 24336 000041D9 720A                    	JC	short SKIP_GETB
 24337                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 24338 000041DB C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL
 24339 000041E0 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 24340                                  	;invoke	GETBUFFR		; Get the entry buffer back
 24341 000041E2 E83E18                  	call	GETBUFFR
 24342                                  SKIP_GETB:
 24343 000041E5 59                      	POP	CX
 24344 000041E6 5E                      	POP	SI
 24345 000041E7 58                      	POP	AX
 24346 000041E8 5B                      	POP	BX
 24347 000041E9 7305                    	JNC	short SET_THE_BUF
 24348 000041EB 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 24349 000041EC 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; Point with SI
 24350 000041EE EB21                    	JMP	SHORT _BADPATH
 24351                                  
 24352                                  SET_THE_BUF:
 24353 000041F0 E856F5                  	call	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 24354 000041F3 8B3E[E205]              	MOV	DI,[CURBUF]
 24355 000041F7 01FE                    	ADD	SI,DI			; Get the offsets back
 24356 000041F9 01FB                    	ADD	BX,DI
 24357                                  ; DOS 3.3 FastOpen 6/12/86  F.C.
 24358                                  FAST_OPEN_SKIP:
 24359 000041FB 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 24360 000041FC E89D02                  	CALL	InsertPath		; insert dir entry info
 24361                                  ; DOS 3.3 FastOpen 6/12/86  F.C.
 24362 000041FF 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 24363 00004201 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24364 00004203 74B8                    	JZ	short _SETRET		; At end
 24365 00004205 47                      	INC	DI			; Skip over "/"
 24366 00004206 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; Point with SI
 24367 00004208 E8520F                  	call	PATHCHRCMP
 24368 0000420B 7503                    	JNZ	short find_bad_name	; oops
 24369 0000420D E9A9FE                  	JMP	FINDPATH		; Next element
 24370                                  
 24371                                  find_bad_name:
 24372 00004210 4E                      	DEC	SI			; Undo above INC to get failure point
 24373                                  _BADPATH:
 24374 00004211 30C9                    	XOR	CL,CL			; Set zero
 24375 00004213 EB2C                    	JMP	SHORT BADPRET
 24376                                  
 24377                                  FILEINPATH:
 24378 00004215 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 24379                                  
 24380                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24381                                  	;context DS			; Got to from one place with DS gone
 24382 00004216 16                      	push	ss
 24383 00004217 1F                      	pop	ds
 24384                                  
 24385                                  ; DOS 3.3 FastOpen
 24386                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],1
 24387 00004218 F606[3A0D]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set  ; do this here is we don't want to
 24388 0000421D 740B                    	JZ	short NO_FAST		; device info to fastopen
 24389                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 24390 0000421F F606[3A0D]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 24391 00004224 7404                    	JZ	short NO_FAST
 24392 00004226 8B3E[660D]              	MOV	DI,[Next_Element_Start]  ; This takes care of one time lookup
 24393                                  					 ; success
 24394                                  NO_FAST:
 24395                                  ; DOS 3.3 FastOpen
 24396 0000422A 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 24397 0000422C 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24398 0000422E 7404                    	JZ	short INCRET
 24399 00004230 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; Path too long
 24400 00004232 EB0D                    	JMP	SHORT BADPRET
 24401                                  
 24402                                  INCRET:
 24403                                  ; DOS 3.3 FasOpen 6/12/86  F.C.
 24404                                  
 24405 00004234 E86502                  	CALL   InsertPath		; insert dir entry info
 24406                                  
 24407                                  ; DOS 3.3 FasOpen 6/12/86  F.C.
 24408 00004237 FEC0                    	INC	AL			; Reset zero
 24409                                  	; 16/12/2022	
 24410                                  ;_SETRET:
 24411 00004239 C3                      	retn
 24412                                  
 24413                                  BADPATHPOP:
 24414 0000423A 5E                      	POP	SI			; Start of next element
 24415 0000423B 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 24416 0000423D 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; Start of bad element
 24417 0000423F 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; zero if bad element is last, non-zero if path too long
 24418                                  BADPRET:
 24419 00004241 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 24420 00004244 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL		; Make sure return correct
 24421 00004247 F9                      	STC
 24422 00004248 C3                      	retn
 24423                                  
 24424                                  ;Break	<STARTSRCH -- INITIATE DIRECTORY SEARCH>
 24425                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24426                                  ;
 24427                                  ; Procedure Name : STARTSRCH
 24428                                  ;
 24429                                  ; Inputs:
 24430                                  ;	[THISDPB] Set
 24431                                  ; Function:
 24432                                  ;	Set up a search for GETENTRY and NEXTENTRY
 24433                                  ; Outputs:
 24434                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameters
 24435                                  ;	Sets up LASTENT, ENTFREE=ENTLAST=-1, VOLID=0
 24436                                  ; Destroys ES,BP,AX
 24437                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24438                                  
 24439                                  STARTSRCH:
 24440 00004249 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 24441 0000424D 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 24442 0000424F A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 24443 00004252 A2[7B05]                	MOV	[VOLID],AL		; No volume ID found
 24444 00004255 48                      	DEC	AX
 24445 00004256 A3[D805]                	MOV	[ENTFREE],AX
 24446 00004259 A3[DA05]                	MOV	[ENTLAST],AX
 24447 0000425C C3                      	retn
 24448                                  
 24449                                  ;BREAK <MatchAttributes - the final check for attribute matching>
 24450                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24451                                  ; Procedure Name : MatchAttributes
 24452                                  ;
 24453                                  ; Input:    [Attrib] = attribute to search for
 24454                                  ;	    CH = found attribute
 24455                                  ; Output:   JZ <match>
 24456                                  ;	    JNZ <nomatch>
 24457                                  ; Registers modified: noneski
 24458                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24459                                  
 24460                                  MatchAttributes:
