 26973                                  ;
 26974                                  ; Procedure Name : FREEENT
 26975                                  ;
 26976                                  ; Inputs:
 26977                                  ;       ES:BP -> DPB
 26978                                  ;       [CURBUF] Set
 26979                                  ;       [CURBUF+2]:BX points to directory entry
 26980                                  ;       [CURBUF+2]:SI points to above dir_first
 26981                                  ; Function:
 26982                                  ;       Free the cluster chain for the entry if present
 26983                                  ; Outputs:
 26984                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 26985                                  ;       (NOTE dir_firclus and dir_size_l/h are wrong)
 26986                                  ; DS BX SI ES BP preserved (BX,SI in meaning, not value) others destroyed
 26987                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26988                                  
 26989                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 26990                                  FREEENT:
 26991 00004C9B 1E                              PUSH    DS
 26992 00004C9C C53E[E205]                      LDS     DI,[CURBUF]
 26993 00004CA0 8B0C                            MOV     CX,[SI]         ; Get pointer to clusters
 26994                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26995                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 26996 00004CA2 8B5508                  	MOV	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]  ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 26997                                  ;hkn; SS override
 26998 00004CA5 368916[0706]                    MOV	[SS:HIGH_SECTOR],DX		;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 26999 00004CAA 8B5506                          MOV     DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27000 00004CAD 1F                              POP     DS
 27001 00004CAE 83F902                  	CMP	CX,2
 27002 00004CB1 7235                            JB	short RET1	; Was 0 length file (or mucked Firclus if CX=1)
 27003                                  	;cmp	cx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 27004 00004CB3 263B4E0D                        CMP     CX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 27005 00004CB7 772F                            JA	short RET1	; Treat like zero length file (firclus mucked)
 27006 00004CB9 29FB                            SUB     BX,DI
 27007 00004CBB 53                              PUSH    BX              ; Save offset
 27008 00004CBC FF36[0706]              	PUSH	word [HIGH_SECTOR] ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 27009 00004CC0 52                              PUSH    DX              ; Save sector number
 27010 00004CC1 89CB                            MOV     BX,CX
 27011 00004CC3 E8B702                          call	RELEASE         ; Free any data allocated
 27012 00004CC6 5A                              POP     DX
 27013 00004CC7 8F06[0706]                      POP	word [HIGH_SECTOR] ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 27014 00004CCB 7302                            JNC	short GET_BUF_BACK
 27015 00004CCD 5B                              POP     BX
 27016                                  freeent_retn:
 27017 00004CCE C3                              retn			; Screw up
 27018                                  
 27019                                  GET_BUF_BACK:
 27020                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 27021 00004CCF C606[4B03]18                    MOV     byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL
 27022 00004CD4 30C0                            XOR     AL,AL
 27023 00004CD6 E84A0D                  	call	GETBUFFR        ; Get sector back
 27024 00004CD9 5B                              POP     BX              ; Get offset back
 27025 00004CDA 72F2                            jc	short freeent_retn
 27026 00004CDC E86AEA                  	call	SET_BUF_AS_DIR

 27035                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27036                                  ;
 27037                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECK_VIRT_OPEN
 27038                                  ;
 27039                                  ; CHECK_VIRT_OPEN checks to see if we had performed a "virtual open" (by
 27040                                  ; examining the flag [VIRTUAL_OPEN] to see if it is 1). If we did, then
 27041                                  ; it calls Dev_Close_SFT to decrement the ref. count. It also resets the
 27042                                  ; flag [VIRTUAL_OPEN].
 27043                                  ; No registers affected (including flags).
 27044                                  ; On input, [THISSFT] points to current SFT.
 27045                                  ;
 27046                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27047                                  
 27048                                  CHECK_VIRT_OPEN:
 27049 00004CEA 50                      	PUSH    AX
 27050 00004CEB 9F                              lahf                    ; preserve flags
 27051 00004CEC 803E[A20A]00                    CMP     byte [VIRTUAL_OPEN],0
 27052 00004CF1 7410                            JZ	short ALL_CLOSED
 27053 00004CF3 C606[A20A]00                    mov     byte [VIRTUAL_OPEN],0	; reset flag
 27054 00004CF8 06                      	push	es
 27055 00004CF9 57                      	push	di
 27056 00004CFA C43E[9E05]                      LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 27057 00004CFE E88CF9                          call	DEV_CLOSE_SFT
 27058 00004D01 5F                      	pop	di
 27059 00004D02 07                      	pop	es
 27060                                  
 27061                                  ALL_CLOSED:
 27062 00004D03 9E                              sahf                    ; restore flags
 27063 00004D04 58                              POP     AX
 27064 00004D05 C3                              retn

 27073                                  ;	NAME	ROM
 27074                                  
 27075                                  ;**	Misc Low level routines for doing simple FCB computations, Cache
 27076                                  ;       reads and writes, I/O optimization, and FAT allocation/deallocation
 27077                                  ;
 27078                                  ;	SKPCLP

 27082                                  ;	BUFWRT
 27083                                  ;	NEXTSEC
 27084                                  ;	OPTIMIZE

 27097                                  ;Break   <FNDCLUS -- Skip over allocation units>
 27098                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27099                                  ;
 27100                                  ; Procedure Name : FNDCLUS
 27101                                  ;
 27102                                  ; Inputs:
 27103                                  ;       CX = No. of clusters to skip
 27104                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27105                                  ;       [THISSFT] point to SFT
 27106                                  ; Outputs:
 27107                                  ;       BX = Last cluster skipped to
 27108                                  ;       CX = No. of clusters remaining (0 unless EOF)
 27109                                  ;       DX = Position of last cluster
 27110                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27111                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 27112                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27113                                  
 27114                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27115                                  ; DOSCODE:8BF2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27116                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27117                                  ; DOSCODE:8BB7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27118                                  
 27119                                  FNDCLUS:
 27120 00004D06 06                      	PUSH	ES
 27121 00004D07 C43E[9E05]                      LES     DI,[THISSFT]		; setup addressability to SFT
 27122                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:di+1Bh] ; MSDOS 3.3
 27123                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+35h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 27124 00004D0B 268B5D35                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_lstclus]
 27125                                  	;mov	dx,[es:di+19h]
 27126 00004D0F 268B5519                        MOV     DX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_cluspos]
 27127 00004D13 09DB                    	OR	BX,BX
 27128 00004D15 7424                    	JZ	short NOCLUS
 27129                                  
 27130 00004D17 29D1                            SUB     CX,DX
 27131 00004D19 7308                            JNB	short FINDIT
 27132                                  
 27133 00004D1B 01D1                            ADD     CX,DX
 27134 00004D1D 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 27135                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+0Bh]
 27136 00004D1F 268B5D0B                        MOV     BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus]
 27137                                  FINDIT:
 27138 00004D23 07                              POP	ES
 27139 00004D24 E313                    	JCXZ	RET9
 27140                                  
 27141                                  	;entry	SKPCLP
 27142                                  SKPCLP:
 27143 00004D26 E8D808                  	call	UNPACK
 27144 00004D29 7214                            jc	short fndclus_retn	; retc
 27145                                  
 27146                                  	; 09/09/2018
 27147                                  
 27148                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 27149                                  	;push	bx
 27150                                  	;mov	bx,di
 27151                                  	;call	IsEOF
 27152                                  	;pop	bx	
 27153                                  	;jae	short RET9
 27154

 27156

 27179                                  ;Break  <BUFSEC -- BUFFER A SECTOR AND SET UP A TRANSFER>
 27180                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27181                                  ;
 27182                                  ; Procedure Name : BUFSEC
 27183                                  ;
 27184                                  ; Inputs:
 27185                                  ;       AH = priority of buffer
 27186                                  ;       AL = 0 if buffer must be read, 1 if no pre-read needed
 27187                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27188                                  ;       [CLUSNUM] = Physical cluster number
 27189                                  ;       [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector position of transfer within cluster
 27190                                  ;       [BYTCNT1] = Size of transfer
 27191                                  ; Function:
 27192                                  ;       Insure specified sector is in buffer, flushing buffer before
 27193                                  ;       read if necessary.
 27194                                  ; Outputs:
 27195                                  ;       ES:DI = Pointer to buffer
 27196                                  ;       SI = Pointer to transfer address
 27197                                  ;       CX = Number of bytes
 27198                                  ;       [NEXTADD] updated
 27199                                  ;       [TRANS] set to indicate a transfer will occur
 27200                                  ;       Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 27201                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27202                                  
 27203                                  BUFSEC:
 27204 00004D40 8B16[BC05]                      MOV     DX,[CLUSNUM]
 27205 00004D44 8A1E[7305]                      MOV     BL,[SECCLUSPOS]

 27207 00004D48 C606[4B03]38                    MOV     byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_IGNORE

 27209 00004D50 E8D00C                  	call	GETBUFFR
 27210 00004D53 72EA                            jc	short fndclus_retn

 27213 00004D5A 8B36[B805]                      MOV     SI,[NEXTADD]
 27214 00004D5E 89F7                            MOV     DI,SI
 27215 00004D60 8B0E[D205]                      MOV     CX,[BYTCNT1]
 27216 00004D64 01CF                            ADD     DI,CX
 27217 00004D66 893E[B805]                      MOV     [NEXTADD],DI

 27235                                  ; ES:BP Points to DPB
 27236                                  ; Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 27444                                  clusgot:

 27457                                  ;Break	<OPTIMIZE -- DO A USER DISK REQUEST WELL>
 27458                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27459                                  ;
 27460                                  ; Procedure Name : OPTIMIZE
 27461                                  ;
 27462                                  ; Inputs:
 27463                                  ;       BX = Physical cluster
 27464                                  ;       CX = No. of records
 27465                                  ;       DL = sector within cluster
 27466                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27467                                  ;       [NEXTADD] = transfer address
 27468                                  ; Outputs:
 27469                                  ;       AX = No. of records remaining
 27470                                  ;       BX = Transfer address
 27471                                  ;       CX = No. or records to be transferred
 27472                                  ;       DX = Physical sector address            (LOW)
 27473                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR] = Physical sector address (HIGH)
 27474                                  ;       DI = Next cluster
 27475                                  ;       [CLUSNUM] = Last cluster accessed
 27476                                  ;       [NEXTADD] updated
 27477                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27478                                  ; ES:BP unchanged. Note that segment of transfer not set.
 27479                                  ;
 27480                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27481                                  
 27482                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27483                                  OPTIMIZE:
 27484 00004E46 52                      	PUSH    DX
 27485 00004E47 53                              PUSH    BX
 27486                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 27487 00004E48 268A4604                        MOV     AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 27488 00004E4C FEC0                            INC     AL              ; Number of sectors per cluster
 27489 00004E4E 88C4                            MOV     AH,AL
 27490 00004E50 28D0                            SUB     AL,DL           ; AL = Number of sectors left in first cluster
 27491 00004E52 89CA                            MOV     DX,CX
 27492                                  	;MOV	CX,0
 27493                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27494                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27495 00004E54 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx	; sub cx,cx
 27496                                  OPTCLUS:
 27497                                  ; AL has number of sectors available in current cluster
 27498                                  ; AH has number of sectors available in next cluster
 27499                                  ; BX has current physical cluster
 27500                                  ; CX has number of sequential sectors found so far
 27501                                  ; DX has number of sectors left to transfer
 27502                                  ; ES:BP Points to DPB
 27503                                  ; ES:SI has FAT pointer
 27504                                  
 27505                                  do_norm3:
 27506 00004E56 E8A807                          call	UNPACK
 27507 00004E59 7237                            JC	short OP_ERR
 27508                                  clusgot2:
 27509 00004E5B 00C1                    	ADD	CL,AL
 27510 00004E5D 80D500                          ADC     CH,0
 27511 00004E60 39D1                            CMP     CX,DX
 27512 00004E62 7333                            JAE	short BLKDON
 27513 00004E64 88E0                            MOV     AL,AH
 27514 00004E66 43                              INC     BX
 27515 00004E67 39DF                            CMP     DI,BX
 27516 00004E69 74EB                            JZ	short OPTCLUS
 27517 00004E6B 4B                              DEC     BX
 27518                                  FINCLUS:
 27519 00004E6C 891E[BC05]                      MOV     [CLUSNUM],BX    ; Last cluster accessed
 27520 00004E70 29CA                            SUB     DX,CX           ; Number of sectors still needed
 27521 00004E72 52                              PUSH    DX
 27522 00004E73 89C8                            MOV     AX,CX
 27523                                  	;mul	word[ES:BP+2]
 27524 00004E75 26F76602                        MUL	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] 
 27525                                  				; Number of sectors times sector size
 27526 00004E79 8B36[B805]                      MOV     SI,[NEXTADD]
 27527 00004E7D 01F0                            ADD     AX,SI           ; Adjust by size of transfer
 27528 00004E7F A3[B805]                        MOV     [NEXTADD],AX
 27529 00004E82 58                              POP     AX              ; Number of sectors still needed
 27530 00004E83 5A                              POP     DX              ; Starting cluster
 27531 00004E84 29D3                            SUB     BX,DX           ; Number of new clusters accessed
 27532 00004E86 011E[BA05]                      ADD     [LASTPOS],BX
 27533 00004E8A 5B                              POP     BX              ; BL = sector position within cluster
 27534 00004E8B E81700                  	call	FIGREC
 27535 00004E8E 89F3                            MOV     BX,SI
 27536 00004E90 F8                      	CLC
 27537 00004E91 C3                              retn
 27538                                  OP_ERR:
 27539 00004E92 83C404                          ADD     SP,4
 27540 00004E95 F9                      	STC
 27541 00004E96 C3                              retn
 27542                                  BLKDON:
 27543 00004E97 29D1                            SUB     CX,DX           ; Number of sectors in cluster we don't want
 27544 00004E99 28CC                            SUB     AH,CL           ; Number of sectors in cluster we accepted
 27545 00004E9B FECC                            DEC     AH              ; Adjust to mean position within cluster
 27546 00004E9D 8826[7305]                      MOV     [SECCLUSPOS],AH
 27547 00004EA1 89D1                            MOV     CX,DX           ; Anyway, make the total equal to the request
 27548 00004EA3 EBC7                            JMP     SHORT FINCLUS
 27549                                  
 27550                                  ;Break	<FIGREC -- Figure sector in allocation unit>
 27551                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27552                                  ;
 27553                                  ; Procedure Name : FIGREC
 27554                                  ;
 27555                                  ; Inputs:
 27556                                  ;       DX = Physical cluster number
 27557                                  ;       BL = Sector position within cluster
 27558                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27559                                  ; Outputs:
 27560                                  ;       DX = physical sector number           (LOW)
 27561                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR] Physical sector address (HIGH)
 27562                                  ; No other registers affected.
 27563                                  ;
 27564                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27565                                  
 27566                                  	; 10/06/2019
 27567                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27568                                  	; DOSCODE:8D96h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27569                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27570                                  	; DOSCODE:8D5Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 27571                                  FIGREC:
 27572 00004EA5 51                              PUSH    CX
 27573                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 27574 00004EA6 268A4E05                        MOV     CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 27575 00004EAA 4A                              DEC     DX
 27576 00004EAB 4A                              DEC     DX
 27577                                  
 27578                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 27579                                  	;SHL	DX,CL
 27580                                  
 27581                                  ;hkn; SS override HIGH_SECTOR
 27582                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27583 00004EAC 36C706[0706]0000        	MOV	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0		;F.C. >32mb
 27584 00004EB3 08C9                    	OR	CL,CL				;F.C. >32mb
 27585 00004EB5 740C                    	JZ	short noshift			;F.C. >32mb
 27586 00004EB7 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH 				;F.C. >32mb
 27587                                  rotleft:					;F.C. >32mb
 27588 00004EB9 F8                      	CLC					;F.C. >32mb
 27589 00004EBA D1D2                    	RCL	DX,1				;F.C. >32mb
 27590                                  	; 10/06/2019
 27591 00004EBC 36D116[0706]            	RCL	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR],1		;F.C. >32mb
 27592 00004EC1 E2F6                    	LOOP	rotleft				;F.C. >32mb
 27593                                  noshift:
 27594                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 27595 00004EC3 08DA                            OR      DL,BL
 27596                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+0Bh]
 27597 00004EC5 2603560B                        ADD     DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_SECTOR]
 27598                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27599                                  	; 10/06/2019
 27600 00004EC9 368316[0706]00                  ADC	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR],0		;F.C. >32mb
 27601                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0        
 27602 00004ECF 59                      	POP     CX
 27603                                  figrec_retn:
 27604 00004ED0 C3                              retn
 27605                                  
 27606                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27607                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27608                                  
 27609                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27610                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 
 27611                                  
 27612                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 27613                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27614                                  ;
 27615                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 27616                                  ;
 27617                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 27618                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 27619                                  ;
 27620                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 27621                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 27622                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 27623                                  ;
 27624                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 27625                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 27626                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 27627                                  ;
 27628                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 27629                                  ;
 27630                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 27631                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 27632                                  ;           ELSE
 27633                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 27634                                  ;
 27635                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 27636                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 27637                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 27638                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 27639                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 27640                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 27641                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 27642                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 27643                                  ;   allocated.
 27644                                  ;
 27645                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 27646                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 27647                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 27648                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 27649                                  ;
 27650                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 27651                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 27652                                  ;                                                                          ;
 27653                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 27654                                  ;   explanation:
 27655                                  ;
 27656                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 27657                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 27658                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 27659                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 27660                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 27661                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 27662                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 27663                                  ;   the
 27664                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 27665                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 27666                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 27667                                  ;
 27668                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 27669                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 27670                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 27671                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 27672                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 27673                                  ;
 27674                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 27675                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 27676                                  ;                                                                          ;
 27677                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 27678                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 27679                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27680                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 27681                                  ;
 27682                                  ;       EXIT    'C' set if insufficient space
 27683                                  ;                 [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 27684                                  ;                 CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 27685                                  ;               'C' clear if space allocated
 27686                                  ;                 BX = First cluster allocated
 27687                                  ;                 FAT is fully updated
 27688                                  ;                 sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 27689                                  ;
 27690                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 27691                                  
 27692                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 27693                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 27694                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 27695                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 27696                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 27697                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 27698                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 27699                                  ;callmagic  endp
 27700                                  
 27701                                  ALLOCATE:
 27702                                  	; 10/09/2018
 27703                                  ;BEGIN MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 27704                                  ;
 27705                                  ;7/5/92 scottq
 27706                                  ;
 27707                                  ;This is the disk compression patch location which allows
 27708                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 27709                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 27710                                  ;data would not.
 27711                                  ;        
 27712                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 27713                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 27714                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine
 27715                                  ;;; so simulate a far call to dosdata:magicpatch
 27716                                  ;;; note dosassume above, so DS -> dosdata
 27717                                  
 27718                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27719                                          ;clc				;clear carry so we fall through
 27720                                  	;				;if no patch is present
 27721                                  	;push	cs			;push segment for far return
 27722                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 27723                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 27724                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 27725                                  
 27726                                  ;Regular_Allocate_Path:
 27727                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27728                                  ;END MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 27729                                  
 27730                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27731                                  	; DOSCODE:8D87h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27732                                  
 27733 00004ED1 53                              PUSH    BX                      ; save (bx)
 27734 00004ED2 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 27735 00004ED4 E82A07                  	call	UNPACK
 27736 00004ED7 893E[9605]                      MOV     [FATBYT],DI             ; save correct cluster 0 value
 27737 00004EDB 5B                              POP     BX
 27738 00004EDC 72F2                            jc	short figrec_retn	; abort if error   [INTERR?]
 27739                                  
 27740 00004EDE 51                              PUSH    CX
 27741 00004EDF 53                              PUSH    BX
 27742                                  
 27743 00004EE0 89DA                            MOV     DX,BX
 27744                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Ch]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 27745                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]	; MSDOS 6.0
 27746 00004EE2 268B5E1D                        mov     bx,[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 27747 00004EE6 83FB02                          cmp     bx,2
 27748 00004EE9 7709                            ja	short FINDFRE
 27749                                  
 27750                                  ;   couldn't find enough free space beyond dpb_next_free, or dpb_next_free is
 27751                                  ;   <2 or >dpb_max_clus. Reset it and restart the scan
 27752                                  
 27753                                  ads1:
 27754                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],2 ; MSDOS 3.3
 27755                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2 ; MSDOS 6.0
 27756 00004EEB 26C7461D0200                    mov     word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 27757 00004EF1 BB0100                          mov     bx,1                    ; Counter next instruction so first
 27758                                                                          ;       cluster examined is 2
 27759                                  
 27760                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 27761                                  ;
 27762                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 27763                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 27764                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 27765                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file
 27766                                  
 27767                                  FINDFRE:
 27768 00004EF4 43                              INC     BX
 27769                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 27770 00004EF5 263B5E0D                        CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 27771 00004EF9 7757                    	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 27772 00004EFB E80307                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 27773 00004EFE 722F                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 27774 00004F00 75F2                            jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 27775                                  
 27776                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 27777                                  ;
 27778                                  ;       (BX) = found free cluster #
 27779                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 27780                                  
 27781                                  	;;mov	[es:bp+1Ch],bx
 27782                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 27783 00004F02 26895E1D                        mov	[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx ; next time start search here
 27784 00004F06 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 27785 00004F07 BA0100                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 27786 00004F0A E84807                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 27787 00004F0D 7220                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 27788                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 27789                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 27790 00004F0F 26837E1FFF              	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 27791 00004F14 7404                            JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 27792                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 27793                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 27794 00004F16 26FF4E1F                        DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 27795                                  NO_ALLOC:
 27796 00004F1A 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 27797 00004F1B 87DA                            XCHG    BX,DX
 27798 00004F1D 89D0                            MOV     AX,DX
 27799 00004F1F E83307                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 27800                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 27801                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 27802 00004F22 720B                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]
 27803 00004F24 93                              xchg    BX,AX           ; (BX) = last one we looked at
 27804 00004F25 89DA                            mov     dx,bx           ; (dx) = current end of file
 27805 00004F27 E2CB                            LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 27806                                  
 27807                                  ;   We've successfully extended the file. Clean up and exit
 27808                                  ;
 27809                                  ;       (BX) = last cluster in file
 27810                                  
 27811 00004F29 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 27812 00004F2C E82607                  	call	PACK            ; mark last cluster EOF
 27813                                  
 27814                                  ;   Note that FAT errors jump here to clean the stack and exit. This saves us
 27815                                  ;   2 whole bytes. Hope its worth it...
 27816                                  ;
 27817                                  ;       'C' set if error
 27818                                  ;       calling (BX) and (CX) pushed on stack
 27819                                  
 27820                                  ads4:   
 27821 00004F2F 5B                      	POP     BX
 27822 00004F30 59                              POP     CX              ; Don't need this stuff since we're successful
 27823 00004F31 729D                            jc	short figrec_retn
 27824 00004F33 E8CB06                          call	UNPACK          ; Get first cluster allocated for return
 27825                                                                  ; CAVEAT... In nul file case, UNPACKs cluster 0.
 27826 00004F36 7298                            jc	short figrec_retn
 27827 00004F38 E83200                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Restore correct cluster 0 value
 27828 00004F3B 7293                            jc	short figrec_retn
 27829 00004F3D 87DF                            XCHG    BX,DI           ; (DI) = last cluster in file upon our entry
 27830 00004F3F 09FF                            OR      DI,DI           ; clear 'C'
 27831 00004F41 758D                    	jnz	short figrec_retn ; we were extending an existing file
 27832                                  
 27833                                  ;   We were doing the first allocation for a new file. Update the SFT cluster
 27834                                  ;   info
 27835                                  dofastk:
 27836                                  	; 20/05/2019
 27837                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27838                                  	;push	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 27839                                  	;;mov	dl,[es:bp+0]
 27840                                  	;;MOV	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive #
 27841                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 27842                                  
 27843                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27844                                  	; DOSCODE:8DF9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27845                                  	
 27846                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27847                                  	;push	dx ; *
 27848                                  	;mov	dl,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] 
 27849                                  	; 15/12/2022
 27850                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 27851                                  	
 27852                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 27853 00004F43 06                      	PUSH	ES
 27854 00004F44 C43E[9E05]              	LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 27855                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Bh],bx
 27856 00004F48 26895D0B                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus],BX
 27857                                  	;;mov	[es:di+1Bh],bx ; MSDOS 3.3
 27858                                  	;mov	[es:di+35h],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 27859 00004F4C 26895D35                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_lstclus],BX
 27860 00004F50 07                      	POP	ES
 27861                                  	;retn
 27862                                  
 27863                                  	;pop	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 27864                                  
 27865                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27866                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27867                                  	;pop	dx ; *
 27868                                  
 27869 00004F51 C3                      	retn	
 27870                                  
 27871                                  ;** we're at the end of the disk, and not satisfied. See if we've scanned ALL
 27872                                  ;   of the disk...
 27873                                  
 27874                                  ads7:   
 27875 00004F52 26837E1D02              	cmp	word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 27876 00004F57 7592                    	jnz	short ads1	; start scan from front of disk
 27877                                  
 27878                                  ;   Sorry, we've gone over the whole disk, with insufficient luck. Lets give
 27879                                  ;   the space back to the free list and tell the caller how much he could have
 27880                                  ;   had.  We have to make sure we remove the "special mark" we put on the last
 27881                                  ;   cluster we were able to allocate, so it doesn't become orphaned.
 27882                                  ;
 27883                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 27884                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file (before call to ALLOCATE)
 27885                                  ;       (TOS+1) = # of clusters wanted to allocate
 27886                                  
 27887 00004F59 5B                              POP     BX              ; (BX) = last cluster of file
 27888 00004F5A BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 27889 00004F5D E81F00                  	call	RELBLKS         ; give back any clusters just alloced
 27890 00004F60 58                              POP     AX              ; No. of clusters requested
 27891                                                                  ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 27892                                                                  ;   Alloc failed, so proceed with return CX
 27893                                                                  ;   setup.
 27894 00004F61 29C8                            SUB     AX,CX           ; AX=No. of clusters allocated
 27895 00004F63 E80700                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 27896                                                                  ;   Alloc failed.
 27897                                  Disk_Full_Return:               ;label added for magic patch 8-6-92 scottq
 27898                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 27899 00004F66 C606[0B06]01            	MOV	byte [DISK_FULL],1 ;MS. indicating disk full
 27900 00004F6B F9                              STC
 27901 00004F6C C3                              retn
 27902                                  
 27903                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27904                                  ;
 27905                                  ; Procedure Name : RESTFATBYT
 27906                                  ;
 27907                                  ; SEE ALLOCATE CAVEAT
 27908                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27909                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27910                                  
 27911                                  RESTFATBYT:
 27912 00004F6D 53                              PUSH    BX
 27913 00004F6E 52                              PUSH    DX
 27914 00004F6F 57                              PUSH    DI
 27915 00004F70 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 27916 00004F72 8B16[9605]                      MOV     DX,[FATBYT]
 27917 00004F76 E8DC06                  	call	PACK
 27918 00004F79 5F                              POP     DI
 27919 00004F7A 5A                              POP     DX
 27920 00004F7B 5B                              POP     BX
 27921                                  ; 16/12/2022
 27922                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27923                                  ;RELEASE_flush:
 27924 00004F7C C3                      	retn
 27925                                  
 27926                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 27927                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27928                                  ;
 27929                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 27930                                  ;
 27931                                  ; Inputs:
 27932                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 27933                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27934                                  ; Function:
 27935                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 27936                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27937                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 27938                                  ;
 27939                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27940                                  
 27941                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27942                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27943                                  RELEASE:
 27944 00004F7D 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 27945                                  
 27946                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 27947                                  RELBLKS:
 27948                                  
 27949                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 27950                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 27951                                  
 27952 00004F7F E87F06                  	call	UNPACK
 27953 00004F82 7224                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 27954 00004F84 7422                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush
 27955 00004F86 89F8                            MOV     AX,DI
 27956 00004F88 52                              PUSH    DX
 27957 00004F89 E8C906                  	call	PACK
 27958 00004F8C 5A                              POP     DX
 27959 00004F8D 7219                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 27960 00004F8F 09D2                            OR      DX,DX
 27961 00004F91 750B                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 27962                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 27963                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 27964 00004F93 26837E1FFF              	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 27965 00004F98 7404                            JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 27966 00004F9A 26FF461F                        INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 27967                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 27968 00004F9E 89C3                            MOV     BX,AX
 27969 00004FA0 48                              dec     ax              ; check for "1"
 27970 00004FA1 7405                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 27971 00004FA3 E84406                  	call	IsEOF
 27972 00004FA6 72D5                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 27973                                  
 27974                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27975                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27976                                  ;%if 0
 27977                                  RELEASE_flush:
 27978                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27979 00004FA8 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 27980                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 27981 00004FAC 56                      	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 27982 00004FAD 51                      	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 27983 00004FAE 06                      	push	es
 27984 00004FAF 55                      	push	bp
 27985 00004FB0 E86E0B                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 27986 00004FB3 5D                      	pop	bp
 27987 00004FB4 07                      	pop	es
 27988 00004FB5 59                      	pop	cx
 27989 00004FB6 5E                      	pop	si
 27990                                  ;%endif
 27991                                  RET12:
 27992 00004FB7 C3                      	retn
 27993                                  
 27994                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 27995                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27996                                  ;
 27997                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 27998                                  ;
 27999                                  ; Inputs:
 28000                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 28001                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 28002                                  ;       DS = CS
 28003                                  ; Outputs:
 28004                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 28005                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28006                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 28007                                  ;
 28008                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28009                                  
 28010                                  GETEOF:
 28011 00004FB8 E84606                  	call	UNPACK
 28012 00004FBB 72FA                            jc	short RET12
 28013 00004FBD 53                              PUSH    BX
 28014 00004FBE 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 28015 00004FC0 E82706                  	call	IsEOF
 28016 00004FC3 5B                              POP     BX
 28017 00004FC4 73F1                            JAE     short RET12
 28018 00004FC6 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 28019 00004FC8 EBEE                            JMP     short GETEOF

 28027                                  ;	TITLE	FCB - FCB parse calls for MSDOS
 28028                                  ;	NAME	FCB
 28029                                  
 28030                                  ;**	FCB.ASM - Low level routines for parsing names into FCBs and analyzing
 28031                                  ;		  filename characters
 28032                                  ;
 28033                                  ;	MakeFcb
 28034                                  ;	NameTrans
 28035                                  ;	PATHCHRCMP
 28036                                  ;	GetLet
 28037                                  ;	UCase
 28038                                  ;	GetLet3
 28039                                  ;	GetCharType
 28040                                  ;	TESTKANJ
 28041                                  ;	NORMSCAN
 28042                                  ;	DELIM
 28043                                  ;
 28044                                  ;	Revision history:
 28045                                  ;
 28046                                  ;		A000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 28047                                  ;	
 28048                                  ;	M048 - access FILE_UCASE_TAB using DS rather than SS.
 28049                                  
 28050                                  TableLook	EQU	-1
 28051                                  
 28052                                  SCANSEPARATOR	EQU	1
 28053                                  DRVBIT		EQU	2
 28054                                  NAMBIT		EQU	4
 28055                                  EXTBIT		EQU	8
 28056                                  
 28057                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28058                                  ;
 28059                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 28060                                  ;
 28061                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28062                                  
 28063                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28064                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28065                                  MAKEFCB:
 28066                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28067 00004FCA 36C606[4E03]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 28068 00004FD0 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 28069                                  	;test	al,2
 28070 00004FD2 A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 28071 00004FD4 7504                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 28072 00004FD6 26C60500                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 28073                                  DEFDRV:
 28074 00004FDA 47                      	INC	DI
 28075 00004FDB B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 28076                                  	;test	al,4
 28077 00004FDE A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 28078 00004FE0 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 28079 00004FE1 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 28080 00004FE3 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 28081 00004FE5 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 28082 00004FE7 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 28083                                  FILLB:
 28084 00004FE9 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28085 00004FEB B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 28086 00004FED F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 28087 00004FF0 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 28088 00004FF2 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 28089 00004FF4 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 28090                                  FILLB2:
 28091 00004FF6 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28092 00004FF8 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 28093 00004FF9 AB                      	STOSW
 28094 00004FFA AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 28095 00004FFB 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 28096                                  	;test	bl,1
 28097 00004FFE F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 28098 00005001 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC

 28223                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28224                                  ;
 28225                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 28226                                  ;
 28227                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 28228                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 28229                                  ;
 28230                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 28231                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 28232                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 28233                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 28234                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 28235                                  ;
 28236                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28237                                  
 28238                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28239                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28240                                  NameTrans:
 28241                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28242 0000509B 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 28243 000050A1 16                      	push	ss
 28244 000050A2 07                      	pop	es
 28245                                  
 28246                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 28247 000050A3 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28248 000050A6 57                      	PUSH	DI
 28249 000050A7 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  '
 28250 000050AA B90500                  	MOV	CX,5
 28251 000050AD AA                      	STOSB
 28252 000050AE F3AB                    	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 28253 000050B0 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 28254 000050B2 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 28255 000050B4 AA                      	STOSB
 28256 000050B5 5F                      	POP	DI
 28257                                  
 28258 000050B6 E87BFF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 28259                                  
 28260                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 28261 000050B9 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 28262 000050BF 75D9                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 28263 000050C1 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 28264 000050C7 C3                      	retn

 28273                                  
 28274                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 28275                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 28276                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28277                                  
 28278                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 28279                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 28280                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 28281                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 28282                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 28283                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 28284                                  
 28285                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 28286                                  ;CharType:
 28287                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28288                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 28289                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28290                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 28291                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28292                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 28293                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28294                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 28295                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28296                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 28297                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28298                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 28299                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28300                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 28301                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28302                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 28303                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28304                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 28305                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28306                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 28307                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28308                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 28309                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28310                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 28311                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28312                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 28313                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28314                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28316                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 28317                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28318                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 28319                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 28320                                  ;	      ; # and "
 28321                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 28322                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 28323                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 28324                                  ;	      ; + and *
 28325                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 28326                                  ;	      ; - and '
 28327                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 28328                                  ;	      ; / and .
 28329                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28330                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 28331                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 28332                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 28333                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 28334                                  ;	      ; = and <
 28335                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 28336                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 28337                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 28338                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 28339                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 28340                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 28341                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 28342                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 28343                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28344                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 28345                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 28346                                  ;	      ; } and |
 28347                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 28348                                  
 28349                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 28350                                  ;					; character in the table

 28416                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28417                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28418                                  
 28419                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28420                                  ;
 28421                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 28422                                  ;
 28423                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 28424                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 28425                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 28426                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 28427                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 28428                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 28429                                  ;
 28430                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 28431                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 28432                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 28433                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 28434                                  ;
 28435                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 28436                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 28437                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 28438                                  ;
 28439                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28440                                  
 28441                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 28442                                  
 28443                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 28444                                  GETLET:	
 28445 00005107 AC                      	LODSB
 28446                                  
 28447                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 28448                                  
 28449                                  	;entry	UCase
 28450                                  UCase:	
 28451                                  	; 09/08/2018
 28452                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 28453                                  _UCase:
 28454 00005108 53                      	PUSH	BX
 28455 00005109 BB[310B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 28456                                  
 28457                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 28458                                  
 28459                                  gl_0:
 28460 0000510C 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 28461 0000510E 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 28462 00005110 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 28463 00005112 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 28464 00005114 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 28465                                  
 28466                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 28467                                  
 28468                                  gl_1:
 28469 00005116 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 28470 00005118 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 28471 0000511A 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 28472                                  
 28473                                  	; M048 - Start 
 28474                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 28475                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 28476                                  	; preserve it.
 28477                                  
 28478                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28479                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28480                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 28481                                  	;CS	XLAT
 28482                                  
 28483                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28484                                  
 28485                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28486 0000511C 1E                      	push	ds
 28487                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 28488 0000511D 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 28489 00005122 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 28490 00005123 1F                      	pop	ds
 28491                                  
 28492                                  	; M048 - End
 28493                                  
 28494                                  ; Now check the type
 28495                                  
 28496                                  ;If TableLook
 28497                                  gl_2:
 28498                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28499 00005124 50                      	PUSH	AX
 28500                                  
 28501                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28502                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 28503                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 28504                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 28505                                  	;cs	xlat	
 28506                                  	
 28507                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28508 00005125 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 28509                                  	
 28510                                  	;test	al,1	
 28511 00005128 A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character

 28628                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28629                                  ;
 28630                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 28631                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 28632                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 28633                                  ;
 28634                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 28635                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 28636                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 28637                                  ;
 28638                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28639                                  
 28640                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28641                                  
 28642                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28643                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28644                                  GetCharType:
 28645                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 28646 00005140 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 28647 00005142 7316                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 28648                                  
 28649 00005144 53                      	push	bx
 28650 00005145 BB[C850]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 28651 00005148 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 28652                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 28653 0000514A 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 28654 0000514C 5B                      	pop	bx
 28655                                  
 28656                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 28657                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 28658                                  
 28659 0000514D 7308                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 28660                                  
 28661 0000514F D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 28662 00005151 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 28663 00005153 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 28664 00005155 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 28665                                  gct_80:
 28666 00005157 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 28667 00005159 C3                      	retn
 28668                                  gct_90:
 28669 0000515A B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 28670 0000515C C3                      	retn

 28685 00005166 C3                      	retn

 28688 00005169 C3                      	retn
