 28698                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 28699                                  
 28700                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 28701                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 28702                                  
 28703                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 28704                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 28705                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 28706                                  ;
 28707                                  ;	FATAL
 28708                                  ;	FATAL1
 28709                                  ;	reset_environment
 28710                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK
 28711                                  ;	SPOOLINT
 28712                                  ;	STATCHK
 28713                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 28714                                  ;	DIVOV
 28715                                  ;	CHARHARD
 28716                                  ;	HardErr
 28717                                  ;
 28718                                  ;	Revision history:
 28719                                  ;
 28720                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 28721                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 28722                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 28723                                  ;
 28724                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 28725                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 28726                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 28727                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 28728                                  ;
 28729                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 28730                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 28731                                  ;	      charhard.
 28732

 29066                                  	; !! NOTE: FALL THROUGH !!
 29067                                  
 29068                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29069                                  ;
 29070                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 29071                                  ;
 29072                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 29073                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 29074                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 29075                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 29076                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 29077                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 29078                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 29079                                  ; is simulated.
 29080                                  ;
 29081                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29082                                  
 29083                                  CNTCHAND:
 29084                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 29085                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 29086                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 29087                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 29088                                  
 29089                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29090 000052B5 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 29091 000052BB 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 29092                                  
 29093 000052BD B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 29094 000052BF E8B5C4                          CALL	BUFOUT
 29095 000052C2 E850C3                          CALL	CRLF
 29096                                  around_deadlock:
 29097 000052C5 16                              PUSH    SS
 29098 000052C6 1F                              POP     DS
 29099 000052C7 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 29100 000052CC 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 29101 000052CE E868E0                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 29102                                  NOSWAP:
 29103 000052D1 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 29104 000052D2 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 29105 000052D6 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 29106 000052DA E8B7B1                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 29107                                  
 29108                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 29109                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 29110                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 29111                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 29112                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 29113                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 29114                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 29115                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 29116                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 29117                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 29118                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 29119                                  			; else
 29120                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 29121                                  
 29122                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29123                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 29124                                  
 29125                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 29126                                  	
 29127 000052DD 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 29128                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 29129 000052DE 1E                      	push	ds
 29130                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 29131 000052DF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 29132 000052E4 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 29133 000052E9 C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 29134 000052EE 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 29135                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 29136 000052F2 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 29137                                  
 29138 000052F7 803E[1112]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 29139 000052FC 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 29140 000052FD 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 29141 000052FF F8                      	CLC				
 29142 00005300 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 29143 00005302 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 29144                                  
 29145                                  	; 05/05/2019
 29146                                  do_low_int23:
 29147 00005304 F8                      	clc
 29148 00005305 2EFF1E[6A51]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]	
 29149                                  
 29150                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 29151                                  
 29152                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 29153                                  
 29154                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 29155                                  ;
 29156                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 29157                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 29158                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 29159                                  ;
 29160                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 29161                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 29162                                  
 29163                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 29164                                  
 29165 0000530A FA                      	CLI
 29166                                  
 29167                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 29168                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 29169                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 29170                                  	;POP	AX
 29171                                  
 29172                                  	; 05/05/2019
 29173                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29174                                  
 29175                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 29176                                  
 29177 0000530B 50                      	push	ax
 29178 0000530C 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 29179                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 29180 0000530E 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 29181 00005313 A3[0A0D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 29182 00005316 58                      	pop	ax
 29183 00005317 A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 29184 0000531A 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 29185 0000531B 58                      	pop	ax
 29186                                  
 29187                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 29188                                  
 29189                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29190                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 29191                                  	;JNZ     SHORT ctrlc_try_new ; current SP not the same as saved SP
 29192

 29195 00005320 750A                    	JNZ     SHORT ctrlc_try_new ; current SP not the same as saved SP
 29196                                  
 29197                                  ; Repeat the operation by redispatching the system call.
 29198                                  
 29199                                  ctrlc_repeat:
 29200                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29201                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]
 29202                                  	; 05/05/2019
 29203                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 29206                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0 
 29207                                  	;transfer COMMAND
 29208                                  COMMANDJ:
 29209 00005329 E91BB0                  	JMP	COMMAND
 29210                                  
 29211                                  ; The current SP is NOT the same as the input SP. Presume that he 
 29212                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input
 29213                                  
 29214                                  ctrlc_try_new:
 29215 0000532C 83C402                  	ADD	SP,2			; pop those flags
 29216                                  	;;test	ax,1
 29217                                  	;TEST	AX,f_Carry		; did he return with carry?
 29218 0000532F A801                    	test	al,f_Carry ; test al,1
 29219 00005331 74EF                    	JZ	short ctrlc_repeat	; no carry set, just retry
 29220                                  
 29221                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29222 00005333 8E1E[0A0D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds
 29223                                  
 29224                                  	; Well...  time to abort the user.  
 29225                                  	; Signal a ^C exit and use the EXIT system call..
 29226                                  
 29227                                  ctrlc_abort:
 29228                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29229                                          ;;MOV	AX,(EXIT SHL 8) + 0

 29235

 29237                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 29239 0000533A 1E                      	push	ds
 29240                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 29241 0000533B 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]

 29245 00005346 EBE1                    	JMP	SHORT COMMANDJ

 29420                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29421                                  ;
 29422                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 29423                                  ;
 29424                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 29425                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 29426                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 29427                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 29428                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 29429                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 29430                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 29431                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 29432                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 29433                                  ; Output:
 29434                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 29435                                  ;
 29436                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29437                                  
 29438                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29439                                  HARDERR:
 29440                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29441                                  	; 30/07/2018
 29442                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 29444                                          ;and	di,0FFh
 29445 000053C8 81E7FF00                	AND     DI,STECODE              ; And off status bits
 29446                                          ;CMP	DI,WRECODE		; Write Protect Error?
 29447                                  	;cmp	di,0
 29448 000053CC 83FF00                  	cmp	DI,error_I24_write_protect ; Write Protect Error?
 29449 000053CF 750A                            JNZ     short NOSETWRPERR
 29450 000053D1 50                              PUSH    AX
 29451                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 29453                                          ;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]

 29456                                          	; 15/03/2018

 29477                                  		 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 29478                                  	;mov	word [ES:BP+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 29479                                  	;mov	word [ES:BP+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0 - 05/05/2019

 29493                                  					; SS override for allowed and EXITHOLD
 29494 00005410 360A26[4B03]            	OR	AH,[SS:ALLOWED]		; Set the allowed_ bits
 29495

 29497                                  FATAL:
 29498                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 29505                                  FATAL1:  
 29506                                  	; 15/03/2018      
 29507 00005419 368C06[8205]            	MOV     [SS:EXITHOLD+2],ES
 29508 0000541E 36892E[8005]                    MOV     [SS:EXITHOLD],BP	; The only things we preserve	
 29509                                  	;LES	SI,[ES:BP+12H] ; MSDOS 3.3

 29512 00005427 8CC5                            MOV     BP,ES                   ; BP:SI points to the device involved
 29513                                  
 29514                                  	; DI has the INT-24-style extended error. We now map the error code 
 29515                                  	; for this into the normalized get extended error set by using the 
 29516                                  	; ErrMap24 table as a translate table. Note that we translate ONLY 
 29517                                  	; the device returned codes and leave all others beyond the look up 
 29518                                  	; table alone.
 29519                                  
 29520                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29521                                  FATALC:
 29522 00005429 E89701                  	call	SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 29523                                  	;cmp	di,0Ch
 29524 0000542C 83FF0C                  	CMP	DI,error_I24_gen_failure
 29525 0000542F 7603                    	JBE	short GOT_RIGHT_CODE	; Error codes above gen_failure get
 29526 00005431 BF0C00                  	MOV	DI,error_I24_gen_failure; mapped to gen_failure. Real codes
 29527                                  					;  Only come via GetExtendedError
 29528                                  ;** ----------------------------------------------------------------
 29529                                  ;
 29530                                  ; Entry point used by REDIRector on Network I 24 errors.
 29531                                  ;
 29532                                  ;	ASSUME	DS:NOTHING,ES:NOTHING,SS:DOSDATA
 29533                                  ;
 29534                                  ; ALL I 24 regs set up. ALL Extended error info SET. ALLOWED Set.
 29535                                  ;     EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.
 29536                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------
 29537                                  	;entry	NET_I24_ENTRY
 29538                                  NET_I24_ENTRY:
 29539                                  GOT_RIGHT_CODE:
 29540 00005434 36803E[2003]00          	CMP     BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; No INT 24s if already INT 24
 29541 0000543A 7404                            JZ	SHORT NoSetFail

 29543 0000543E EB6C                    	JMP	short FailRet
 29544                                  NoSetFail:
 29545 00005440 368926[8805]                    MOV     [SS:CONTSTK],SP		; SS override
 29546 00005445 16                              PUSH	SS
 29547 00005446 07                              POP	ES
 29548                                      
 29549                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 29550                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may 
 29551                                  	; NEVER return to us. Thus,we need to free it here and then 
 29552                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.
 29553

 29565                                  					; Prepare to play with stack
 29566 0000545C 36FE06[2003]                    INC     BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE]	; Flag INT 24 in progress
 29567 00005461 36FE0E[2103]                    DEC     BYTE [SS:INDOS]		; INT 24 handler might not return
 29568                                  
 29569                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSDOS 6.21)
 29570                                  
 29571                                  	;; Extended Open hooks
 29572                                  					; AN000;IFS.I24 error disabled
 29573                                  	;test	byte [ss:EXTOPEN_ON],2
 29574 00005466 36F606[F605]02          	TEST	byte [ss:EXTOPEN_ON],EXT_OPEN_I24_OFF 
 29575 0000546C 7404                    	JZ	short i24yes		; AN000;IFS.no
 29576                                  faili24:				; AN000;

 29584

 29586                                          ;IN	int_fatal_abort		; Fatal error interrupt vector,
 29587                                  					; must preserve ES

 29590 00005482 7504                    	jne	short do_low_int24	; Y: the int must be done from low mem

 29592                                  					; must preserve ES
 29593 00005486 EB05                    	jmp	short criterr_ret_addr
 29594                                  
 29595                                  do_low_int24:
 29596                                  	; 05/05/2019
 29597                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29598 00005488 2EFF1E[6E51]            	call    far [cs:LowInt24Addr]
 29599                                  criterr_ret_addr:
 29600 0000548D 268926[8405]                    MOV     [ES:USER_SP],SP         ; restore our stack
 29601 00005492 268C16[8605]                    MOV     [ES:USER_SS],SS
 29602 00005497 8CC5                            MOV     BP,ES

 29604                                  passi24:
 29605 0000549B 368B26[8805]                    MOV     SP,[SS:CONTSTK]
 29606 000054A0 36FE06[2103]                    INC     BYTE [SS:INDOS]		; Back in the DOS

 29608 000054AB FB                              STI
 29609                                  FailRet:
 29610 000054AC 36C42E[8005]                    LES     BP,[SS:EXITHOLD]
 29611                                  	
 29612                                  	; 08/07/2018
 29613                                  
 29614                                  	; Triage the user's reply.
 29615                                  
 29616 000054B1 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1
 29617 000054B3 723D                    	JB	short CheckIgnore	; 0 => ignore

 29623                                  
 29624                                  				; SS override for ALLOWED, EXTOPEN_ON,

 29638                                  CleanUp:

 29640 000054D8 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1

 29642                                  	;jnz	short CleanUp2
 29643                                  	;retn
 29644                                  	; 17/12/2022
 29645 000054DE 7411                    	jz	short Cleanup_retn ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29646                                  CleanUp2:
 29647 000054E0 1E                      	push	ds
 29648 000054E1 56                      	push	si
 29649 000054E2 50                      	push	ax
 29650 000054E3 36A1[AA05]              	MOV	AX,[ss:SFN]

 29654 000054EF 5E                      	pop	si
 29655 000054F0 1F                      	pop	ds
 29656                                  Cleanup_retn:

 29658                                  
 29659                                  	; The reply was IGNORE. See if we are allowed to ignore.
 29660                                  
 29661                                  CheckIgnore:
 29662                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],20h
 29663 000054F2 36F606[4B03]20          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_IGNORE ; Can we?
 29664 000054F8 74C9                    	jz	short DoFail			 ; No, do fail
 29665 000054FA EBD6                    	jmp	short CleanUp
 29666                                  
 29667                                  	; The reply was RETRY. See if we are allowed to retry.
 29668                                  
 29669                                  CheckRetry:
 29670                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],10h
 29671 000054FC 36F606[4B03]10          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY	; Can we?
 29672 00005502 74BF                    	jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 29673 00005504 EBCC                    	JMP	short CleanUp
 29674                                  
 29675                                  	; The reply was ABORT.
 29676                                  DoAbort:
 29677 00005506 16                      	push	ss
 29678 00005507 1F                      	pop	ds
 29679                                  
 29680 00005508 803E[5703]00            	CMP	byte [CONSWAP],0
 29681 0000550D 7403                    	JZ	short NOSWAP2
 29682 0000550F E827DE                  	call	SWAPBACK
 29683                                  NOSWAP2:
 29684                                  	; See if we are to truly abort. If we are in the process of aborting, 
 29685                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.
 29686                                  
 29687                                  	;test	[fAborting],0FFh
 29688                                  	;jnz	short DoFail

 29693                                  	; Set return code
 29694                                  
 29695 00005519 C606[7C05]02            	MOV	BYTE [EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_HARD_ERROR ; 2
 29696 0000551E 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 29697                                  
 29698                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 29699                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 29700                                  
 29701 00005520 E9990D                  	jmp	exit_inner
 29702                                  
 29703                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29704                                  ;
 29705                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 29706                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 29707                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 29708                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 29709                                  ;
 29710                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 29711                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 29712                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 29713                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 29714                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 29715                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 29716                                  ;
 29717                                  ; output:   none.
 29718                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29719                                  
 29720                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 29721                                  	
 29722                                  reset_environment:
 29723                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29724                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 29725                                  
 29726                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 29727                                  
 29728 00005523 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 29729                                  
 29730                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter 
 29731                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 29732                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 29733                                  
 29734 00005524 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 29735                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 29736                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 29737 00005526 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 29738                                  
 29739                                  					; SS override
 29740 00005528 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 29741                                  
 29742                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 29743                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 29744                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 29745                                  					; On process exit.
 29746 0000552E B82211                  	mov     ax, 1122h
 29747 00005531 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 29748                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 29749                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 29750 00005533 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 29751 00005535 E8CCB9                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 29752                                  
 29753 00005538 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 29754 00005539 06                      	push	es
 29755 0000553A 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 29756                                  
 29757 0000553B 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 29758 00005540 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX

 29760                                  
 29761                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 29762                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper 
 29763                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 29764

 29768 0000554B 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB

 29770                                  
 29771                                  					; SS override
 29772                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3

 29774 00005554 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 29775                                  
 29776                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks 
 29777                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 29778                                  
 29779                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process

 29781                                  
 29782                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal 
 29783                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that 
 29784                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 29785

 29790                                  					; SS override

 29792                                  
 29793                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 29794                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA  
 29795 00005561 16                      	push	ss
 29796 00005562 1F                      	pop	ds	
 29797                                  
 29798 00005563 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 29799                                  
 29800                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors, 
 29801                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 29802

 29804 00005565 E820BE                  	call	ECritDisk

 29809

 29811

 29814 00005572 C606[2103]00            	MOV	BYTE [INDOS],0		; Go to known state

 29826 00005595 E8FCAE                  	call	restore_world
 29827                                  
 29828                                  	; 05/05/2019
 29829 00005598 07                      	pop	es ; * ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:94A8h, MSDOS.SYS)
 29830                                  
 29831                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29832 00005599 50                      	push	ax			; set up ds, but save ds in TEMPSEG

 29875 000055C2 CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address

 29877                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29878                                  ;
 29879                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 29880                                  ;
 29881                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 29882                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 29883                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 29884                                  ;
 29885                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29886                                  
 29887                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 29888 000055C3 50                      	PUSH	AX
 29889                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 29890 000055C4 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 29891 000055C7 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 29892                                  					; Change to dosdata to access 
 29893                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 29894                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29895

 29897 000055CA 1E                      	push	ds
 29898                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 29899 000055CB 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 29900                                  
 29901                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate 
 29902                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 29903                                  
 29904 000055D0 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX

 29909 000055D6 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0

 29919                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.

 29931                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29932                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29933                                  
 29934                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 29935                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 29936                                  
 29937                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 29938                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29939                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 29940                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 29941                                  ;
 29942                                  ;	IsEof
 29943                                  ;	UNPACK
 29944                                  ;	PACK
 29945                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 29946                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 29947                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 29948                                  ;	FAT_operation
 29949                                  ;
 29950                                  ;	Revision history:
 29951                                  ;
 29952                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 29953                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 29954                                  ;
 29955                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 29956                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 29957                                  
 29958                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29959                                  
 29960                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 29961                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29962                                  ;
 29963                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 29964                                  ;
 29965                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 29966                                  ;
 29967                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 29968                                  ;		BX has fat value
 29969                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 29970                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 29971                                  ;
 29972                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29973                                  
 29974                                  IsEOF:
 29975                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 29976 000055EA 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 29977 000055F0 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 29978                                  
 29979                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 29980                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 29981                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 29982                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 29983                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 29984                                  
 29985 000055F2 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 29986 000055F6 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 29987                                  
 29988 000055F8 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 29989                                  IsEOF_other:
 29990 000055FC C3                      	retn
 29991                                  EOF16:
 29992 000055FD 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 29993 00005600 C3                      	retn
 29994                                  
 29995                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29996                                  
 29997                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 29998                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29999                                  ;
 30000                                  ; Procedur Name : UNPACK
 30001                                  ;
 30002                                  ; Inputs:
 30003                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 30004                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 30005                                  ; Outputs:
 30006                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 30007                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 30008                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30009                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 30010                                  ;
 30011                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 30012                                  ;
 30013                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30014                                  	
 30015                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30016                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30017                                  
 30018                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30019                                  UNPACK:
 30020                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 30021 00005601 09DB                    	or	bx, bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 30022 00005603 7507                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 30023 00005605 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 30024 00005609 09FF                    	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 30025 0000560B C3                      	retn				; done
 30026                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 30027                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30028                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 30029 0000560C 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 30030 00005610 7726                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 30031 00005612 E8DC00                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 30032 00005615 721E                    	jc	short _DoContext
 30033 00005617 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 30034 00005619 750E                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 30035 0000561B 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 30036 0000561F 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10
 30037 00005623 720C                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 30038 00005625 09FF                    	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 30039 00005627 EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 30040                                  High12:
 30041 00005629 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30042 0000562B D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30043 0000562D D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30044 0000562F D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30045                                  Unpack12:
 30046 00005631 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 30047                                  _DoContext:
 30048 00005635 16                      	PUSH	SS
 30049 00005636 1F                      	POP	DS
 30050 00005637 C3                      	retn
 30051                                  HURTFAT:
 30052                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 30053                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 30054 00005638 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 30055 0000563E 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30056 0000563F B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 30057                                  
 30058                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30059 00005641 36C606[4B03]08          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 30060                                  ;
 30061                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 30062                                  ;
 30063 00005647 BFFF0F                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 30064 0000564A E8C8FD                  	call	FATAL
 30065 0000564D 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 30066 0000564F F8                      	CLC
 30067 00005650 7501                    	JNZ	short OKU_RET 		; Try to ignore bad FAT
 30068 00005652 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 30069                                  OKU_RET:
 30070 00005653 58                      	POP	AX
 30071                                  hurtfat_retn:
 30072 00005654 C3                      	retn
 30073                                  
 30074                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30075                                  
 30076                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 30077                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30078                                  ;
 30079                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 30080                                  ;
 30081                                  ; Inputs:
 30082                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 30083                                  ;	DX = Data
 30084                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 30085                                  ; Outputs:
 30086                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 30087                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 30088                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30089                                  ;	No other registers affected
 30090                                  ;
 30091                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 30092                                  ;
 30093                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30094                                  
 30095                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30096                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30097                                  PACK:
 30098                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 30099 00005655 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 30100 00005657 7505                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 30101 00005659 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 30102 0000565D C3                      	retn				; done
 30103                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 30104                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30105 0000565E E89000                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 30106 00005661 72D2                    	JC	short _DoContext
 30107 00005663 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 30108 00005665 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 30109 00005667 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 30110 00005668 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 30111 0000566A D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 30112 0000566C 59                      	POP	CX
 30113 0000566D 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 30114 00005670 EB14                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 30115                                  ALIGNED:
 30116                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 30117 00005672 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 30118 00005678 730A                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 30119 0000567A 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 30120 0000567E 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 30121 00005682 EB02                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN		; MZ go store
 30122                                  Pack16:
 30123 00005684 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI			; MZ no original data
 30124                                  PACKIN:
 30125 00005686 09D6                    	OR	SI,DX
 30126 00005688 8935                    	MOV	[DI],SI
 30127                                  
 30128                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30129 0000568A 36C536[E205]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CURBUF]
 30130                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30131 0000568F F6440540                	TEST	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30132                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 30133 00005693 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty11	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 30134                                  	; 10/06/2019
 30135 00005695 E89105                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 30136                                  	
 30137                                  	;or	byte [si+5],40h
 30138 00005698 804C0540                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30139                                  yesdirty11:				;LB.				;AN000;
 30140                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30141 0000569C 36803E[7805]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:CLUSSPLIT],0	; 15/08/2018
 30142                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30143 000056A2 16                      	push	ss
 30144 000056A3 1F                      	pop	ds
 30145 000056A4 74AE                    	jz	short hurtfat_retn	; Carry clear
 30146 000056A6 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30147 000056A7 53                      	PUSH	BX
 30148 000056A8 51                      	PUSH	CX
 30149 000056A9 A1[8E05]                	MOV	AX,[CLUSSAVE]
 30150 000056AC 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 30151                                  	;;add	si,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 30152                                  	;add	si,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30153 000056B0 83C614                  	ADD	SI,BUFINSIZ
 30154 000056B3 8824                    	MOV	[SI],AH
 30155                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30156                                  	;Context DS
 30157 000056B5 16                      	push	ss
 30158 000056B6 1F                      	pop	ds
 30159                                  	
 30160 000056B7 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30161                                  	
 30162                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30163 000056B8 8B16[9205]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC+2]		;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 30164 000056BC 8916[0706]              	MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 30165                                  
 30166                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30167 000056C0 8B16[9005]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC]
 30168 000056C4 BE0100                  	MOV	SI,1
 30169 000056C7 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 30170 000056C9 E85903                  	call	GETBUFFRB
 30171 000056CC 58                      	POP	AX
 30172 000056CD 721C                    	JC	short POPP_RET
 30173 000056CF C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]

 30177                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;

 30183                                  yesdirty12:

 30185                                  	;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30186 000056E0 83C714                  	ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 30187 000056E3 4F                      	DEC	DI

 30200                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30201                                  
 30202                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 30203                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30204                                  ;
 30205                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 30206                                  ;
 30207                                  ; Inputs:
 30208                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 30209                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 30210                                  ; Function:
 30211                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 30212                                  ; Outputs:
 30213                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 30214                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 30215                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 30216                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 30217                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 30218                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 30219                                  ;
 30220                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30221                                  
 30222                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30223                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30224                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30225                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30226                                  
 30227                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 30228                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 30229 000056F1 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 30230                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 30231 000056F6 50                      	push	ax
 30232 000056F7 53                      	push	bx
 30233 000056F8 51                      	push	cx
 30234 000056F9 52                      	push	dx
 30235 000056FA 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 30236 000056FC 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 30237 00005702 7302                    	JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 30238 00005704 D1E8                    	SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 30239                                  Map16:	
 30240                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 30241 00005706 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 30242                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30243 00005708 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 30244 0000570A 11FF                    	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 30245 0000570C 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 30246                                  
 30247                                  ;IF FastDiv
 30248                                  ;
 30249                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 30250                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 30251                                  ;
 30252                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 30253                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 30254                                  ;
 30255                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 30256                                  
 30257 00005710 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 30258 00005714 7510                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 30259 00005716 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 30260 00005718 81E2FF01                	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 30261 0000571C 88E0                    	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 30262                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 30263                                  	;shr	al,1	
 30264                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 30265 0000571E D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; 2
 30266 00005720 D0D8                    	rcr	al,1			; 2
 30267                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30268 00005722 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 30269 00005724 EB04                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 30270                                  _DoDiv:
 30271                                  ;ENDIF
 30272                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30273                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 30274                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30275 00005726 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			; 2
 30276                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 30277 00005728 F7F1                    	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 30278                                  ;IF FastDiv
 30279                                  DivDone:
 30280                                  ;ENDIF
 30281                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 30282 0000572A 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 30283 0000572E 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 30284                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 30285 0000572F 50                      	push	ax
 30286 00005730 52                      	push	dx
 30287 00005731 51                      	push	cx
 30288 00005732 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 30289                                  
 30290                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30291 00005734 C706[0706]0000          	MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 	;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 30292                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30293 0000573A 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 30294 0000573C BE0100                  	MOV	SI,1
 30295                                  	;invoke	GETBUFFRB
 30296 0000573F E8E302                  	call	GETBUFFRB
 30297                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 30298 00005742 59                      	pop	cx
 30299 00005743 58                      	pop	ax
 30300 00005744 5A                      	pop	dx
 30301 00005745 7257                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 30302                                  
 30303 00005747 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 30304                                  	;;lea	di,[si+16]
 30305                                  	;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30306 0000574B 8D7C14                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 30307 0000574E 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 30308 00005750 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 30309 00005752 7537                    	JNZ	short MAPRET
 30310 00005754 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 30311                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30312 00005756 16                      	push	ss
 30313 00005757 1F                      	pop	ds	
 30314 00005758 FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 30315 0000575C A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 30316 0000575F 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 30317                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30318 00005763 C706[9205]0000          	MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 30319 00005769 42                      	INC	DX
 30320 0000576A C706[0706]0000          	MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0	;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 30321                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30322 00005770 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 30323 00005772 BE0100                  	MOV	SI,1
 30324                                  	;invoke	GETBUFFRB
 30325 00005775 E8AD02                  	call	GETBUFFRB
 30326 00005778 7224                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 30327 0000577A C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 30328 0000577E 8D7C14                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 30329 00005781 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 30330                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30331 00005783 16                      	push	ss
 30332 00005784 1F                      	pop	ds
 30333 00005785 A2[8F05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE+1],AL
 30334                                  
 30335                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 30336 00005788 BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 30337                                  MAPRET:
 30338                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 30339 0000578B 5A                      	pop	dx
 30340 0000578C 59                      	pop	cx
 30341 0000578D 5B                      	pop	bx
 30342 0000578E 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 30343 00005790 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 30344 00005796 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 30345 00005798 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 30346                                  MapSet:
 30347 0000579A A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; set zero flag if not on boundary
 30348                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 30349 0000579C 58                      	pop	ax
 30350 0000579D C3                      	retn
 30351                                  
 30352                                  MAP_POP:
 30353                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 30354 0000579E 5A                      	pop	dx
 30355 0000579F 59                      	pop	cx
 30356 000057A0 5B                      	pop	bx
 30357 000057A1 58                      	pop	ax
 30358                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 30359 000057A2 C3                      	retn

 30361                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30362                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30363                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30364                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
