 30366                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 30367                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30368                                  ;
 30369                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 30370                                  ;
 30371                                  ; Inputs:
 30372                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of intrest (local only,
 30373                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 30374                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 30375                                  ; Function:
 30376                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 30377                                  ;	if disk changed.
 30378                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 30379                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 30380                                  ; Outputs:
 30381                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30382                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 30383                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 30384                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 30385                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 30386                                  ;
 30387                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30388                                  
 30389                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 30390 000057A3 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 30391                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30392                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 30393                                  	; 15/12/2022
 30394 000057A7 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 30395 000057AB A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 30396 000057AE E8CAAE                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 30397                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 30398                                  	; 17/12/2022
 30399 000057B1 EB78                    	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 30400                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 30401                                  	;retn
 30402                                  
 30403                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30404                                  ;
 30405                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 30406                                  ;
 30407                                  ; Inputs:
 30408                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 30409                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of intrest (local only,
 30410                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 30411                                  ; Function:
 30412                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 30413                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 30414                                  ; Outputs:
 30415                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 30416                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 30417                                  ;	THISDRV set
 30418                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30419                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 30420                                  ;
 30421                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30422                                  
 30423                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30424                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30425                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30426                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30427                                  
 30428                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 30429 000057B3 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30430 000057B4 57                      	PUSH	DI
 30431                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 30432 000057B5 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 30433                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30434                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 30435                                  	; 15/12/2022
 30436 000057B9 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 30437 000057BD A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 30438 000057C0 E8B8AE                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 30439 000057C3 E86500                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 30440 000057C6 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 30441 000057C7 07                      	POP	ES
 30442 000057C8 72D8                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 30443 000057CA 7538                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 30444                                  
 30445                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 30446                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 30447                                  
 30448                                  MED_CHANGE:
 30449 000057CC 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 30450 000057CE 48                      	DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 30451 000057CF 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 30452 000057D0 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 30453 000057D4 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 30454                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 30455 000057D6 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 30456                                  
 30457                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30458                                  
 30459                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 30460                                  ;
 30461                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 30462                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 30463                                  
 30464 000057DA 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 30465                                  frcd20: 
 30466                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 30467                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 30468 000057DF 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 30469 000057E4 7518                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 30470                                  
 30471                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30472                                  	;push	es
 30473                                  	;push	di
 30474                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 30475                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 30476                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 30477                                  	;pop	di
 30478                                  	;pop	es
 30479                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 30480                                  
 30481                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30482 000057E6 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 30483 000057EA 7512                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 30484 000057EC 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 30485 000057EE 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 30486 000057F2 750A                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 30487                                  
 30488                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30489                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax
 30490 000057F4 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 30491 000057F8 7404                    	JZ	short frcd25		; If root (0), leave root
 30492                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 30493 000057FA 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 30494                                  frcd25:	
 30495                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 30496                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 30497 000057FE 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 30498 00005801 E2DC                    	LOOP	frcd20
 30499 00005803 1F                      	POP	DS
 30500                                  NO_CHANGE:
 30501 00005804 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 30502 00005808 F8                      	CLC
 30503 00005809 C3                      	retn
 30504                                  
 30505                                  ;Break	<Fat_Operation - miscellaneous fat stuff>
 30506                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30507                                  ;
 30508                                  ; Procedure Name : FAT_operation
 30509                                  ;
 30510                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30511                                  
 30512                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30513                                  
 30514                                  FAT_operation:
 30515                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30516                                  FATERR:
 30517                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 30518                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30519 0000580A 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 30520                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 30521                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 30522 00005810 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; Put error code in DI
 30523                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 30524 00005814 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 30525                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 30526 00005819 B41A                    	MOV	AH,2+Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY ; While trying to read FAT
 30527 0000581B A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Tell which drive
 30528 0000581E E8F8FB                  	call	FATAL1
 30529 00005821 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 30530 00005825 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 30531 00005827 7502                    	JNZ	short FAT_GOT_DPB	; User said retry
 30532 00005829 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 30533 0000582A C3                      	retn
 30534                                  
 30535                                  FAT_GOT_DPB:
 30536                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30537 0000582B 16                      	push	ss			
 30538 0000582C 1F                      	pop	ds
 30539                                  	;mov	al,0Fh
 30540 0000582D B00F                    	MOV	AL,DMEDHL
 30541                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+1]
 30542 0000582F 268A6601                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT] 
 30543 00005833 A3[5A03]                	MOV	[DEVCALL_REQLEN],AX ; 09/09/2018 
 30544 00005836 C606[5C03]01            	MOV	BYTE [DEVCALL_REQFUNC],DEVMDCH
 30545 0000583B C706[5D03]0000          	MOV	word [DEVCALL_REQSTAT],0
 30546                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+16h]
 30547                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30548 00005841 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 30549 00005845 A2[6703]                	MOV	[CALLMED],AL
 30550 00005848 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30551 00005849 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 30552                                  
 30553                                  ;hkn; DEVCALL is in DOSDATA
 30554 0000584A BB[5A03]                	MOV	BX,DEVCALL
 30555                                  	;;lds	si,[es:bp+12h]
 30556                                  	;lds	si,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30557 0000584D 26C57613                	LDS	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; DS:SI Points to device header
 30558 00005851 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:BX Points to call header
 30559 00005852 E8B4EE                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 30560                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30561 00005855 16                      	push	ss
 30562 00005856 1F                      	pop	ds
 30563 00005857 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 30564 00005858 8B3E[5D03]              	MOV	DI,[DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 30565                                  	;test	di,8000h
 30566                                  	;jnz	short FATERR
 30567 0000585C 09FF                    	or	di,di
 30568 0000585E 78AA                    	js	short FATERR		; have error
 30569 00005860 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 30570                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 30571                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+18h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30572 00005862 26866618                	XCHG	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS] ; Reset dpb_first_access
 30573 00005866 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Use physical unit number
 30574                                  ; See if we had changed volume id by creating one on the diskette
 30575 00005869 3806[A10A]              	cmp	[VOLCHNG_FLAG],AL
 30576 0000586D 7508                    	jnz	short CHECK_BYT
 30577 0000586F C606[A10A]FF            	mov	byte [VOLCHNG_FLAG],-1
 30578 00005874 E9A700                  	jmp	GOGETBPB		; Need to get device driver to read in
 30579                                  					; new volume label.
 30580                                  CHECK_BYT:
 30581 00005877 0A26[6803]              	OR	AH,[CALLRBYT]
 30582                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 30583                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 30584                                  	; 17/12/2022
 30585 0000587B 7865                    	js	short NEWDSK
 30586                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30587                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 30588                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 30589                                  
 30590                                  CHECK_ZR:
 30591 0000587D 743C                    	JZ	short CHKBUFFDIRT	; jump if I don't know
 30592 0000587F F8                      	CLC
 30593 00005880 C3                      	retn				; If Media not changed (NZ)
 30594                                  
 30595                                  DISK_CHNG_ERR:
 30596 00005881 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30597 00005882 55                      	PUSH	BP
 30598                                  	;;les	bp,[es:bp+12h]
 30599                                  	;les	bp,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30600 00005883 26C46E13                	LES	BP,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; Get device pointer
 30601                                  	;;test	word [es:bp+4],800h
 30602                                  	;TEST	word [ES:BP+SYSDEV.ATT],DEVOPCL ; Did it set vol id?
 30603 00005887 26F6460508              	test	byte [es:bp+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(DEVOPCL>>8)
 30604 0000588C 5D                      	POP	BP
 30605 0000588D 07                      	POP	ES
 30606 0000588E 7426                    	JZ	short FAIL_OPJ2		; Nope, FAIL
 30607 00005890 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; Save buffer pointer for ignore
 30608 00005891 57                      	PUSH	DI
 30609 00005892 16                      	push	ss			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30610 00005893 1F                      	pop	ds
 30611                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 30612 00005894 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 30613 00005899 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30614 0000589A C43E[6903]              	LES	DI,[CALLVIDM]		; Get volume ID pointer
 30615 0000589E 8C06[2A03]              	MOV	[EXTERRPT+2],ES
 30616 000058A2 07                      	POP	ES
 30617 000058A3 893E[2803]              	MOV	[EXTERRPT],DI
 30618                                  	;mov	ax,0Fh
 30619 000058A7 B80F00                  	MOV	AX,error_I24_wrong_disk
 30620 000058AA C606[7505]01            	MOV	byte [READOP],1		; Write
 30621                                  	;invoke	HARDERR
 30622 000058AF E815FB                  	call	HARDERR
 30623 000058B2 5F                      	POP	DI			; Get back buffer for ignore
 30624 000058B3 1F                      	POP	DS
 30625 000058B4 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 30626                                  FAIL_OPJ2:
 30627 000058B6 741D                    	JZ	short FAIL_OP
 30628 000058B8 E970FF                  	JMP	FAT_GOT_DPB		; Retry
 30629                                  
 30630                                  CHKBUFFDIRT:
 30631                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30632                                  
 30633                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30634                                  	;lds	di,[BUFFHEAD]
 30635                                  
 30636                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30637 000058BB 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0	; any dirty buffers ? ;hkn;
 30638 000058C1 741F                    	je	short NEWDSK			; no, skip the check
 30639 000058C3 E8F800                  	call	GETCURHEAD			; get pointer to first buffer
 30640                                  nbuffer:
 30641                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 30642 000058C6 384504                  	cmp	[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],al	; Unit OK ?
 30643 000058C9 750E                    	jne	short lfnxt			; no, go for next buffer
 30644                                  	;test   byte [di+5],40h
 30645 000058CB F6450540                	TEST	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty	; is the buffer dirty ?
 30646 000058CF 7408                    	jz	short lfnxt			; no, go for next buffer
 30647                                  	;Context DS
 30648 000058D1 16                      	push	ss
 30649 000058D2 1F                      	pop	ds
 30650 000058D3 F8                      	clc
 30651 000058D4 C3                      	retn
 30652                                  
 30653                                  FAIL_OP:					; This label & code is here
 30654                                  	;Context DS				;  for reachability
 30655 000058D5 16                      	push	ss
 30656 000058D6 1F                      	pop	ds
 30657 000058D7 F9                      	STC
 30658 000058D8 C3                      	retn
 30659                                  
 30660                                  lfnxt:
 30661                                  	; 15/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30662                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30663                                  	;lds	di,[di]
 30664                                  
 30665                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30666 000058D9 8B3D                    	mov	di,[di]
 30667                                  	;;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]	; get next buffer
 30668                                  	
 30669                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30670                                  	;cmp	di,-1
 30671                                  	;jne	short nbuffer
 30672                                  	
 30673                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30674 000058DB 36393E[BB0E]            	cmp	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di		; is this where we started ?;hkn;
 30675 000058E0 75E4                    	jne	short nbuffer			; no, check this guy also
 30676                                  
 30677                                  ; If no dirty buffers, assume Media changed
 30678                                  NEWDSK:
 30679                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 3.3
 30680                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 30681 000058E2 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1	; Media changed, must
 30682                                  						;  recompute
 30683                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30684                                  	;call	SETVISIT
 30685                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30686 000058E8 E8D300                  	call	 GETCURHEAD
 30687                                  nxbuffer:
 30688                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30689                                  	;or 	byte [di+5],20h
 30690                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30691                                  	;cmp	[di+4],al
 30692 000058EB 384504                  	cmp	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],al		; This drive ?
 30693 000058EE 7510                    	jne	short lfnxt2
 30694                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 30695 000058F0 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 30696 000058F4 758B                    	jnz	short DISK_CHNG_ERR
 30697                                  	;mov	word [di+4],20FFh
 30698 000058F6 C74504FF20              	mov	word [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],(buf_visit*256)+0FFh ; free up
 30699 000058FB E8D200                  	call	SCANPLACE
 30700                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30701 000058FE EB02                    	jmp	short skpbuff
 30702                                  lfnxt2:
 30703 00005900 8B3D                    	mov	di,[di]
 30704                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 30705                                  skpbuff:
 30706                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30707 00005902 363B3E[BB0E]            	cmp	di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]					;hkn;
 30708 00005907 75E2                    	jne	short nxbuffer
 30709                                  
 30710 00005909 36833E[7700]00          	CMP	word [ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT],0 ;LB.  look ahead buffers ?	;AN001;
 30711 0000590F 740D                    	JZ	short GOGETBPB		;LB.  no			;AN001;
 30712 00005911 363A06[B00D]            	CMP	AL,[ss:CurSC_DRIVE]	;LB.  same as changed drive	;AN001;
 30713 00005916 7506                    	JNZ	short GOGETBPB		;LB.  no			;AN001;
 30714 00005918 36C606[B00D]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CurSC_DRIVE],-1 ;LB.  invalidate look ahead buffers ;AN000;
 30715                                  ;lfnxt2:
 30716                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30717                                  	;call	SKIPVISIT
 30718                                  	;jnz	short nxbuffer
 30719                                  GOGETBPB:
 30720                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30721                                  	;;lds	di,[es:bp+12h]
 30722                                  	;lds	di,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0	
 30723 0000591E 26C57E13                	LDS	DI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR]
 30724                                  	; 20/05/2019
 30725                                  	;test	word [di+4],2000h
 30726                                  	;TEST	word [DI+SYSDEV.ATT],ISFATBYDEV
 30727 00005922 F6450520                	TEST	byte [DI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(ISFATBYDEV>>8)
 30728 00005926 7510                    	JNZ	short GETFREEBUF
 30729                                  	;context DS	    		;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30730 00005928 16                      	push	ss
 30731 00005929 1F                      	pop	ds
 30732 0000592A BB0200                  	MOV	BX,2
 30733 0000592D E8D1FC                  	CALL	UNPACK			; Read the first FAT sector into CURBUF
 30734                                  FAIL_OPJ:
 30735 00005930 72A3                    	JC	short FAIL_OP
 30736 00005932 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 30737 00005936 EB13                    	JMP	SHORT GOTGETBUF
 30738                                  
 30739                                  GETFREEBUF:
 30740 00005938 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Get a free buffer for BIOS to use
 30741 00005939 55                      	PUSH	BP
 30742                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30743                                  	;LDS	DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/08/2018
 30744                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30745 0000593A 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX			;LB.  fake to get 1st	  ;AN000;
 30746                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30747 0000593C 368916[0706]            	MOV	[SS:HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;LB.  buffer addr	  ;AN000;
 30748 00005941 E87A00                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;LB.			  ;AN000;
 30749                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30750 00005944 E84202                  	call	BUFWRITE
 30751 00005947 5D                      	POP	BP
 30752 00005948 07                      	POP	ES
 30753                                  	;JC	short FAIL_OPJ
 30754 00005949 728A                    	jc	short FAIL_OP
 30755                                  GOTGETBUF:
 30756                                  	;;add	di,16
 30757                                  	;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30758 0000594B 83C714                  	ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 30759                                  
 30760                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30761 0000594E 368C1E[6A03]            	MOV	[SS:CALLXAD+2],DS
 30762                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30763 00005953 16                      	push	ss
 30764 00005954 1F                      	pop	ds
 30765 00005955 893E[6803]              	MOV	[CALLXAD],DI
 30766                                  	;mov	al,16h
 30767 00005959 B016                    	MOV	AL,DBPBHL
 30768                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+1]
 30769 0000595B 268A6601                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 30770 0000595F A3[5A03]                	MOV	[DEVCALL_REQLEN],AX ; 09/09/2018
 30771 00005962 C606[5C03]02            	MOV	BYTE [DEVCALL_REQFUNC],DEVBPB
 30772 00005967 C706[5D03]0000          	MOV	word [DEVCALL_REQSTAT],0
 30773                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+16h]
 30774                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h]
 30775 0000596D 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 30776 00005971 A2[6703]                	MOV	[CALLMED],AL
 30777 00005974 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30778 00005975 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 30779                                  	;;push	word [es:bp+14h]
 30780                                  	;push	word [es:bp+15h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30781 00005976 26FF7615                	PUSH	WORD [ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR+2]
 30782                                  	;;push	word [es:bp+12h]
 30783                                  	;push	word [es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30784 0000597A 26FF7613                	PUSH	WORD [ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR]
 30785                                  
 30786                                  ;hkn; DEVCALL is in DOSDATA
 30787 0000597E BB[5A03]                	MOV	BX,DEVCALL
 30788 00005981 5E                      	POP	SI
 30789 00005982 1F                      	POP	DS			; DS:SI Points to device header
 30790 00005983 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:BX Points to call header
 30791                                  	;invoke	DEVIOCALL2
 30792 00005984 E882ED                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 30793 00005987 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 30794                                  	;Context DS
 30795 00005988 16                      	push	ss		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30796 00005989 1F                      	pop	ds
 30797 0000598A 8B3E[5D03]              	MOV	DI,[DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 30798                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30799                                  	;test	di,8000h
 30800                                  	;jnz	short FATERRJ
 30801                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30802 0000598E 09FF                    	or	di,di
 30803 00005990 7829                    	js	short FATERRJ 		; have error
 30804                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+16h]
 30805                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h]  ; MSDOS 6.0
 30806 00005992 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 30807 00005996 C536[6C03]              	LDS	SI,[CALLBPB]
 30808                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],0
 30809                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],0 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30810 0000599A 26C7461D0000            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],0 ; recycle scanning pointer
 30811                                  	;invoke	$SETDPB
 30812 000059A0 E8A5B6                  	call	_$SETDPB
 30813                                  
 30814                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30815 000059A3 36C53E[6803]            	LDS	DI,[SS:CALLXAD]		; Get back buffer pointer
 30816                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+8]
 30817 000059A8 268A4608                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_COUNT]
 30818                                  
 30819                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30820                                  	;;mov	ah,[es:bp+0Fh]
 30821                                  	;MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 30822                                  	;;mov	[DI-8],ax
 30823                                  	;MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcnt-BUFINSIZ],AX
 30824                                  
 30825                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30826                                  	;mov	[di-0Ah],al
 30827 000059AC 8845F6                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcnt-BUFINSIZ],AL 
 30828                                  						;>32mb		  ;AN000;
 30829                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+0Fh]
 30830 000059AF 268B460F                	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]		;>32mb
 30831                                  	;mov	[di-9h],ax			  ;AC000;
 30832 000059B3 8945F7                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc-BUFINSIZ],AX 
 30833                                  					;>32mb Correct buffer info ;AC000;
 30834                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30835 000059B6 16                      	push	ss
 30836 000059B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 30837 000059B8 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			;Media changed (Z), Carry clear

 30875                                  ;
 30876                                  ;SETVISIT:
 30877                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 30879                                  ;; Inputs:

 30888                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 30889                                  ;; No other registers altered
 30890                                  ;

 30892                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 30893                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 30894                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 30895                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 30896                                  ;SETLOOP:

 30902                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP

 30971                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 30972                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30973                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 30974                                  ; Inputs:
 30975                                  ;	 No Inputs
 30976                                  ; Function:
 30977                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 30978                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 30979                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 30980                                  ; Outputs:
 30981                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 30982                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 30983                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 30984                                  ; No other registers altered
 30985                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30986                                  
 30987                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30988                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30989                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30990                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30991                                  
 30992                                  GETCURHEAD:
 30993 000059BE 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 30994 000059C3 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 30995 000059CA 36893E[BB0E]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	;save first buffer addr
 30996 000059CF C3                      	retn
 30997

 31218                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 31219                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31220                                  ;
 31221                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 31222                                  ; Inputs:
 31223                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 31224                                  ; Function:
 31225                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 31226                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 31227                                  ;	   same segment
 31228                                  ;
 31229                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 31230                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 31231                                  ; No Registers altered
 31232                                  ;
 31233                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31234                                  
 31235                                  POINTCOMP:
 31236                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31237                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 31238 00005A14 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 31239 00005A16 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 31240                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 31241 00005A18 51                      	PUSH	CX
 31242 00005A19 52                      	PUSH	DX
 31243 00005A1A 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 31244 00005A1C 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 31245 00005A1E 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 31246 00005A20 5A                      	POP	DX
 31247 00005A21 59                      	POP	CX
 31248                                  _ret_label:
 31249 00005A22 C3                      	retn
 31250                                  
 31251                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31252                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 31253                                  
 31254                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 31255                                  
 31256                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 31257                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31258                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 31259                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 31260                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 31261                                  ; 
 31262                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 31263                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 31264                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 31265                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 31266                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 31267                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 31268                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 31269                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 31270                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 31271                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 31272                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 31273                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31274                                  
 31275                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 31276                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31277                                  ;	GetBuffr reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 31278                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 31279                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 31280                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 31281                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 31282                                  ; 
 31283                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 31284                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 31285                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 31286                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 31287                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 31288                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 31289                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 31290                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 31291                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 31292                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 31293                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 31294                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 31295                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31296                                  
 31297                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31298                                  	; DOSCODE:9937h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31299                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31300                                  	; DOSCODE:98DBh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 31301                                  GETBUFFR:
 31302 00005A23 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI
 31303                                  
 31304                                  ;	This entry point is called for FAT buffering with SI != 0
 31305                                  
 31306                                  GETBUFFRB:
 31307 00005A25 A3[9405]                	MOV	[PREREAD],AX			; save pre-read flag
 31308                                  	; 15/12/2022
 31309 00005A28 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 31310                                  	; 27/11/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31311                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; mov al,[es:bp+0]
 31312 00005A2C C53E[1E00]              	LDS	DI,[LastBuffer]			; Get the recency pointer
 31313                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31314                                  ;hkn; SS override
 31315 00005A30 368B0E[0706]            	MOV	CX,[SS:HIGH_SECTOR]		; F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 31316                                  
 31317                                  ;	See if this is the buffer that was most recently returned.
 31318                                  ;	A big performance win if it is.
 31319                                  
 31320 00005A35 83FFFF                  	CMP	DI,-1				; Recency pointer valid?
 31321 00005A38 7412                    	je	short getb5			; No
 31322                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 31323 00005A3A 3B5506                  	CMP	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 31324 00005A3D 750D                    	JNZ	short getb5			; Wrong sector
 31325                                  	
 31326                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31327                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+8]
 31328 00005A3F 3B4D08                  	CMP	CX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]	; F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 31329 00005A42 7508                    	JNZ	short getb5			; F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 31330                                  	
 31331                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 31332 00005A44 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 31333                                  	;JZ	getb35				; Just asked for same buffer
 31334 00005A47 7503                    	jnz	short getb5
 31335                                  	;jmp	getb35
 31336                                  	; 17/12/2022
 31337                                  	; 28/07/2019
 31338 00005A49 E9C800                  	jmp	getb35x
 31339                                  	; 07/12/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31340                                  	;jmp	getb35
 31341                                  
 31342                                  ;	It's not the buffer most recently returned. See if it's in the
 31343                                  ;	cache.
 31344                                  ;
 31345                                  ;	(cx:dx) = sector #
 31346                                  ;	(al) = drive #
 31347                                  ;	(si) = 0 iff non fat sector, != 0 if FAT sector read
 31348                                  ;	??? list may be incomplete ???
 31349                                  
 31350                                  getb5:	
 31351                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31352                                  	;lds	di,[SS:BUFFHEAD]
 31353                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31354 00005A4C E86FFF                  	CALL	GETCURHEAD			; get Q Head
 31355                                  getb10:	
 31356                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 31357 00005A4F 3B5506                  	CMP	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 31358 00005A52 750D                    	jne	short getb12			; wrong sector lo
 31359

 31716                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31717                                  ;
 31718                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 31719                                  ;
 31720                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 31721                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 31722                                  ;
 31723                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 31724                                  ;
 31725                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31726                                  ;
 31727                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31728                                  
 31729                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 31730                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31731 00005B60 B4FF                    	mov	ah, -1 ; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 31732                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 31733 00005B62 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 31734 00005B65 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear
 31735 00005B67 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL			; 
 31736 00005B69 7406                    	JZ	short DOBUFFER		; do this buffer
 31737                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 31738 00005B6B 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 31739 00005B6E F8                      	CLC
 31740 00005B6F 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 31741                                  DOBUFFER:
 31742                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 31743 00005B71 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 31744 00005B75 74E8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 31745 00005B77 50                      	PUSH	AX
 31746                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 31747 00005B78 FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 31748 00005B7B E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE
 31749 00005B7E 58                      	POP	AX
 31750 00005B7F 7206                    	JC	short LEAVE_BUF		; Leave buffer marked free (lost).
 31751                                  	;and	ah,0BFh
 31752 00005B81 80E4BF                  	AND	AH,~buf_dirty		; Buffer is clean, clears carry
 31753                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 31754 00005B84 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 31755                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 31756 00005B87 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 31757                                  checkflush_retn:
 31758 00005B88 C3                      	retn

 31760                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 31761                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31762                                  ;
 31763                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 31764                                  ;
 31765                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 31766                                  ;

 31768                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31769                                  ;
 31770                                  ;	USES	All buf DS:DI

 31867 00005BE5 51                      	push	cx

 31890                                  NOSET:				;	succeedes.

 31902                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 31903                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31904                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 31905                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
 31906                                  ;	SC_DRIVE even if SC is disabled to save the testing
 31907                                  ;	code and time
 31908                                  ;
 31909                                  ;	ENTRY	ES:BP = drive parameter block
 31910                                  ;
 31911                                  ;	EXIT	[SC_SECTOR_SIZE]= drive sector size
 31912                                  ;		[SC_DRIVE]= drive #
 31913                                  ;
 31914                                  ;	USES	Flags
 31915                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31916                                  
 31917                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31918                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31919                                  
 31920                                  SET_RQ_SC_PARMS:
 31921                                  ;hkn; SS override for all variables used in this procedure.

 31923                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+2]

 31925 00005C1B 36A3[AD0D]              	MOV	[ss:SC_SECTOR_SIZE],ax
 31926                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 31927                                  	; 27/11/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31928                                  	;MOV	al,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]		; save drive #
 31929                                  	; 15/12/2022
 31930 00005C1F 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 31931 00005C23 36A2[AF0D]              	MOV	[ss:SC_DRIVE],al
 31932 00005C27 58                      	pop	ax
 31933                                  srspx:	
 31934 00005C28 C3                      	retn					;LB. return

 31983                                  
 31984                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 31985                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 31986                                  
 31987                                  ; =========================================================================
 31988                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 31989                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 31990                                  ;
 31991                                  ;	$WAIT
 31992                                  ;	$EXEC
 31993                                  ;	$Keep_process
 31994                                  ;	Stay_resident
 31995                                  ;	$EXIT
 31996                                  ;	$ABORT
 31997                                  ;	abort_inner
 31998                                  ;
 31999                                  ;	Modification history:
 32000                                  ;
 32001                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 32002                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 32003                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 32004                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 32005                                  ;
 32006                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 32007                                  ;
 32008                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 32009                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 32010                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 32011                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 32012                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 32013                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 32014                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 32015                                  ;
 32016                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 32017                                  ;
 32018                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 32019                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 32020                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 32021                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 32022                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 32023                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 32024                                  ;
 32025                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 32026                                  ;
 32027                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 32028                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 32029                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 32030                                  ;
 32031                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 32032                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 32033                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 32034                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 32035                                  ;
 32036                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 32037                                  ;
 32038                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 32039                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 32040                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 32041                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 32042                                  ;
 32043                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 32044                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 32045                                  ;		       UMBs.
 32046                                  ;
 32047                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 32048                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 32049                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 32050                                  ;
 32051                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 32052                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 32053                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 32054                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 32055                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 32056                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 32057                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 32058                                  ;

 32081                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 32082                                  _$WAIT:
 32083                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32084                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 32085                                  
 32086 00005C3D 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX

 32090                                  ; =========================================================================
 32091                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 32092                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 32093                                  ;
 32094                                  ;
 32095                                  ; Assembler usage:
 32096                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 32097                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 32098                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 32099                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 32100                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 32101                                  ;
 32102                                  ;	AL  Function
 32103                                  ;	--  --------
 32104                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 32105                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 32106                                  ;	    begin execution.
 32107                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 32108                                  ;
 32109                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 32110                                  ;
 32111                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32112                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 32113                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 32114                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32115                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 32116                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 32117                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32118                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32119                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 32120                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32121                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32122                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 32123                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32124                                  ;
 32125                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 32126                                  ;
 32127                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32128                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 32129                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 32130                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32131                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 32132                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 32133                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32134                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32135                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 32136                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32137                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32138                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 32139                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32140                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 32141                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 32142                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32143                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 32144                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 32145                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32146                                  ;
 32147                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 32148                                  ;
 32149                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32150                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 32151                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 32152                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32153                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 32154                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 32155                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32156                                  ;
 32157                                  ; Returns:
 32158                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 32159                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 32160                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 32161                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 32162                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 32163                                  ; =========================================================================
 32164                                  ;
 32165                                  ;   Revision history:
 32166                                  ;
 32167                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 32168                                  ;
 32169                                  ; =========================================================================
 32170                                  
 32171                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 32172                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 32173

 32178                                  ;%out	following sizes:

 32181                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128

 32194

 32196                                  	; DOSCODE:9B04h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32197                                  	
 32198                                  _$EXEC:
 32199                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32200                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 32201                                  
 32202                                  EXEC001S:
 32203                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 32204                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 32205                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 32206                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 32207                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 32208                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 32209                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 32210                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 32211                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 32212                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 32213                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 32214                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 32215                                  	;
 32216                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 32217                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 32218                                  
 32219                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 32220                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 32221                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 32222                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 32223                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 32224                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 32225                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 32226                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 32227                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 32228                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 32229                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 32230                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 32231                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 32232                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 32233                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 32234                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 32235                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 32236                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 32237                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 32238                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32239                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]
 32240                                  	%define		Exec_NoStack	byte [bp-29]
 32241                                  	
 32242                                  	; ==================================================================
 32243                                  	; validate function
 32244                                  	; ==================================================================
 32245                                  		      	
 32246                                  	; M068 - Start
 32247                                  	;
 32248                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 32249                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 32250                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 32251                                  	; the A20  off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 32252                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 32253                                  
 32254                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32255 00005C47 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 32256                                  
 32257                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 32258                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 32259                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExceReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 32260                                  
 32261 00005C4D 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 32262                                  	;jne	short @f
 32263 00005C4F 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 32264                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 32265 00005C51 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 32266 00005C52 B9[4C04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 32267 00005C55 51                      	push	cx
 32268                                  ;@@:
 32269                                  Exec_@f:
 32270                                  	; M068 - End
 32271                                  	
 32272                                  	;Enter
 32273                                  
 32274 00005C56 55                      	push	bp
 32275 00005C57 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 32276                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 32277                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 32278                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 32279                                  	; 17/12/2022
 32280                                  	; 20/05/2019
 32281 00005C59 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0	
 32282                                  
 32283                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32284 00005C5C 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 32285                                  					; M030
 32286 00005C5E 7614                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 32287                                  
 32288                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32289                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 32290                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 32291                                  
 32292                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 32293 00005C60 36C606[2303]01          	mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 32294                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 32295                                  	;mov	al,1
 32296 00005C66 B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function
 32297                                  
 32298                                  Exec_Ret_Err:
 32299                                  	;Leave
 32300 00005C68 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 32301 00005C6A 5D                      	pop	bp
 32302                                  	;transfer SYS_RET_ERR
 32303 00005C6B E91FAA                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 32304                                  
 32305                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32306                                  ExecReadyJ:
 32307 00005C6E E80318                  	call	ExecReady		; M028
 32308 00005C71 E90504                  	jmp	norm_ovl		; do a Leave & xfer sysret_OK ; M028
 32309                                  
 32310                                  Exec_Check_2:
 32311 00005C74 3C02                    	cmp	AL,2			
 32312 00005C76 74E8                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 32313                                  
 32314                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32315 00005C78 3C04                    	cmp	al,4			; 2 & 4 are not allowed
 32316 00005C7A 74E4                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun

 33217 00006048 E8D601                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 33218                                  ;SR;
 33219                                  ;The current lie strategy uses the PSP to store the lie version. However,
 33220                                  ;device drivers are loaded as overlays and have no PSP. To handle them, we
 33221                                  ;use the Sysinit flag provided by the BIOS as part of a structure pointed at
 33222                                  ;by BiosDataPtr. If this flag is set, the overlay call has been issued from
 33223                                  ;Sysinit and therefore must be a device driver load. We then get the lie 
 33224                                  ;version for this driver and put it into the Sysinit PSP. When the driver
 33225                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay
 33226                                  ;call is issued.
 33227

 33747                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 33748                                  ;
 33749                                  ; Input:    DX is  an  offset  from  CurrentPDB  at which to
 33750                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 33751                                  ;
 33752                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 33753                                  ;	    paragraphs long.  An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 33754                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.

 33769 00006279 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system

 33771

 33995                                  ;**	Arena_Free_Process
 33996                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33997                                  ;	Free all arena blocks allocated to a prOcess
 33998                                  ;
 33999                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = PID of process
 34000                                  ;	EXIT	none
 34001                                  ;	USES	????? BUGBUG
 34002                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34003                                  
 34004                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34005                                  	; DOSCODE:A1C2h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 34007                                  arena_free_process:
 34008                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34009                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34010 000062F4 36A1[2400]                      MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head]
 34011                                  arena_free_process_start:
 34012 000062F8 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE ; 0
 34013                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head] ; 15/04/2018  
 34014 000062FB E83000                          CALL	check_signature         ; ES <- AX, check for valid block
 34015                                  
 34016                                  arena_free_process_loop:
 34017                                          ;retc
 34018 000062FE 723D                            JC	SHORT AFP_RETN	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 34019 00006300 06                      	PUSH    ES
 34020 00006301 1F                              POP     DS

 34022 00006302 391E0100                        CMP     [ARENA.OWNER],BX	; is block owned by pid?
 34023 00006306 7504                            JNZ     SHORT arena_free_next	; no, skip to next
 34024                                  	;mov	[1],di
 34025 00006308 893E0100                        MOV     [ARENA.OWNER],DI	; yes... free him
 34026                                  
 34027                                  arena_free_next:
 34028                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ;'Z'
 34029 0000630C 803D5A                          CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 34030                                                                          ; end of road, Jack?
 34031                                          ;retz				; never come back no more
 34032                                  	;JZ	SHORT AFP_RETN  ; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 2.11)
 34033                                  	; 14/05/2019
 34034                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34035 0000630F 7405                    	jz	short arena_chk_umbs
 34036                                          
 34037 00006311 E81300                  	CALL    arena_next              ; next item in ES/AX carry set if trash
 34038 00006314 EBE8                            JMP     SHORT arena_free_process_loop
 34039

 34041                                  arena_chk_umbs:				; M010 - Start
 34042                                  	; 20/05/2019
 34043 00006316 36A1[8C00]              	mov	ax,[ss:UMB_HEAD]	; ax = umb_head

 34045 0000631D 741E                    	je	short ret_label		; N: we're done
 34046

 34048 00006321 39C7                    	cmp	di,ax			; Q: is last arena above umb_head

 34050 00006325 EBD1                    	jmp	short arena_free_process_start
 34051                                  					; M010 - End
