 34057                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 34058                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34059                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 34060                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34061                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 34062                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 34063                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34064                                  
 34065                                  arena_next:
 34066 00006327 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 34067 00006329 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 34068 0000632D 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 34069                                  
 34070                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 34071                                  ;
 34072                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 34073                                  ;       RETN
 34074                                  
 34075                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 34076                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34077                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 34078                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34079                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 34080                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 34081                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 34082                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 34083                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34084                                  
 34085                                  check_signature:        
 34086                                  
 34087 0000632E 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 34088                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 34089 00006330 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 34090                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 34091 00006334 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 34092                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 34093 00006336 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 34094                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 34095 0000633A 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 34096 0000633C F9                              STC                             ; set error
 34097                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 34098                                  AFP_RETN:
 34099                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 34100                                  check_signature_ok:
 34101                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 34102 0000633D C3                      	RETN
 34103                                  
 34104                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 34105                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34106                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 34107                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 34108                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 34109                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 34110                                  ;
 34111                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 34112                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34113                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34114                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 34115                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 34116                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 34117                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 34118                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34119                                          
 34120                                  Coalesce:
 34121                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 34122 0000633E 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 34123                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 34124                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 34125 00006341 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 34126 00006343 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 34127                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 34128 00006346 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 34129                                  
 34130                                  coalesce_check:
 34131                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 34132 00006348 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 34133                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 34134 0000634D 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 34135                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 34136 0000634F 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 34137 00006354 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 34138                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 34139 00006355 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 34140 00006359 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 34141 0000635C 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 34142 0000635E EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 34143                                  
 34144                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34145                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 34146                                  
 34147                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 34148                                  
 34149                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34150                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34151                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 34152                                  ;
 34153                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 34154                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 34155                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 34156                                  ;
 34157                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 34158                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 34159                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 34160                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 34161                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 34162                                  ;
 34163                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 34164                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 34165                                  ;
 34166                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 34167                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 34168                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 34169                                  ;           INT     21h
 34170                                  ;
 34171                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 34172                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 34173                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 34174                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 34175                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 34176                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 34177                                  ;
 34178                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 34179                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 34180                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 34181                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 34182                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 34183                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 34184                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 34185                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 34186                                  ;	USES	All
 34187                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34188                                  
 34189                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34190                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34191                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 34192                                  ;
 34193                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34194                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 34195                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 34196                                  ;           INT     21h

 34524                                  
 34525                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 34526                                  
 34527                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34528                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34529                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 34530                                  ;
 34531                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 34532                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 34533                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 34534                                  ;
 34535                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 34536                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 34537                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 34538                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 34539                                  ;
 34540                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 34541                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 34542                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 34543                                  ;		code.
 34544                                  ;
 34545                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 34546                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 34547                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 34548                                  ;
 34549                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34550                                  ;		'C' set if error
 34551                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 34552                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 34553                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 34554                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 34555                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 34556                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 34557                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34558                                  
 34559                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34560                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34561                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 34562                                  ;
 34563                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34564                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 34565                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 34566                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 34567                                  ;           INT     21h
 34568                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 34569                                  ;         size possible
 34570                                  ;   Error return:
 34571                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 34572                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 34573                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 34574                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 34575                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34576                                  
 34577                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 34578                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34579                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 34580 000064B6 E8CFAE                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 34581                                  
 34582 000064B9 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 34583 000064BC 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 34584 000064BE 48                              DEC     AX
 34585 000064BF E86CFE                          CALL    check_signature
 34586 000064C2 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 34587

 34606                                  ;

 34608                                  ;
 34609                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear of OK
 34610                                  ;		'C' set if error

 34612                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 34613                                  
 34614                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)

 34617                                  ;
 34618                                  ;   Assembler usage:

 34661                                          ;error	error_invalid_block
 34662                                  	;mov	al,9
 34663 0000650B B009                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_block
 34664                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34665                                  dealloc_errj:
 34666                                  AllocOperErrj:	; 17/12/2022
 34667 0000650D E97DA1                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 34668                                  
 34669                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 34670                                  
 34671                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34672                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34673                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 34674                                  ;
 34675                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 34676                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 34677                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 34678                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 34679                                  ;           INT     21h
 34680                                  ;
 34681                                  ;	ENTRY	
 34682                                  ;		(al) = 0
 34683                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 34684                                  ;
 34685                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 34686                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 34687                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 34688                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 34689                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 34690                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 34691                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 34692                                  ;
 34693                                  ;		(al) = 2
 34694                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 34695                                  ;
 34696                                  ;		(al) = 3
 34697                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 34698                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 34699                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 34700                                  ;
 34701                                  ;
 34702                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34703                                  ;
 34704                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 34705                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 34706                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 34707                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 34708                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 34709                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 34710                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 34711                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 34712                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 34713                                  ;
 34714                                  ;		'C' set if error
 34715                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 34716                                  ;
 34717                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 34718                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 34719                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 34720                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 34721                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 34722                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34723                                  
 34724                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34725                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34726                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 34727                                  ;
 34728                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34729                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 34730                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 34731                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 34732                                  ;           INT     21h
 34733                                  ;
 34734                                  ;   Error return:
 34735                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 34736                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34737                                  
 34738                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34739                                  _$ALLOCOPER:
 34740                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34741                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 34902                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34903                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34904                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 34905                                  ;
 34906                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 34907                                  ;
 34908                                  ;
 34909                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 34910                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 34911                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 34912                                  ;		   else
 34913                                  ;			DS = last arena
 34914                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 34915                                  ;
 34916                                  ;		   CY if error
 34917                                  ;
 34918                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 34919                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34920                                  
 34921                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34922                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34923                                  
 34924                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34925                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34926                                  	
 34927                                  GetLastArena:
 34928 0000659B 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 34929                                  
 34930 0000659C 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 34931 000065A0 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 34932 000065A2 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 34933                                  
 34934 000065A4 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 34935                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 34936 000065A8 7419                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES		
 34937                                  					
 34938                                  GLA_next:
 34939 000065AA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 34940 000065AC E878FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 34941                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34942                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 34943                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34944 000065AF 7228                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 34945                                  
 34946 000065B1 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 34947 000065B7 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is 
 34948                                  					;    umb_head
 34949                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 34950                                  
 34951 000065B9 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 34952                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 34953 000065BD EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 34954                                  GLA_chkumb:
 34955 000065BF 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 34956                                  GLA_@f:
 34957 000065C1 75E7                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 34958                                  
 34959                                  GLA_done:
 34960                                  					; M061 - Start
 34961 000065C3 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 34962 000065C9 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 34963                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next 
 34964                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 34965 000065CB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 34966 000065CD E857FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 34967                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 34968 000065D0 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 34969 000065D2 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 34970 000065D4 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 34971                                  					; M061 - End
 34972                                  GLA_ret:
 34973                                  	; 17/12/2022				
 34974                                  	;clc
 34975                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34976                                  	;clc
 34977 000065D6 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 34978 000065D7 C3                      	retn				; M061
 34979                                  
 34980                                  GLA_err:
 34981 000065D8 F9                      	stc				; M061
 34982                                  GLA_err2:
 34983 000065D9 58                      	pop	ax
 34984 000065DA C3                      	retn

 35013                                  ;BREAK <ServerCall -- Server DOS call>
 35014                                  
 35015                                  ; DOSCODE:A517h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35016                                  ; DOSCODE:A4B7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35017

 35020                                  ;SRVC001S label byte
 35021                                  
 35022                                  SRVC001S:
 35023                                  
 35024 000065DB [DF65]                  SERVERTAB:	dw	SERVER_DISP
 35025 000065DD [3166]                  SERVERLEAVE:	dw	SERVERRETURN
 35026 000065DF 0B                      SERVER_DISP:	db	(SERVER_DISP_END-SERVER_DISP-1)/2 ; = 11
 35027 000065E0 [9966]                  		dw	SRV_CALL	; 0
 35028 000065E2 [3266]                  		dw	COMMIT_ALL	; 1
 35029 000065E4 [6866]                  		dw	CLOSE_NAME	; 2
 35030 000065E6 [7366]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID	; 3
 35031 000065E8 [7A66]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID_PID	; 4
 35032 000065EA [8166]                  		dw	GET_LIST	; 5
 35033 000065EC [DA66]                  		dw	GET_DOS_DATA	; 6
 35034 000065EE [FE66]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 7
 35035 000065F0 [FE66]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 8
 35036 000065F2 [FE66]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 9
 35037 000065F4 [0A67]                  		dw	_$SetExtendedError  ; 10
 35038

 35040                                  
 35041                                  ;SRVC001E label byte
 35042                                  
 35043                                  SRVC001E:
 35044                                  
 35045                                  ;hkn; TABLE	ENDS
 35046                                  
 35047                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35048                                  ;
 35049                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 35050                                  ;
 35051                                  ; Inputs:
 35052                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 35053                                  ; Function:
 35054                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 35055                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 35056                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 35057                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 35058                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 35059                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 35060                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 35061                                  ;			CX User Index
 35062                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 35063                                  ;			BX = UID
 35064                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 35065                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 35066                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 35067                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 35068                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 35069                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 35070                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 35071                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 35072                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 35073                                  ;
 35074                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35075                                  
 35076                                  _$ServerCall:
 35077                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35078                                  	; DOSCODE:A4D2h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)		
 35079                                  	; 10/06/2019
 35080                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35081                                  	; DOSCODE:A532h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 35082                                  
 35083                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35084                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 657Bh
 35085 000065F6 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7
 35086 000065F8 7204                    	JB	short SET_STUFF
 35087 000065FA 3C09                    	CMP	AL,9
 35088 000065FC 761A                    	JBE	short NO_SET_ID		; No DPL on calls 7,8,9
 35089                                  SET_STUFF:
 35090 000065FE 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point to DPL with DS:SI
 35091                                  	;mov	bx,[si+12h]
 35092 00006600 8B5C12                  	MOV	BX,[SI+DPL.UID]
 35093                                  
 35094                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35095                                  ;SR;
 35096                                  ; WIN386 updates the USER_ID itself. If WIN386 is present we skip the updating
 35097                                  ; of USER_ID
 35098                                  
 35099 00006603 36F606[3010]01          	test	byte [SS:IsWin386],1
 35100 00006609 7505                    	jnz	short skip_win386
 35101                                  
 35102                                  ;hkn; SS override for user_id and proc_id
 35103                                  	; 15/08/2018
 35104 0000660B 36891E[3E03]            	MOV	[SS:USER_ID],BX		; Set UID
 35105                                  
 35106                                  skip_win386:
 35107 00006610 8B5C14                  	MOV	BX,[SI+DPL.PID]
 35108 00006613 36891E[3C03]            	MOV	[SS:PROC_ID],BX		; Set process ID
 35109                                  NO_SET_ID:
 35110                                  	; 10/06/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35111 00006618 2EFF36[DD65]            	PUSH	word [cs:SERVERLEAVE]	; push return address
 35112 0000661D 2EFF36[DB65]            	PUSH	word [cS:SERVERTAB]	; push table address
 35113 00006622 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35114 00006623 E872AC                  	call	TableDispatch
 35115                                  
 35116                                  ;hkn; SS override
 35117                                  	;mov 	byte [SS:EXETERR_LOCUS],1
 35118 00006626 36C606[2303]01          	MOV	byte [SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; Extended Error Locus
 35119                                  	;error	error_invalid_function
 35120                                  	;mov	al,1
 35121 0000662C B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function
 35122                                  servercall_error:
 35123 0000662E E95CA0                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 35124                                  
 35125                                  SERVERRETURN:
 35126 00006631 C3                      	retn
 35127                                  
 35128                                  ; Commit - iterate through the open file list and make sure that the
 35129                                  ; directory entries are correctly updated.
 35130                                  
 35131                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35132                                  COMMIT_ALL:
 35133 00006632 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			;   for (i=0; ThisSFT=getSFT(i); i++)
 35134 00006634 16                      	push	ss
 35135 00006635 1F                      	pop	ds
 35136 00006636 E84FAD                  	call	ECritSFT		; Gonna scan SFT cache, lock it down
 35137                                  CommitLoop:
 35138 00006639 53                      	push	bx
 35139 0000663A E82401                  	call	SFFromSFN
 35140 0000663D 7222                    	JC	short CommitDone
 35141 0000663F 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 35142                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0
 35143                                  					; if (ThisSFT->refcount != 0)
 35144 00006643 7418                    	JZ	short CommitNext
 35145                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 35146 00006645 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 35147                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],sf_busy  
 35148                                  					; BUSY SFTs have god knows what
 35149 00006649 7412                    	JZ	short CommitNext	;   in them.
 35150                                  	; 17/12/2022

 35388                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 35389                                  
 35390                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 35391                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35392                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 35393                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 35394                                  ;
 35395                                  ;	NOTE:
 35396                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 35397                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35398                                  ;
 35399                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 35400                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 35401                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 35402                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35403                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 35404                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 35405                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35406                                  
 35407                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35408                                  
 35409                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 35410                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35411                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 35412 0000672E 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35413                                  	
 35414                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 35415 00006733 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 35416                                  
 35417                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 35418 00006738 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 35419 0000673D 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 35420                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35421                                  	;mov	al,6
 35422 0000673F B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35423                                  ReturnCarry:
 35424 00006741 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 35425 00006742 C3                      	retn				; go back
 35426                                  pjfn10: 
 35427                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 35428 00006743 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 35429 00006748 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 35430                                  	;clc
 35431                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 35432 0000674A C3                      	retn
 35433                                  
 35434                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 35435                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35436                                  ;
 35437                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 35438                                  ;
 35439                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 35440                                  ;
 35441                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 35442                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 35443                                  ;                   AX has error code
 35444                                  ;               Carry Reset
 35445                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 35446                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 35447                                  ; NOTE:
 35448                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 35449                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35450                                  ;
 35451                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35452                                  
 35453                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35454                                  
 35455                                  SFFromHandle:
 35456 0000674B E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 35457                                  	;retc				; return if error
 35458 0000674E 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 35459 00006750 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 35460                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 35461                                  	;;mov	al,6
 35462                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35463                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 35464                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35465                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35466 00006754 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 35467                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 35468                                  	;;mov	al,6
 35469                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35470                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 35471                                  GetSF:
 35472 00006756 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 35473 00006757 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 35474 0000675A 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 35475 0000675C E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 35476 0000675F 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 35477 00006760 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 35478                                  
 35479                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 35480                                  
 35481                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 35482                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35483                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 35484                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 35485                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 35486                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 35487                                  ;
 35488                                  ;   NOTE:
 35489                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 35490                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35491                                  ;
 35492                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 35493                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35494                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 35495                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 35496                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 35497                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35498                                  
 35499                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35500                                  
 35501                                  SFFromSFN:
 35502                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35503                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 35504 00006761 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35505                                  
 35506                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 35507 00006766 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 35508                                  sfsfn5:	
 35509                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 35510 0000676B 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 35511 0000676F 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 35512                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 35513 00006771 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 35514 00006775 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 35515                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 35516 00006778 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 35517 0000677B 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 35518 0000677D F9                      	STC
 35519 0000677E C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 35520                                  sfsfn7:
 35521 0000677F 50                      	push	ax
 35522                                  	;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 35523                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 35524                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 35525                                  	
 35526                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35527 00006780 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 35528                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35529                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 35530                                  	
 35531 00006782 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 35532 00006784 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 35533 00006786 58                      	pop	ax
 35534                                  	;add	di,6
 35535 00006787 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 35536 0000678A C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 35537                                  
 35538                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 35539                                  
 35540                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 35541                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35542                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 35543                                  ;
 35544                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 35545                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35546                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 35547                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 35548                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35549                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 35550                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 35551                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35552                                  
 35553                                  JFNFree:
 35554 0000678B 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 35555                                  jfnf1:	
 35556 0000678D E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 35557 00006790 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 35558 00006792 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 35559 00006796 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 35560 00006798 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 35561 00006799 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 35562                                  
 35563                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 35564                                  jfnf5:	
 35565                                  	;mov	al,4
 35566 0000679B B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 35567                                  jfnfx:	
 35568 0000679D C3                      	retn				; bye
 35569                                  
 35570                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 35571                                  
 35572                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 35573                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35574                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 35575                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 35576                                  ;
 35577                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 35578                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 35579                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 35580                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 35581                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 35582                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 35583                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 35584                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 35585                                  ;
 35586                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 35587                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 35588                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 35589                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 35590                                  ;
 35591                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 35592                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 35593                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 35594                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 35595                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 35596                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35597                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 35598                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 35599                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35600                                  
 35601                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35602                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35603                                  
 35604                                  SFNFree:
 35605                                  	; 12/08/2018
 35606                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35607                                  	;
 35608                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35609 0000679E 50                      	push	ax
 35610 0000679F 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 35611                                  sfnf5:	
 35612 000067A1 53                      	push	bx
 35613 000067A2 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 35614 000067A5 5B                      	pop	bx
 35615 000067A6 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 35616 000067A8 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 35617                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 35618 000067AC 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 35619                                  	
 35620                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 35621 000067AE 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 35622                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 35623 000067B2 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 35624                                  sfnf7:

 35694                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 35695                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35696                                  ;
 35697                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 35698                                  ;
 35699                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 35700                                  ;		path
 35701                                  ;
 35702                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 35703                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 35704                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 35705                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 35706                                  ;
 35707                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 35708                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 35709                                  ;	USES	all
 35710                                  ;
 35711                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35712                                  
 35713                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35714                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35715                                  
 35716                                  _$CLOSE:
 35717                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 35718                                  
 35719 000067E6 E85A02                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 35720 000067E9 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 35721 000067EB 16                      	push	ss
 35722 000067EC 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 35723 000067ED 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 35724 000067F1 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 35725                                  
 35726                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 35727                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 35728                                  ;
 35729                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 35730                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT;  if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 35731                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 35732                                  
 35733                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 35734 000067F5 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 35735 000067F9 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 35736                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 35737 000067FB 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 35738                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 35739 000067FF 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 35740                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 35741 00006801 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 35742 00006803 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 35743                                  
 35744                                  ; The JFN must be freed.  Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 35745                                  ; -1.
 35746                                  
 35747                                  FreeJFN:
 35748 00006805 E826FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		;   d = pJFN (handle);
 35749 00006808 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 35750                                  PostFree:
 35751                                  
 35752                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 35753                                  
 35754 0000680C E887C7                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 35755                                  
 35756                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 35757                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 35758                                  
 35759 0000680F 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 35760                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 35761 00006811 B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 35762                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35763                                  CloseOk:
 35764 00006813 E96E9E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 35765                                  CloseError:
 35766 00006816 E9749E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 35767

 35996                                  ;	BREAK <$READ - Read from a file handle>
 35997                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35998                                  ;
 35999                                  ;**	$Read - Read from a File Handle
 36000                                  ;
 36001                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 36002                                  ;
 36003                                  ;	LDS	DX, buf
 36004                                  ;	MOV	CX, count
 36005                                  ;	MOV	BX, handle
 36006                                  ;	MOV	AH, Read
 36007                                  ;	INT	int_command
 36008                                  ;	  AX has number of bytes read
 36009                                  ;
 36010                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = file handle
 36011                                  ;		(cx) = byte count
 36012                                  ;		(ds:dx) = buffer address
 36013                                  ;	EXIT	Through system call return so that to user:
 36014                                  ;		  'C' clear if OK
 36015                                  ;		    (ax) = bytes read
 36016                                  ;		  'C' set if error
 36017                                  ;		    (ax) = error code
 36018                                  ;
 36019                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 36021                                  _$READ:

 36026

 36029 00006905 7303                    	JNC	short ReadSetup		; no errors do the operation
 36030                                  
 36031                                  ;	Have an error. 'C' set
 36032                                  
 36033                                  ReadError:
 36034                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 36036                                  	;jmp	short CommitErrorj3

 36043                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36044                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 
 36045                                  ;; Extended Open

 36051                                  					;AN000;;EO. set it off;smr;SS Override
 36052                                  needi24:				;AN000;
 36053                                  ;; Extended Open

 36065                                   	; here instead of calling it as a subroutine; but I have modified code

 36073                                  	;MOV	BX,DX			; copy offset
 36074                                  	;push	cx			; don't stomp on count
 36075                                  	;MOV	CL,4			; bits to shift bytes->para
 36076                                  	;SHR	BX,CL			; get number of paragraphs

 36088 0000692F 1F                      	pop	ds

 36509                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 36510                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36511                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 36512                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 36513                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 36514                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 36515                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 36516                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 36517                                  ;
 36518                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 36519                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 36520                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 36521                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 36522                                  ;	USES	none
 36523                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36524                                  
 36525                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36526                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36527                                  CheckOwner:
 36528                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36529                                  
 36530 00006A43 E805FD                  	call	SFFromHandle
 36531 00006A46 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 36532                                  
 36533 00006A48 50                      	push	ax
 36534                                  
 36535                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36536                                  
 36537                                  ;SR; WIN386 patch - Do not check for USER_ID for using handles since these 
 36538                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.
 36539

 36547                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:di+47]
 36548 00006A59 263B452F                	cmp	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID]

 36567                                  ;============================================================================
 36568                                  ; MACRO.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36569                                  ;============================================================================
 36570                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018
 36571                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36572                                  
 36573                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 36574                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 36575                                  
 36576                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 36577                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 36578                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 36579                                  
 36580                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 36581                                  ;
 36582                                  ;	$AssignOper
 36583                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 36584                                  ;	InitCDS
 36585                                  ;	$UserOper
 36586                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 36587                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 36588                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 36589                                  ;
 36590                                  ;   Revision history:
 36591                                  ;
 36592                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 36593                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 36594                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 36595                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 36596                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 36597                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 36598                                  ;				    aliasing.
 36599                                  ;
 36600                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 36601                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 36602                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 36603                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 36604                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 36605                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 36606                                  ;
 36607                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 36608                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 36609                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 36610                                  ;
 36611                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 36612                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 36613                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 36614                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 36615                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 36616                                  ;
 36617                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 36618                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 36619                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 36620                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 36621                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 36622                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 36623                                  ;
 36624                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 36625                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 36626                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 36627                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 36628                                  ;   number.
 36629                                  ;
 36630                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 36631                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 36632                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 36633                                  ;   TransPath.
 36634                                  ;
 36635                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 36636                                  
 36637                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 36638                                  
 36639                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 36640                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 36641                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 36642                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 36643                                  ;					; current drive)
 36644                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 36645                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 36646                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 36647                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 36648                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 36649                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 36650                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 36651                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 36652                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 36653                                  
 36654                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 36655                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36656                                  ; Inputs:
 36657                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 36658                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 36659                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 36660                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 36661                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 36662                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 36663                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 36664                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 36665                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 36666                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 36667                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 36668                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 36669                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 36670                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 36671                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 36672                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 36673                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 36674                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 36675                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 36676                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 36677                                  ; Function:
 36678                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 36679                                  ; Returns:
 36680                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 36681                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36682                                  
 36683                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36684                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 36695                                  	;cmp	word [si+45h],0

 36704                                  	;OR	word [SI+curdir.flags],curdir_inuse ; set in_use	;AN000;

 36706                                  resetdrv:

 36753                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 36754                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36755                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 36756                                  ;
 36757                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 36758                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 36759                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 36760                                  ;		'C' clear
 36761                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive
 36762                                  ;	USES	SI, DS, Flags

 36768                                  fdpb5:

 36771 00006AA7 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si]

 36774                                  	;;lds	si,[si+18h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 36775                                  	;lds	si,[si+19h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 36776 00006AAB C57419                  	LDS	SI,[SI+DPB.NEXT_DPB]
 36777 00006AAE EBF2                    	JMP	short fdpb5
 36778                                  fdpb10:	
 36779 00006AB0 F9                      	STC
 36780                                  ret_label15:

 36850                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 36851                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36852                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 36853                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 36854                                  ;
 36855                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 36856                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 36857                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 36858                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 36859                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 36860                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 36861                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 36862                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 36863                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 36864                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 36865                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 36866                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36867                                  
 36868                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36869                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36870                                  _$UserOper:
 36871                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36872                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 36873 00006AFF 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36874 00006B00 2C01                    	SUB	AL,1			; quick dispatch on 0,1
 36875 00006B02 58                      	POP	AX
 36876 00006B03 7211                    	JB	short UserGet 		; return to user the string
 36877 00006B05 742E                    	JZ	short UserSet 		; set the current user
 36878 00006B07 3C05                    	CMP	AL,5			; test for 2,3,4 or 5
 36879 00006B09 763D                    	JBE	short UserPrint		; yep
 36880                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 36881 00006B0B 36C606[2303]01          	MOV	byte [SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ;smr;SS Override 
 36882                                  					; Extended Error Locus
 36883                                  	;error	error_invalid_function	; not 0,1,2,3
 36884                                  	;mov	al,1
 36885 00006B11 B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function
 36886                                  useroper_error:
 36887                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36888                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36889 00006B13 E9779B                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 36890                                  	;jmp	short ASS_ERR
 36891

 36894                                  ; Set Return CX to MYNUM

 36896 00006B17 07                      	POP	ES
 36897 00006B18 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX			; destination
 36898 00006B1A 368B0E[0E00]            	MOV	CX,[SS:MYNUM]		; Get number	;smr;SS Override
 36899 00006B1F E8A899                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 36900                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx

 36902 00006B25 16                      	push	ss			; point to DOSDATA
 36903 00006B26 1F                      	pop	ds
 36904 00006B27 BE[0503]                	MOV	SI,MYNAME		; point source to user string
 36905                                  UserMove:

 36908 00006B2F 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; 16th byte is 0
 36909 00006B31 AA                      	STOSB

 36917 00006B3A 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; user space has source
 36918 00006B3C 16                      	push	ss
 36919 00006B3D 07                      	pop	es

 36922 00006B46 EBE2                    	JMP	short UserMove

 36955                                  ;   GetVisDrv - correctly map non-spliced inuse drives

 36991                                  ;Break <Getthisdrv - map a drive designator (0=def, 1=A...)>
 36992                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36993                                  ;   GetThisDrv - look through a set of macros and return the current drive and
 36994                                  ;	macro pointer

 36997                                  ;   Outputs:

 36999                                  ;		Carry Clear - AL has physical drive (0=A)
