 37074                                  ;Break <GetCDSFromDrv - convert a drive number to a CDS pointer>
 37075                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37076                                  ;   GetCDSFromDrv - given a physical drive number, convert it to a CDS
 37077                                  ;	pointer, returning an error if the drive number is greater than the
 37078                                  ;	number of CDS's
 37079                                  ;
 37080                                  ;   Inputs:	AL is physical unit # A=0...
 37081                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Set if Bad Drive
 37082                                  ;		Carry Clear
 37083                                  ;		    DS:SI -> CDS
 37084                                  ;		    [THISCDS] = DS:SI
 37085                                  ;   Registers modified: DS,SI
 37086                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37087                                  
 37088                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37089                                  GetCDSFromDrv:
 37090 00006BC4 363A06[4700]            	CMP	AL,[SS:CDSCOUNT]	; is this a valid designator;smr;SS Override
 37091 00006BC9 7202                    	JB	SHORT GetCDS		; yes, go get the macro
 37092 00006BCB F9                      	STC				; signal error
 37093 00006BCC C3                      	RETN				; bye
 37094                                  GetCDS:
 37095 00006BCD 53                      	PUSH	BX
 37096 00006BCE 50                      	PUSH	AX
 37097 00006BCF 36C536[3C00]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; get pointer to table	;smr;SS Override
 37098                                  	;mov	bl,81 ; MSDOS 3.3
 37099                                  	;mov	bl,88 ; MSDOS 6.0 
 37100 00006BD4 B358                    	MOV	BL,curdir.size		; size in convenient spot
 37101 00006BD6 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; get net offset
 37102 00006BD8 01C6                    	ADD	SI,AX			; convert to true pointer
 37103 00006BDA 368936[A205]            	MOV	[SS:THISCDS],SI		; store convenient offset;smr;SS Override
 37104 00006BDF 368C1E[A405]            	MOV	[SS:THISCDS+2],DS	; store convenient segment;smr;SS Override
 37105 00006BE4 58                      	POP	AX
 37106 00006BE5 5B                      	POP	BX
 37107 00006BE6 F8                      	CLC				; no error
 37108 00006BE7 C3                      	RETN				; bye!

 37116                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 37117                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37118                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 37119                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 37120                                  ;
 37121                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 37122                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 37123                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 37124                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 37125                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 37126                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 37127                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 37128                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37129                                  
 37130                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37131                                  TransFCB:
 37132                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37133                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37134                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 37135                                  	;ENTER
 37136 00006BE8 55                      	push	bp
 37137 00006BE9 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 37138                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 37139 00006BEB 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 37140 00006BEE 16                      	push	ss
 37141 00006BEF 07                      	pop	es
 37142 00006BF0 06                      	push	es
 37143 00006BF1 57                      	push	di
 37144                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37145                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 37146 00006BF2 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 37147 00006BF5 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 37148 00006BFB 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 37149 00006C01 E8DEB0                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 37150                                  	; 06/12/2022
 37151 00006C04 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 37152 00006C06 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 37153 00006C09 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 37154 00006C0D 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 37155                                  GetDrive:
 37156 00006C13 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 37157 00006C14 E858FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 37158 00006C17 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 37159 00006C19 E87403                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 37160                                  
 37161                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 37162                                  
 37163                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 37164 00006C1C B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 37165 00006C1F 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 37166                                  FCBScan:
 37167 00006C20 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 37168                                  	
 37169                                  	; 09/08/2018
 37170                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 37171                                  	;es	xlat
 37172                                  
 37173                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 37174 00006C21 E81CE5                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 37175                                  
 37176                                  	;test	al,8	
 37177 00006C24 A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 37178 00006C26 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 37179                                  NextCh: 
 37180 00006C28 E2F6                    	loop	FCBScan
 37181 00006C2A 5E                      	pop	si
 37182 00006C2B 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 37183 00006C2D E80AB5                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 37184 00006C30 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 37185 00006C31 07                      	pop	es
 37186 00006C32 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 37187 00006C33 1F                      	pop	ds
 37188                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37189                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 37190 00006C34 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]
 37191 00006C37 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 37192 00006C3A 7407                    	jz	short BadPack
 37193 00006C3C 55                      	push	bp
 37194 00006C3D E80E00                  	call	TransPathSet            ; convert the path
 37195 00006C40 5D                      	pop	bp
 37196 00006C41 7303                    	jnc	short FCBRet		; bye with transPath error code
 37197                                  BadPack:
 37198 00006C43 F9                      	STC
 37199                                  	;mov	al,3
 37200 00006C44 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found
 37201                                  FCBRet: 
 37202                                  	;LEAVE
 37203 00006C46 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 37204 00006C48 5D                      	pop	bp
 37205                                  TransPath_retn:
 37206 00006C49 C3                      	retn

 37210                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 37211                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37212                                  ;
 37213                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 37214                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 37215                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 37216                                  ;       exactly.
 37217                                  ;
 37218                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 37219                                  ;       matches splice.
 37220                                  ;
 37221                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 37222                                  ;
 37223                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 37224                                  ;
 37225                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 37226                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 37227                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 37228                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 37229                                  ;
 37230                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 37231                                  ;
 37232                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 37233                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 37234                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 37235                                  ;
 37236                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 37237                                  ;
 37238                                  ;       if fSharing then
 37239                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 37240                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37241                                  ;           splice
 37242                                  ;           fatRead
 37243                                  ;           return
 37244                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 37245                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 37246                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37247                                  ;           return
 37248                                  ;       if device then
 37249                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 37250                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37251                                  ;           return
 37252                                  ;       if file then
 37253                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 37254                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 37255                                  ;           Copy current dir
 37256                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 37257                                  ;           splice
 37258                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 37259                                  ;           if local then
 37260                                  ;               fatread
 37261                                  ;           return
 37262                                  ;
 37263                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 37264                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 37265                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 37266                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 37267                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 37268                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 37269                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 37270                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 37271                                  ;
 37272                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37273                                  
 37274                                  ; 22/05/2019
 37275                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37276                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37277                                  
 37278                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37279                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37280                                  
 37281                                  TransPath:
 37282 00006C4A 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 37283 00006C4C EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 37284                                  TransPathSet:
 37285 00006C4E B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 37286                                  SetSplice:
 37287 00006C50 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	;   NoSetDir = !fExact; ;smr;SS Override
 37288 00006C54 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 37289                                  TransPathNoSet:
 37290 00006C56 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		;   fSplice = TRUE;     ;smr;SS Override
 37291 00006C5A 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 37292 00006C60 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 37293 00006C65 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 37294 00006C6C 16                      	push	ss
 37295 00006C6D 07                      	pop	es
 37296                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 37297 00006C6E 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 37298                                  ;
 37299                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 37300                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 37301                                  ;
 37302 00006C72 36F606[7205]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 37303 00006C78 7435                    	JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 37304                                  ;
 37305                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 37306                                  ;
 37307 00006C7A E8FC02                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 37308 00006C7D E8EFFE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 37309 00006C80 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 37310 00006C82 E80B03                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 37311 00006C85 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 37312 00006C88 E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 37313 00006C8B 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 37314                                  ;
 37315                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 37316                                  ;
 37317 00006C8D 16                      	push	ss
 37318 00006C8E 1F                      	pop	ds
 37319 00006C8F 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 37320 00006C93 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 37321 00006C98 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 37322 00006C9A E83102                  	CALL    Splice
 37323                                  NoServerSplice:
 37324 00006C9D 16                      	push	ss
 37325 00006C9E 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 37326 00006C9F C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 37327 00006CA3 E8E2A6                  	call	ECritDisk
 37328 00006CA6 E80AEB                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 37329 00006CA9 E8F7A6                  	call	LCritDisk
 37330                                  NoPath:
 37331                                  	;mov	al,3
 37332 00006CAC B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 37333 00006CAE C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 37334                                  
 37335                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 37336                                  ; the name if so.
 37337                                  
 37338                                  CheckUNC:
 37339 00006CAF 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 37340                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 37341 00006CB6 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 37342 00006CB9 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 37343                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 37344                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 37345                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 37346 00006CBB 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 37347                                  
 37348                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 37349                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 37350                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 37351                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 37352                                  
 37353                                  NO_CHECK:
 37354 00006CBD E8B902                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 37355 00006CC0 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 37356 00006CC1 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 37357 00006CC3 E897E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 37358 00006CC6 86E0                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 37359 00006CC8 E892E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 37360 00006CCB 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 37361 00006CCD 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 37362 00006CCF 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 37363                                  
 37364                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 37365                                  ; local machine root path
 37366                                  
 37367 00006CD1 58                      	POP     AX
 37368 00006CD2 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 37369                                  UNCCpy:
 37370 00006CD3 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 37371 00006CD4 E831E4                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 37372 00006CD7 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 37373 00006CD9 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 37374 00006CDB E87FE4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 37375 00006CDE 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 37376 00006CE0 AA                      	STOSB
 37377 00006CE1 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 37378 00006CE3 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 37379                                  UNCDone:
 37380 00006CE6 16                      	push	ss
 37381 00006CE7 1F                      	pop	ds
 37382 00006CE8 C3                       	retn				; return error code
 37383                                  UNCTerm:
 37384 00006CE9 AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 37385 00006CEA EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 37386                                  
 37387                                  CheckDevice:
 37388                                  
 37389                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 37390                                  
 37391 00006CEC 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 37392 00006CED 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 37393 00006CF0 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 37394                                  	;mov	al,2 
 37395 00006CF2 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 37396 00006CF4 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 37397 00006CF5 C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 37398                                  CheckPath:
 37399 00006CF6 50                      	push	ax
 37400 00006CF7 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 37401                                  
 37402                                  
 37403                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37404                                  %if 0
 37405                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37406                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 37407                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 37408                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 37409                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 37410                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 37411                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 37412                                  ;;;
 37413                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 37414                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 37415                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 37416                                  ;;;
 37417                                  ;;;More info:
 37418                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 37419                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 37420                                  ;;;
 37421                                  	call	no5Dshere
 37422                                  start5Dhack:
 37423                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice         
 37424                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 37425                                  
 37426                                  %endif
 37427                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37428                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 37429 00006CF8 E8B8D6                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 37430                                  
 37431 00006CFB 5D                      	pop	bp
 37432 00006CFC 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 37433 00006CFD 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 37434                                  
 37435                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 37436                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS

 37441 00006D08 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 37442                                  
 37443                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 37444                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input

 37456 00006D19 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 37457                                  DoFile_retn:
 37458 00006D1A C3                      	retn
 37459                                  
 37460                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 37462

 37469                                  
 37470                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.

 37516                                  
 37517 00006D45 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 37518 00006D47 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 37519 00006D4B 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 37520 00006D4D AA                      	STOSB
 37521                                  
 37522                                  ; Now get original string.
 37523                                  
 37524                                  GetOrig:
 37525 00006D4E 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 37526 00006D4F 5E                      	pop	si
 37527 00006D50 1F                      	pop	ds
 37528                                  
 37529                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 37530                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 37531                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 37533 00006D51 E8D000                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?

 37537                                  ;
 37538                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 37539                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 37540                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 37541                                  ;
 37542 00006D5A 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 37543                                  SkipPath:

 37551                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in

 37556 00006D69 AA                      	STOSB

 37559                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 37560                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..

 37564                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 37565 00006D6D 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn

 37623                                  
 37624                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 37625                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37626                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 37627                                  ;
 37628                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 37629                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 37630                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 37631                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 37632                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 37633                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 37634                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 37635                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 37636                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 37637                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 37638                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37639                                  
 37640                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37641                                  
 37642                                  Canonicalize:
 37643                                  
 37644                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 37645                                  
 37646 00006DBF AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 37647 00006DC0 E89AE3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 37648 00006DC3 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 37649 00006DC5 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 37650 00006DC7 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 37651 00006DC9 AA                      	STOSB
 37652 00006DCA EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 37653                                  CanonDec:
 37654 00006DCC 4E                      	DEC     SI
 37655                                  
 37656                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 37657                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 37658                                  ; buffer.
 37659                                  
 37660                                  CanonLoop:
 37661                                  
 37662                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 37663                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 37664                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 37665                                  
 37666 00006DCD 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 37667 00006DCF 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 37668 00006DD1 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 37669 00006DD3 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 37670 00006DD8 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 37671 00006DDA B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 37672 00006DDC AA                      	STOSB
 37673 00006DDD 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 37674                                  DoTerminate:
 37675 00006DDF AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 37676 00006DE0 F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 37677 00006DE1 C3                      	retn
 37678                                  
 37679                                  CanonBad:
 37680 00006DE2 E8CC01                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 37681                                  	;mov	al,3

 37684                                  	;mov	al,2

 37686                                  PathEnc:
 37687 00006DEB F9                      	STC
 37688                                  CanonBad_retn:
 37689 00006DEC C3                      	retn
 37690                                  
 37691                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 37692                                  ; it to 8.3
 37693                                  
 37694                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 37695 00006DED E85000                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))
 37696 00006DF0 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);

 37698                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases.  These will be backed up.
 37699                                  
 37700                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)
 37701 00006DF2 26833D2E                	CMP	WORD [ES:DI],002Eh
 37702 00006DF6 7408                    	JZ	short Skip1

 37705 00006DFD 750A                    	JNZ	short CanonNormal
 37706 00006DFF 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           d--;

 37709                                  	;mov	al,3
 37710 00006E03 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 37711 00006E05 72E5                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn
 37712 00006E07 EB02                    	JMP     short CanonPath         ;           }
 37713                                  
 37714                                  ; We have a normal path. Advance destination pointer over it.
 37715

 37717 00006E09 01CF                    	ADD     DI,CX                   ;           d += ct;
 37718                                  
 37719                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path
 37720                                  ; sep char or are pointing at a nul or are pointing at something else.
 37721                                  ; If we point at something else, then we have an error.
 37722

 37737

 37741 00006E1F 74FA                    	JZ	short CanonPathLoop	; yep, grab another
 37742 00006E21 4E                      	DEC     SI                      ; back up
 37743 00006E22 EBA9                    	JMP	short  CanonLoop	; go copy component
 37744                                  
 37745                                  ;BREAK <PathSep - determine if char is a path separator>
 37746                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37747                                  ;   PathSep - look at DS:SI and see if char is / \ or NUL
 37748                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to a char
 37749                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has char from DS:SI (/ => \)
 37750                                  ;               Zero set if AL is / \ or NUL
 37751                                  ;               Zero reset otherwise

 37754                                  
 37755                                  PathSep:

 37763 00006E2A E930E3                  	jmp	PATHCHRCMP

 37765                                  
 37766                                  ;BREAK <SkipBack - move backwards to a path separator>
 37767                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37768                                  ;   SkipBack - look at ES:DI and backup until it points to a / ;   Inputs:     ES:DI - point to a char
 37770                                  ;               BX has current directory back up limit (point to a / \)
 37771                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI backed up to point to a path char
 37772                                  ;               AL has char from output ES:DI (path sep if carry clear)
 37773                                  ;               Carry set if illegal backup
 37774                                  ;               Carry Clear if ok

 37780 00006E2F 720B                    	JB	short SkipBad		;       if (d < dlim)
 37781 00006E31 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           goto err;

 37783 00006E35 E825E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ;           break;
 37784 00006E38 75F3                    	JNZ	short SkipBack		;       }
 37785 00006E3A F8                      	CLC                             ;   return (0);
 37786 00006E3B C3                      	retn				;
 37787                                  SkipBad:                                ;err:
 37788                                  	;mov	al,3
 37789 00006E3C B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; bad path error

 37791 00006E3F C3                      	retn				;
 37792                                  
 37793                                  ;Break <CopyComponent - copy out a file path component>
 37794                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37795                                  ;   CopyComponent - copy a file component from a path string (DS:SI) into ES:DI
 37796                                  ;
 37797                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source path
 37798                                  ;               ES:DI - destination
 37799                                  ;               ES:BP - end of buffer
 37800                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - too long
 37801                                  ;               Carry Clear - DS:SI moved past component
 37802                                  ;                   CX has length of destination

 37805

 37809                                  
 37810                                  %define CopyBP	 [BP]		; word

 37845 00006E6D E82BE2                  	call	NameTrans               ;       s = NameTrans (s, Name1);

 37855 00006E8B 742F                    	JZ	short CopyBadPath	;               return (-1);
 37856                                  DoPack:                                 ;           }

 37858 00006E90 16                      	push	ss

 37866 00006EA0 49                      	DEC     CX
 37867 00006EA1 034E02                  	ADD     CX,CopyDoff ; [bp+2]

 37909                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 37910                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37911                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 37912                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 37913                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 37914                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 37915                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 37916                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 37917                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 37918                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 37919                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 37920                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 37921                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 37922                                  ;                   left alone
 37923                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB
 37924                                  ;   Registers modified: DS:SI, ES:DI, BX,AX,CX
 37925                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37926

 37944                                  	;;test	word [si+67],2000h
 37945                                  	;TEST	word [SI+curdir.flags],curdir_splice
 37946 00006EF1 74F3                    	JZ	short SpliceScan 	;       if ( Spliced (i) ) {
 37947 00006EF3 57                      	push	di
 37948 00006EF4 E8A100                  	CALL    PathPref                ;           if (!PathPref (s, d))
 37949 00006EF7 7403                    	JZ	short SpliceFound	;
 37950                                  SpliceSkip:
 37951 00006EF9 5F                      	pop	di
 37952 00006EFA EBEA                    	JMP	short SpliceScan	;               continue;
 37953                                  SpliceFound:
 37954 00006EFC 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		;           if (*s || NoSetDir) {
 37955 00006F00 7508                    	JNZ	short SpliceDo
 37956 00006F02 36F606[4C03]FF          	TEST	byte [ss:NoSetDir],-1			;smr;SS Override
 37957 00006F08 75EF                    	JNZ	short SpliceSkip
 37958                                  SpliceDo:
 37959 00006F0A 89FE                    	MOV     SI,DI                   ;               p = src + strlen (p);
 37960 00006F0C 06                      	push	es
 37961 00006F0D 1F                      	pop	ds
 37962 00006F0E 5F                      	pop	di
 37963 00006F0F E88000                  	CALL	TextFromDrive1          ;               src = TextFromDrive1(src,i);
 37964 00006F12 36A1[B605]              	MOV     AX,[SS:CURR_DIR_END]			;smr;SS Override
 37965 00006F16 09C0                    	OR      AX,AX
 37966 00006F18 7808                    	JS	short NoPoke
 37967 00006F1A 01F8                    	ADD     AX,DI                   ;               curdirend += src-p;
 37968 00006F1C 29F0                    	SUB     AX,SI
 37969 00006F1E 36A3[B605]              	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],AX			;smr;SS Override
 37970                                  NoPoke:
 37971 00006F22 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		;               if (*p)
 37972 00006F25 7503                    	JNZ	short SpliceCopy	;                   *src++ = '\\';
 37973 00006F27 B05C                    	MOV     AL,"\"
 37974 00006F29 AA                      	STOSB
 37975                                  SpliceCopy:                             ;               strcpy (src, p);
 37976 00006F2A E82DA3                  	call	FStrCpy
 37977 00006F2D 83C404                  	ADD     SP,4                    ; throw away saved stuff
 37978 00006F30 80C901                  	OR      CL,1                    ; signal splice done.
 37979 00006F33 EB0C                    	JMP     SHORT DoSet             ;               return;
 37980                                  SpliceDone:                             ;               }
 37981 00006F35 368F06[A405]            	pop	word [SS:THISCDS+2]     ;   ThisCDS = TmpCDS;
 37982 00006F3A 368F06[A205]            	pop	word [SS:THISCDS]			;smr;SS Override
 37983                                  AllDone:
 37984 00006F3F 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 37985                                  DoSet:

 38000                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 38001                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38002                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 38003                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 38004                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 38005                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 38006                                  ;
 38007                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 38008                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 38009                                  ;   Outputs:
 38010                                  ;       Carry Clear
 38011                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 38012                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 38013                                  ;       Carry Set
 38014                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 38015                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 38016                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38017                                  
 38018                                  _$NameTrans:
 38019 00006F54 1E                      	push	ds
 38020 00006F55 56                      	push	si
 38021 00006F56 06                      	push	es
 38022 00006F57 57                      	push	di
 38023 00006F58 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 38024                                  	
 38025                                  	; MSDOS 6.0	
 38026                                  ; M027 - Start
 38027                                  ;
 38028                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 38029                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 38030                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 38031                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 38032                                  ; and restore CX.
 38033                                  
 38034                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 38035 00006F59 B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 38036 00006F5B E8BA02                  	call	SetAttrib

 38042 00006F61 E8E6FC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 38043 00006F64 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 38044 00006F65 5F                      	pop     di
 38045 00006F66 07                      	pop	es
 38046 00006F67 5E                      	pop     si
 38047 00006F68 1F                      	pop     ds

 38058                                  ;Break   <DriveFromText - return drive number from a text string>
 38059                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38060                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 38061                                  ;   pointer.
 38062                                  ;
 38063                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to a text string
 38064                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has drive number

 38079 00006F8B 75C6                    	jnz	short Splice_retn

 38081 00006F8F C3                      	retn				;           }

 38084                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 38086                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 38087                                  ;

 38103                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 38104                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38105                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 38106                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 38107                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 38108                                  ;
 38109                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 38110                                  ;               ES:DI string
 38111                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 38112                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 38113                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 38114                                  ;   Registers modified: CX

 38117                                  PathPref:

 38119 00006F9B 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 38120 00006F9C F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 38121 00006F9E 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 38122 00006FA0 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 38123 00006FA1 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 38124 00006FA4 E8B6E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 38125 00006FA7 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 38126                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK
 38127 00006FA9 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		; get next char to match
 38128 00006FAC E877FE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 38129                                  Prefix:
 38130 00006FAF 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 38131 00006FB0 C3                      	retn

 38164                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 38165                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 38166                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38167                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 38168                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 38169                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 38170                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 38171                                  ;           INT     int_command
 38172                                  ;
 38173                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 38174                                  ;       ------          --------
 38175                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 38176                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 38177                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 38178                                  ;
 38179                                  ;   Error returns:
 38180                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 38181                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 38182                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 38183                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 38184                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38185                                  
 38186                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 38187                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 38188                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38189                                  ;
 38190                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 38191                                  ;
 38192                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 38193                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 38194                                  ;
 38195                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 38196                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 38197                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 38198                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 38199                                  ;		'C' set if error
 38200                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 38201                                  ;	USES	all
 38202                                  ;
 38203                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38204                                  
 38205                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38206                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38207                                  
 38208                                  _$OPEN:       
 38209 00006FBA 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 38210                                  _$Open2:
 38211                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 38212 00006FBC B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 38213 00006FBE E85702                  	call	SetAttrib

 38215                                  
 38216                                  	;xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 3.3
 38217                                  
 38218 00006FC4 50                      	push	ax
 38219                                  
 38220                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 38221                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 38222                                  ;
 38223                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 38224                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 38225                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 38226                                  ;
 38227                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 38228                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 38229                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 38230                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 38231                                  
 38232                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 38233                                  
 38234                                  AccessFile:
 38235 00006FC5 E8C0A3                  	call	ECritSFT
 38236 00006FC8 E8D3F7                  	call	SFNFree			; get a free sfn
 38237 00006FCB E8D5A3                  	call	LCritSFT
 38238 00006FCE 7214                    	jc	short OpenFailJ		; oops, no free sft's
 38239 00006FD0 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 38240 00006FD5 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 38241 00006FDA 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 38242                                  
 38243                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 38244                                  
 38245 00006FDF E8A9F7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 38246 00006FE2 7303                    	jnc	short SaveJFN
 38247                                  OpenFailJ:
 38248 00006FE4 E99300                  	JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 38249                                  
 38250                                  SaveJFN:
 38251 00006FE7 36893E[AE05]            	mov	[ss:PJFN],DI		; save the jfn offset	;smr;SS Override
 38252 00006FEC 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 38253 00006FF1 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 38254                                  
 38255                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 38256                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 38257                                  
 38258 00006FF6 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 38259 00006FFB 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN
 38260 00006FFE 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 38261 00007000 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 38262 00007003 51                      	push	cx			; save routine to call
 38263 00007004 E843FC                  	call	TransPath		; convert the path

 38265                                  
 38266 00007008 36C536[9E05]            	LDS	SI,[SS:THISSFT]					;smr;SS Override
 38267 0000700D 720A                    	JC	short OpenCleanJ	; no error, go and open file
 38268 0000700F 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1				;smr;SS Override
 38269 00007015 7404                    	JZ	short SetSearch
 38270                                  	;mov	al,2
 38271 00007017 B002                    	MOV	AL,error_file_not_found ; no meta chars allowed
 38272                                  OpenCleanJ:
 38273 00007019 EB50                    	JMP	short OpenClean
 38274                                  
 38275                                  SetSearch:
 38276 0000701B 58                      	pop	ax			; Mode (Open), Attributes (Create)
 38277                                  
 38278                                  ;	We need to get the new inheritance bits.
 38279                                  
 38280 0000701C 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 38281                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38282                                  	;mov	[si+2],cx ; 0
 38283 0000701E 894C02                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],cx ; initialize mode field to 0
 38284                                  	;mov    [si+51],cx ; 0
 38285 00007021 894C33                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],cx	 ; clean out sharing info
 38286                                  	;
 38287 00007024 81FB[DA2B]              	CMP	BX,DOS_OPEN
 38288 00007028 7509                    	JNZ	short _DoOper
 38289                                  	;test   al,80h
 38290 0000702A A880                    	test	AL,SHARING_NO_INHERIT	; look for no inher
 38291 0000702C 7405                    	JZ	short _DoOper ; 10/08/2018
 38292 0000702E 247F                    	AND	AL,7Fh			; mask off inherit bit
 38293                                  	;mov	cx,1000h
 38294 00007030 B90010                  	MOV	CX,sf_no_inherit
 38295                                  _DoOper:
 38296                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3
 38297                                  	;;mov	word [si+2], 0
 38298                                  	;;mov	word [si+33h], 0
 38299                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],0
 38300                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],0
 38301                                  
 38302                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38303                                  ;**	Check if this is an extended open. If so you must set the
 38304                                  ;	modes in sf_mode. Call Set_EXT_mode to do all this. See
 38305                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm
 38306                                  
 38307                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38308                                  	;SAVE	<di, es>                ;M022 conditional removed here
 38309 00007033 57                      	push	di
 38310 00007034 06                      	push	es
 38311 00007035 1E                      	push	ds

 38317 0000703C 07                      	pop	es
 38318 0000703D 5F                      	pop	di
 38319                                  
 38320                                  	;Context DS
 38321 0000703E 16                      	push	ss
 38322 0000703F 1F                      	pop	ds	
 38323

 38325 00007041 FFD3                    	CALL	BX			; blam!
 38326 00007043 59                      	pop	cx
 38327 00007044 C536[9E05]              	LDS	SI,[THISSFT]
 38328 00007048 721A                    	JC	short OpenE2		;AN000;FT. chek extended open hooks first

 38682                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 38683                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38684                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry.  Return a file handle if there
 38685                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 38686                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 38687                                  ;
 38688                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 38689                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 38690                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 38691                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 38692                                  ;		Carry Set:
 38693                                  ;		    AX has error code
 38694                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 38695                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38696                                  
 38697                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 38698 0000717A 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 38699 0000717B B9[7D2B]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 38700 0000717E E914FF                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 38701                                  
 38702                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 38703                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38704                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 38705                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 38706                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 38707                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 38708                                  ;
 38709                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 38710                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 38711                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 38712                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 38713                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38714                                  
 38715                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 38716                                  ;BinToAscii:
 38717                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 38718                                  ;bta5:
 38719                                  ;	push    cx
 38720                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 38721                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 38722                                  ;	push    ax
 38723                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 38724                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 38725                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 38726                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 38727                                  ;	add     al,7
 38728                                  ;bta6: 
 38729                                  ;	stosb
 38730                                  ;	pop     ax
 38731                                  ;	pop     cx
 38732                                  ;	loop    bta5
 38733                                  ;	retn
 38734                                  
 38735                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 38736                                  BinToAscii:
 38737 00007181 B90404                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 38738                                  bta5:	
 38739 00007184 D3C0                    	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 38740 00007186 50                      	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 38741 00007187 240F                    	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 38742 00007189 0441                    	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 38743 0000718B AA                      	STOSB				; drop in the character
 38744 0000718C 58                      	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 38745 0000718D FECD                    	dec	ch
 38746 0000718F 75F3                    	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 38747 00007191 C3                      	retn
 38748                                  
 38749                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 38750                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38751                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 38752                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 38753                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 38754                                  ;
 38755                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 38756                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 38757                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 38758                                  ;		AX has handle
 38759                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 38760                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38761                                  
 38762                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38763                                  
 38764                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 38765                                  	;Enter
 38766 00007192 55                      	push	bp
 38767 00007193 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 38768                                  
 38769                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 38770                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 38771                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 38772                                  
 38773 00007195 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 38774                                  
 38775                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 38776 00007198 F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 38777 0000719C 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 38778                                  
 38779                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 38780                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 38781                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 38782                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 38783                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 38784                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 38785                                  
 38786                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 38787 0000719E B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 38788 000071A1 EB69                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 38789                                  
 38790                                  OKatts:
 38791                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 38792 000071A3 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 38793                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 38794 000071A6 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 38795                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 38796 000071A9 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 38797                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 38798 000071AC 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 38799 000071AF 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 38800 000071B0 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search

 38852                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended

 38904                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through

 38925                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 38926                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38927                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 38928                                  ;	 BX= mode
 38929                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 38930                                  ;	 DX= flag
 38931                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 38932                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 38933                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 38934                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 38935                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 38936                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE

 39146                                  ; 14/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39147                                  ; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39148                                  
 39149                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 39150                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39151                                  ;
 39152                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39153                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 39154                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 39155                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 39156                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 39157                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 39158                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 39159                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 39160                                  ;	    INT     21h
 39161                                  ;
 39162                                  ;   Error returns:
 39163                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 39164                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 39165                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 39166                                  ;
 39167                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39168                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 39169                                  ;
 39170                                  ;				    0? lock all
 39171                                  ;				    8? lock write
 39172                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 39173                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 39174                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 39175                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 39176                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)

 39507                                  ; SHARE_CHECK
 39508                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39509                                  ; Inputs:
 39510                                  ;       [THISSFT] Points to filled in local file/device SFT for new
 39511                                  ;               instance of file sf_mode ALWAYS has mode (even on FCB SFTs)

 39516                                  ;       Check for sharing violations on local file/device access
 39517                                  ; Outputs:
 39518                                  ;    Carry clear

 39533                                  ; SHARE_VIOLATION
 39534                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39535                                  ; Inputs:
 39536                                  ;       [THISDPB] Set
 39537                                  ;       AX has error code
 39538                                  ; Function:

 39550 00007429 57                      	PUSH    DI

 39552                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 39553 0000742F C606[4B03]18            	MOV     byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 39554 00007434 C42E[8A05]              	LES     BP,[THISDPB]
 39555 00007438 BF0100                  	MOV     DI,1			; Fake some registers
 39556 0000743B 89F9                    	MOV     CX,DI

 39558 0000743D 268B5611                	MOV     DX,[ES:BP+DPB.DIR_SECTOR]
