 41150 0000772B F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb			   
 41151                                  
 41152 0000772D 751A                    	jnz	short cp_fail		; Q: does the patch match
 41153                                  					; N: exit
 41154                                  					; Y:	
 41155                                  
 41156                                  		; we do a check sum starting from the location of the 
 41157                                  		; exepack signature 'RB' up to 11c/2 bytes, the end of the
 41158                                  		; unpacking code.
 41159                                  
 41160 0000772F 368B3E[8700]            	mov	di,[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET]	; di -> start of unpack code
 41161 00007734 89D9                    	mov	cx,bx			; cx = length of check sum
 41162                                  
 41163 00007736 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; save check sum passed to us in bx
 41164 00007738 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 41165                                  ep_chksum:
 41166 0000773A 260305                  	add	ax,[es:di]
 41167 0000773D 83C702                  	add	di,2
 41168 00007740 E2F8                    	loop	ep_chksum
 41169                                  
 41170 00007742 5F                      	pop	di			; restore di
 41171                                  
 41172 00007743 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		 	; Q: does the check sum match
 41173 00007745 7502                    	jne	short cp_fail		; N: exit
 41174                                  					; Y: 
 41175 00007747 F8                      	clc	
 41176 00007748 C3                      	retn
 41177                                  
 41178                                  cp_fail:
 41179 00007749 F9                      	stc
 41180 0000774A C3                      	retn
 41181                                  
 41182                                  ; M020 : BEGIN
 41183                                  ;
 41184                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41185                                  ;
 41186                                  ; procedure : RationalPatch
 41187                                  ;
 41188                                  ; A routine (in Ration DOS extender) which is invoked at hardware interrupts
 41189                                  ; clobbers CX register on 286 machines. (123 release 3 uses Rational DOS
 41190                                  ; extender). This routine identifies Buggy Rational EXEs and fixes the bug.
 41191                                  ;
 41192                                  ; THE BUG is in the following code sequence:
 41193                                  ;
 41194                                  ;8b 0e 10 00	mov	cx, ds:[10h]		; delay count
 41195                                  ;90		even				; word align
 41196                                  ;e2 fe		loop	$			; wait		CLOBBERS CX
 41197                                  ;e8 xx xx	call	set_A20			; enable A20
 41198                                  ;
 41199                                  ; This patch routine replaces the mov & the loop with a far call into a
 41200                                  ; routine in DOS data segment which is in low memory (because A20 line
 41201                                  ; is off). The routine (RatBugCode) in DOS data saves & restores CX around
 41202                                  ; a mov & loop.
 41203                                  ;
 41204                                  ; Identification of Buggy Rational EXE
 41205                                  ; ====================================
 41206                                  ;
 41207                                  ; (ALL OFFSETS ARE IN THE PROGRAM SECTION - EXCLUDING THE EXE HEADER)
 41208                                  ;
 41209                                  ; OFFSET				Contains
 41210                                  ; ------				--------
 41211                                  ; 0000h			100 times Version number in binary
 41212                                  ;			bug exists in version 3.48 thru 3.83 (both inclusive)
 41213                                  ;
 41214                                  ; 000ah			the WORDS : 0000h, 0020h, 0000h, 0040h, 0001h
 41215                                  ;
 41216                                  ; 002ah			offset where version number is stored in ASCII
 41217                                  ;				e.g. '3.48A'
 41218                                  ;
 41219                                  ; 0030h			offset of copyright string. Copyright strings either
 41220                                  ;			start with "DOS/16M Copyright...." or
 41221                                  ;			"Copyright.....". The string contains
 41222                                  ;			"Rational Systems, Inc."
 41223                                  ;
 41224                                  ; 0020h			word : Paragraph offset of the buggy code segment
 41225                                  ;				from the program image
 41226                                  ; 0016h			word : size of buggy code segment
 41227                                  ;
 41228                                  ;	Buggy code is definite to start after offset 200h in its segment
 41229                                  ;
 41230                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41231                                  
 41232                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41233                                  ; DOSCODE:B976h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41234                                  
 41235                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41236                                  ; DOSCODE:B654h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41237                                  
 41238                                  RScanPattern1:
 41239 0000774B 000020000000400001-     	db	0, 0, 20h, 0, 0, 0, 40h, 0, 1, 0
 41239 00007754 00                 
 41240                                  
 41241                                  RLen1 equ $ - RScanPattern1
 41242                                  
 41243                                  RScanPattern2:
 41244 00007755 8B0E100090E2FEE8        	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 90h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 41245                                  
 41246                                  RLen2 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 41247                                  
 41248                                  RScanPattern3:
 41249 0000775D 8B0E1000E2FEE8          	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 41250                                  
 41251                                  RLen3 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 41252                                  
 41253                                  ; DOSCODE:B98Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41254                                  ; DOSCODE:B66Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41255                                  
 41256                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41257                                  ;
 41258                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 41259                                  ;
 41260                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41261                                  
 41262                                  RationalPatch:
 41263 00007764 FC                      	cld
 41264 00007765 50                      	push	ax
 41265 00007766 53                      	push	bx
 41266 00007767 51                      	push	cx
 41267 00007768 52                      	push	dx
 41268 00007769 56                      	push	si
 41269 0000776A 57                      	push	di
 41270 0000776B 06                      	push	es
 41271 0000776C 1E                      	push	ds			; we use all of them
 41272 0000776D BF0A00                  	mov	di,0Ah			; look for pat1 at offset 0Ah
 41273 00007770 0E                      	push	cs
 41274 00007771 1F                      	pop	ds
 41275                                  	
 41276 00007772 BE[4B77]                	mov	si,RScanPattern1
 41277                                  	;mov	cx,10
 41278 00007775 B90A00                  	mov	cx,RLen1
 41279 00007778 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb			; do we have the pattern ?
 41280 0000777A 754A                    	jne	short rpexit
 41281 0000777C 26A10000                	mov	ax,[es:0]
 41282 00007780 3D5C01                  	cmp	ax,348			; is it a buggy version ?
 41283 00007783 7241                    	jb	short rpexit
 41284 00007785 3D7F01                  	cmp	ax,383			; is it a buggy version
 41285 00007788 773C                    	ja	short rpexit
 41286                                  
 41287 0000778A E85A00                  	call	VerifyVersion
 41288 0000778D 7537                    	jne	short rpexit
 41289                                  
 41290 0000778F 268B0E1600              	mov	cx,[es:16h]		; Length of buggy code seg
 41291 00007794 81E90002                	sub	cx,200h			; Length we search (we start
 41292                                  					;  at offset 200h)
 41293 00007798 268E062000              	mov	es,[es:20h]		; es=buggy code segment
 41294 0000779D BE[5577]                	mov	si,RScanPattern2
 41295                                  	;mov	dx,8	
 41296 000077A0 BA0800                  	mov	dx,RLen2
 41297 000077A3 E82900                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq with nop
 41298 000077A6 740B                    	jz	short rpfound
 41299                                  
 41300 000077A8 BE[5D77]                	mov	si,RScanPattern3
 41301                                  	;mov	dx,15
 41302 000077AB BA0F00                  	mov	dx,RLen3
 41303 000077AE E81E00                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq w/o nop
 41304 000077B1 7513                    	jnz	short rpexit
 41305                                  
 41306                                  rpfound:
 41307                                  	
 41308                                  ;	we set up a far call into DOS data
 41309                                  ;	dx has the length of the code seq we were searching for
 41310                                  
 41311 000077B3 B09A                    	mov	al,9Ah			; far call opcode
 41312 000077B5 AA                      	stosb
 41313 000077B6 B8[1612]                	mov	ax,RatBugCode
 41314 000077B9 AB                      	stosw
 41315 000077BA 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss
 41316 000077BC AB                      	stosw
 41317 000077BD 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 41318 000077BF 83E906                  	sub	cx,6			; filler (with NOPs)
 41319 000077C2 B090                    	mov	al,90h
 41320 000077C4 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 41321                                  rpexit:
 41322 000077C6 1F                      	pop	ds
 41323 000077C7 07                      	pop	es
 41324 000077C8 5F                      	pop	di
 41325 000077C9 5E                      	pop	si
 41326 000077CA 5A                      	pop	dx
 41327 000077CB 59                      	pop	cx
 41328 000077CC 5B                      	pop	bx
 41329 000077CD 58                      	pop	ax
 41330 000077CE C3                      	retn
 41331                                  
 41332                                  ; M020 END
 41333                                  
 41334                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41335                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41336                                  
 41337                                  ; DOSCODE:B6D8h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41338                                  
 41339                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41340                                  ;
 41341                                  ; ScanCodeSeq
 41342                                  ;
 41343                                  ; Looks for a pattern pointed to by DS:SI & len DX in ES:200 to ES:200+CX-1
 41344                                  ;
 41345                                  ; returns in ES:DI the start of the pattern if Zero flag is set
 41346                                  ;
 41347                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41348                                  
 41349                                  ScanCodeSeq:
 41350                                  	; 17/12/2022
 41351 000077CF BF0002                  	mov	di,200h
 41352                                  ;ScanCodeSeq_di:
 41353 000077D2 51                      	push	cx
 41354 000077D3 29D1                    	sub	cx,dx
 41355 000077D5 41                      	inc	cx
 41356                                  	; 17/12/2022
 41357                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41358                                  	;mov	di,200h
 41359                                  scsagain:
 41360 000077D6 56                      	push	si
 41361 000077D7 57                      	push	di
 41362 000077D8 51                      	push	cx
 41363 000077D9 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 41364 000077DB F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 41365 000077DD 59                      	pop	cx
 41366 000077DE 5F                      	pop	di
 41367 000077DF 5E                      	pop	si
 41368 000077E0 7403                    	je	short scsfound
 41369 000077E2 47                      	inc	di
 41370 000077E3 E2F1                    	loop	scsagain
 41371                                  scsfound:
 41372 000077E5 59                      	pop	cx
 41373                                  vvexit:		; 18/12/2022
 41374 000077E6 C3                      	retn
 41375                                  
 41376                                  
 41377                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41378                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41379                                  
 41380                                  ; DOSCODE:B6F0h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41381                                  
 41382                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41383                                  ;
 41384                                  ; VerifyVersion
 41385                                  ;
 41386                                  ; Checks whether the binary version from ES:0 matches the ASCII version
 41387                                  ; from ES:2A.
 41388                                  ;
 41389                                  ;       Entry: AX = binary version number 
 41390                                  ;       Exit : Z flag set if version numbers match
 41391                                  ;
 41392                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41393                                  
 41394                                  VerifyVersion:
 41395 000077E7 268B362A00              	mov	si,[es:2Ah]		; offset of version number
 41396                                  					;  in ascii
 41397 000077EC B30A                    	mov	bl,10
 41398 000077EE 83C603                  	add	si,3			; point to last digit
 41399                                  
 41400 000077F1 E80E00                  	call	VVDigit
 41401 000077F4 75F0                    	jne	short vvexit
 41402 000077F6 E80900                  	call	VVDigit
 41403 000077F9 75EB                    	jne	short vvexit
 41404 000077FB 26803C2E                	cmp	byte [es:si],'.' ; 2Eh
 41405 000077FF 75E5                    	jne	short vvexit
 41406 00007801 4E                      	dec	si
 41407                                  	;call	VVDigit
 41408                                  	; 18/12/2022
 41409                                  	;jmp	short VVDigit
 41410                                  ;vvexit:
 41411                                  	;retn
 41412                                  VVDigit:
 41413 00007802 F6F3                    	div	bl
 41414 00007804 80C430                  	add	ah,'0' ; 30h
 41415 00007807 4E                      	dec	si
 41416 00007808 26386401                	cmp	[es:si+1],ah
 41417 0000780C B400                    	mov	ah,0			; do not xor or sub we need Z
 41418 0000780E C3                      	retn

 41420                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41421                                  ;
 41422                                  ;	M068
 41423                                  ;
 41424                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: IsCopyProt
 41425                                  ;
 41426                                  ;	Inputs		: DS:100 -> start of com file just read in
 41427                                  ;
 41428                                  ;	Outputs		: sets the A20OFF_COUNT variable to 10 if 
 41429                                  ;			  the program loaded in DS:100 uses a MICROSOFT
 41430                                  ;			  copy protect scheme that relies on the A20 line
 41431                                  ;			  being turned off for it's scheme to work.
 41432                                  ;
 41433                                  ;			  Note: The int 21 function dispatcher will turn 
 41434                                  ;				a20 off, if the A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero 
 41435                                  ;				and dec the A20OFF_COUNT before	iretting 
 41436                                  ;				to the user. 
 41437                                  ;
 41438                                  ;	Uses		: ES, DI, SI, CX
 41439                                  ;
 41440                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41441                                  
 41442                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41443                                  
 41444                                  CPStartOffset	EQU	0175h
 41445                                  CPID1Offset	EQU	011Bh
 41446                                  CPID2Offset	EQU	0173h
 41447                                  CPID3Offset	EQU	0146h
 41448                                  CPID4Offset	EQU	0124h
 41449                                  ID1		EQU	05343h
 41450                                  ID2		EQU	05044h
 41451                                  ID3		EQU	0F413h
 41452                                  ID4		EQU	08000h
 41453                                  
 41454                                  ; DOSCODE:B9FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41455                                  
 41456                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41457                                  ; DOSCODE:B71Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41458                                  
 41459                                  CPScanPattern:
 41460 0000780F 89264801                	db	89h,26h,48h,01h		 ; mov [148],sp
 41461 00007813 8C0E4C01                	db	8Ch,0Eh,4Ch,01h		 ; mov [14C],cs
 41462 00007817 C7064A010001            	db	0C7h,06h,4Ah,01h,00h,01h ; mov [14A],100h 
 41463 0000781D 8C0E1301                	db 	8Ch,0Eh,13h,01h		 ; mov [113],cs
 41464 00007821 B82001                  	db	0B8h,20h,01h		 ; mov ax,120h
 41465 00007824 BE0001                  	db	0BEh,00h,01h		 ; mov si,100h
 41466                                  
 41467                                  CPSPlen	EQU $ - CPScanPattern
 41468                                  
 41469                                  ; DOSCODE:BA12h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41470                                  ; DOSCODE:B734h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41471                                  
 41472                                  IsCopyProt:
 41473 00007827 813E1B014353            	cmp	word [CPID1Offset],ID1
 41474 0000782D 752D                    	jne	short CP_done
 41475                                  
 41476 0000782F 813E73014450            	cmp	word [CPID2Offset],ID2
 41477 00007835 7525                    	jne	short CP_done
 41478                                  
 41479 00007837 813E460113F4            	cmp	word [CPID3Offset],ID3
 41480 0000783D 751D                    	jne	short CP_done
 41481                                  
 41482 0000783F 813E24010080            	cmp	word [CPID4Offset],ID4
 41483 00007845 7515                    	jne	short CP_done
 41484                                  
 41485 00007847 0E                      	push	cs
 41486 00007848 07                      	pop	es
 41487 00007849 BF[0F78]                	mov	di,CPScanPattern	; es:di -> Pattern to find
 41488                                  
 41489 0000784C BE7501                  	mov	si,CPStartOffset	; ds:si -> possible location 
 41490                                  					; of pattern
 41491                                  
 41492 0000784F B91800                  	mov	cx,CPSPlen ; 24		; cx = length of pattern
 41493 00007852 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 41494 00007854 7506                    	jnz	short CP_done
 41495                                  
 41496 00007856 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; M071
 41497                                  CP_done:
 41498 0000785C C3                      	retn

 41564                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 41565                                  DOSINIT:

 41567                                  	;
 41568                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 41569                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 41570                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 41571                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 41572                                  	;

 41574                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 41575

 41577 0000786E FC                              CLD

 42398                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42399                                  ;
 42400                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 42401                                  ;
 42402                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 42403                                  ;
 42404                                  ;	USED:	none
 42405                                  ;
 42406                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42407                                  
 42408                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 42409                                  ;
 42410                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 42411                                  ;
 42412 00007B61 50                      	push	ax
 42413                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 42414 00007B62 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 42415 00007B65 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 42416                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 42417                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 42418                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 42419 00007B67 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 42420 00007B69 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 42421                                  ;
 42422                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 42423                                  ; need to call it later.
 42424                                  ;
 42425 00007B6B 53                      	push	bx
 42426 00007B6C 52                      	push	dx
 42427 00007B6D 1E                      	push	ds
 42428 00007B6E 06                      	push	es
 42429                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 42430 00007B6F B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 42431 00007B72 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 42432                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 42433                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 42434                                  
 42435 00007B74 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42436                                  
 42437 00007B79 891E[6311]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 42438 00007B7D 8C06[6511]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 42439                                  cXMMexit:
 42440 00007B81 F8                      	clc
 42441 00007B82 07                      	pop	es
 42442 00007B83 1F                      	pop	ds
 42443 00007B84 5A                      	pop	dx
 42444 00007B85 5B                      	pop	bx
 42445 00007B86 58                      	pop	ax
 42446 00007B87 C3                      	retn				; done
 42447                                  ;
 42448                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 42449                                  ;
 42450                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 42451 00007B88 F9                      	stc
 42452 00007B89 58                      	pop	ax
 42453 00007B8A C3                      	retn

 42455                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42456                                  ;
 42457                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 42458                                  ;
 42459                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 42460                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 42461                                  ;
 42462                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 42463                                  ;		   if AX =0
 42464                                  ;		      if first entry
 42465                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 42466                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 42467                                  ;		      else
 42468                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 42469                                  ;
 42470                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 42471                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES	
 42472                                  ;
 42473                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 42474                                  ;
 42475                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 42476                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42477                                  
 42478 00007B8B 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 42479                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 42480                                  
 42481                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 42482                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 42483                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 42484                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 42485                                  
 42486                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 42487 00007B8C 1E                      	push	ds
 42488                                  
 42489 00007B8D 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42490                                  
 42491 00007B92 E8B500                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 42492                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 42493                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42494                                  	; cx = 0
 42495 00007B95 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 42496                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 42497 00007B97 756C                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 42498                                  
 42499                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42500 00007B99 2E380E[8B7B]            	cmp	[cs:num_entry],cl ; 0
 42501                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:num_entry],0	; Q: is it the first call to this 
 42502 00007B9E 7508                    	jne	short second_entry	; N: just patch the stub with 
 42503                                  					;    segment in ES
 42504                                  					; Y: patch the vectors with stub 
 42505 00007BA0 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 42506 00007BA2 E86D00                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch the segment of vectors
 42507 00007BA5 E8EC00                  	call	patch_offset		; patch the offsets of vectors 
 42508                                  					; with those in the stub.
 42509                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42510                                  	; cx = 0
 42511                                  second_entry:
 42512 00007BA8 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; patch the stub with segment in es
 42513                                  
 42514                                  	;mov	di,OFFSET DOSDATA:DOSINTTABLE
 42515                                  	;mov	di,1062h	; (same table addr for MSDOS 5.0 and MSDOS 6.21)
 42516 00007BAA BF[6210]                	mov	di,DOSINTTABLE
 42517                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42518                                  	; cx = 0
 42519                                  	;mov	cx,9
 42520 00007BAD B109                    	mov	cl,9
 42521 00007BAF 1E                      	push	ds			
 42522 00007BB0 07                      	pop	es			; es:di -> DOSINTTABLE
 42523                                  
 42524                                  dosinttabloop:
 42525 00007BB1 83C702                  	add	di,2
 42526 00007BB4 AB                      	stosw
 42527 00007BB5 E2FA                    	loop	dosinttabloop	
 42528                                  
 42529                                  ; For ROMDOS, this routine will only be called when the DOS wants to
 42530                                  ; use the HMA, so we don't want to check CS
 42531                                  
 42532                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 42533 00007BB7 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; Q: is the DOS running in the HMA
 42534 00007BBA 724E                    	jb	short sr_done		; N: done
 42535                                  ;endif
 42536 00007BBC E8A2FF                  	call	check_XMM		; Y: set up the XMS entry point
 42537 00007BBF 7249                    	jc	short sr_done		; failed to set up XMS do not do
 42538                                  					; A20 toggling in the stub.
 42539                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42540                                  	; cx = 0
 42541 00007BC1 E84B01                  	call	patch_in_nops		; enable the stub to check A20 state
 42542                                  ; M021-
 42543                                  	;mov	byte [1211h],1
 42544 00007BC4 C606[1112]01            	mov	byte [DosHasHMA],1	; set flag telling DOS control of HMA 
 42545                                  				
 42546                                  					; set pointer to the routine that 
 42547                                  					; patches buggy exepacked code.
 42548                                  	;mov	[FixExePatch],offset DOSCODE:ExePatch
 42549 00007BC9 C706[1212][2776]        	mov	word [FixExePatch],ExePatch
 42550                                  					; M068: set pointer to the routine 
 42551                                  					; M068: that detects copy protected
 42552                                  					; M068: apps
 42553                                  	;mov	[ChkCopyProt],offset DOSCODE:IsCopyProt
 42554 00007BCF C706[6100][2778]        	mov	word [ChkCopyProt],IsCopyProt
 42555                                  
 42556                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDF1h
 42557                                  
 42558                                  ;	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42559                                  ;
 42560                                  ;; M020 - begin
 42561                                  ;
 42562                                  ;	call	WhatCPUType
 42563                                  ;	cmp	al,1
 42564                                  ;	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 42565                                  ;					;  on 286 systems
 42566                                  ;	;mov	[RationalPatchPtr],offset DOSCODE:RationalPatch
 42567                                  ;	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 42568                                  ;
 42569                                  ;; M020 - end
 42570                                  ;
 42571                                  ;	jmp	short sr_done
 42572                                  ;
 42573                                  ;patch_vec_seg:				; patch vectors with segment in es
 42574                                  ;	mov	ax,es
 42575                                  ;	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch in DOSCODE for the segments
 42576                                  ;					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 42577                                  ;					; offsets as they have been already
 42578                                  ;					; set to the doscode offsets at
 42579                                  ;					; DOSINIT.
 42580                                  ;sr_done:
 42581                                  ;	mov	byte [cs:num_entry],1
 42582                                  ;	pop	ds
 42583                                  ;	retf	; ! far return !
 42584                                  
 42585                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42586                                  ;
 42587                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 42588                                  ;
 42589                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 42590                                  ;
 42591                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 42592                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 42593                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 42594                                  ;
 42595                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 42596                                  ;
 42597                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42598                                  
 42599                                  WhatCPUType:
 42600                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42601                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 42602                                  
 42603                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 42604                                  
 42605                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 42606                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 42607                                  ;
 42608                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 42609                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 42610                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 42611                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 42612                                  
 42613                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42614                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 42615                                  
 42616                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 42617 00007BD5 9C                      	pushf
 42618 00007BD6 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 42619 00007BD7 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 42620                                  
 42621 00007BD9 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 42622 00007BDB 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 42623 00007BDC 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 42624 00007BDD 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 42625 00007BDE 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 42626 00007BDF 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 42627 00007BE2 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 42628 00007BE5 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 42629                                  
 42630 00007BE7 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 42631 00007BEA 50                      	push	ax
 42632 00007BEB 9D                      	popf
 42633 00007BEC 9C                      	pushf
 42634 00007BED 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 42635 00007BEE 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 42636 00007BF1 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 42637                                  
 42638                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 42639 00007BF3 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 42640                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 42641 00007BF4 43                      	inc	bx
 42642                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 42643 00007BF5 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 42644 00007BF7 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 42645 00007BF8 9D                      	popf
 42646                                  	
 42647                                  	;endm
 42648                                  
 42649                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42650                                  	;retn
 42651                                  
 42652                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42653                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB27h
 42654 00007BF9 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 42655 00007BFB 750D                    	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 42656                                  					;  on 286 systems
 42657 00007BFD C706[1412][6477]        	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 42658                                  
 42659 00007C03 EB05                    	jmp	short sr_done
 42660                                  
 42661                                  patch_vec_seg:				; patch vectors with segment in es
 42662 00007C05 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 42663 00007C07 E80800                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch in DOSCODE for the segments
 42664                                  					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 42665                                  					; offsets as they have been already
 42666                                  					; set to the doscode offsets at
 42667                                  					; DOSINIT.
 42668                                  sr_done:
 42669 00007C0A 2EC606[8B7B]01          	mov	byte [cs:num_entry],1
 42670 00007C10 1F                      	pop	ds
 42671 00007C11 CB                      	retf	; ! far return !
 42672                                  
 42673                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42674                                  ;
 42675                                  ; Procedure Name : patch_vec_segments
 42676                                  ;
 42677                                  ; Inputs	 : ax -> has segment address to patch in
 42678                                  ;		   ds -> DOSDATA
 42679                                  ;
 42680                                  ; Outputs	 : Patches in AX as the segment for the following vectors:
 42681                                  ;			
 42682                                  ;			0,20-28,3a-3f
 42683                                  ;

 42697

 42699

 42704                                  	;mov	cl,2

 42711                                  	;loop	ps_set1
 42712                                  
 42713                                  	; 17/12/2022

 42715                                  	;inc	di
 42716                                  	;inc	di
 42717                                  
 42718                                  	;add	di,4			; skip int 22h vector
 42719 00007C22 83C706                  	add	di,6 ; *
 42720

 42722 00007C26 83C706                  	add	di,6			; skip int 24h
 42723                                  
 42724                                  					; set vectors 25-28 and 2a-3f 
 42725                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42726                                  	;mov	cx,4			; set 4 segments
 42727                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42728 00007C29 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 42729                                  ps_set2:
 42730 00007C2B AB                      	stosw				
 42731                                  	;add	di,2
 42732                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42733 00007C2C 47                      	inc	di
 42734 00007C2D 47                      	inc	di
 42735 00007C2E E2FB                    	loop	ps_set2
 42736                                  
 42737 00007C30 83C704                  	add	di,4			; skip int 29h vector (fast con) as it may
 42738                                  					;   already be set.
 42739                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42740                                  	;mov	cx,6			; set 6 segs (skip 2 between each)
 42741                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42742 00007C33 B106                    	mov	cl,6			;  set segs for ints 2ah-2fh
 42743                                  ps_set3:
 42744 00007C35 AB                      	stosw
 42745                                  	;add	di,2
 42746                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42747 00007C36 47                      	inc	di
 42748 00007C37 47                      	inc	di
 42749 00007C38 E2FB                    	loop	ps_set3
 42750                                  
 42751                                  ; 30h & 31H is the CPM call entry point whose segment address is set up by
 42752                                  ; below. So skip it.
 42753                                  
 42754 00007C3A 83C708                  	add	di,8			; skip vector 30h & 31h 
 42755                                  	
 42756                                  	; 04/11/2022

 42758                                  	; 17/12/2022

 42760                                  ps_set4:

 42763                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42764 00007C40 47                      	inc	di

 42767

 42772                                  ;endif

 43020                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43021                                  ;
 43022                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 43023                                  ;
 43024                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 43025                                  ;
 43026                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 43027                                  ;
 43028                                  ;	Description:
 43029                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 43030                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 43031                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 43032                                  ;
 43033                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43034                                  
 43035                                  	; 04/11/2022
 43036                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43037                                  	; DOSCODE:0BC50h
 43038                                  
 43039                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 43040                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 43041                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 43042                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 43043                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 43044                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 43045                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 43046                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 43047                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 43048 00007CFF [8A10]                  	dw	i0patch
 43049 00007D01 [9410]                  	dw	i20patch
 43050 00007D03 [9E10]                  	dw	i21patch
 43051 00007D05 [A810]                  	dw	i25patch
 43052 00007D07 [B210]                  	dw	i26patch
 43053 00007D09 [BC10]                  	dw	i27patch
 43054 00007D0B [C610]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 43055 00007D0D [D010]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 43056                                  
 43057                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 43058                                  
 43059                                  patch_in_nops:
 43060 00007D0F 50                      	push	ax
 43061 00007D10 56                      	push	si
 43062 00007D11 BE[FF7C]                	mov	si,patch_table
 43063 00007D14 B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 43064                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43065                                  	; cx = 0
 43066                                  	;mov	cx,8
 43067                                  	;mov	cx,patch_table_size ; 8
 43068 00007D17 B108                    	mov	cl,patch_table_size ; 8
 43069                                  pin_loop:
 43070 00007D19 2E8B3C                  	mov	di,[cs:si]
 43071 00007D1C AB                      	stosw
 43072                                  	;add	si,2
 43073                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43074 00007D1D 46                      	inc	si
 43075 00007D1E 46                      	inc	si
 43076 00007D1F E2F8                    	loop	pin_loop
 43077 00007D21 5E                      	pop	si
 43078 00007D22 58                      	pop	ax
 43079 00007D23 C3                      	retn
 43080                                  
 43081                                  ; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 43265                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 43266                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 43267                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 43268                                  ;;
 43269                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 43270                                  ;;
 43271                                  ;;	on return:
 43272                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 43273                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 43274                                  ;;
 43275                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 43276                                  ;;
 43277                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 43278                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 43279                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 43280                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 43281                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 43282                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 43283                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 43284                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 43285                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 43286                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 43287                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 43288                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 43289                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 43290                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 43291                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 43292                                  ;;
 43293                                  ;;***************************************************************************

 43501                                  ;============================================================================
 43502                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 43503                                  ;============================================================================
 43504                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 43505                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 43506                                  
 43507                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 43508                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43509                                  
 43510                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 43511                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 43512                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 43513                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 43514                                  ;
 43515                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 43516                                  ; describing that data item.
 43517                                  
 43518                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 43519                                  
 43520                                  ;
 43521                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 43522                                  ;
 43523                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 43524                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 43525                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 43526                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 43527                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 43528                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 43529                                  ;
 43530                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 43531                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 43532                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 43533                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 43534                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 43535                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 43536                                  ;   as EOF).
 43537                                  
 43538                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 43539                                  
 43540                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 43541                                  
 43542                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 43543 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 43544 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 43545 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 43546                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0
 43547 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 43548                                  
 43549                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 43550                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 43551                                  ; console.
 43552                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21)
 43553 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 43554 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 43555                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 43556 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 43557 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 43558                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21)
 43559 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 43560 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 43561 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b		; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 43562                                  switch_character:
 43563 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused

 43767                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 43768                                  
 43769                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 43770                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 43771                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 43772                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 43773                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 43774                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 43775                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 43776                                  ; **********************************************************
 43777                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 43778                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 43779                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 43780                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 43781                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 43782                                  ; **********************************************************	
 43783                                  
 43784                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 43785                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43786                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 43787                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 43788                                  
 43789                                  ; 	ORG     0
 43790                                  
 43791                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 43792                                  
 43793                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 43794                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 43795 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 43796 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 43797                                  
 43798                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 43799

 43803                                  RENBUF:	
 43804 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 43805                                  
 43806                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 43807                                  SEARCHBUF:

 43809                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0

 44041                                  ; Say What????!!! This does NOT go into the swappable area!
 44042                                  ; NOTE: We include the decl of ibmpatch in ms-dos even though it is not needed.
 44043                                  ;       This allows the REDIRector to work on either IBM or MS-DOS.
 44044                                   
 44045                                  IBMPATCH: ; label byte
 44046                                  PRINTER_FLAG:
 44047 00000AA0 00                      	db	0		; [SYSTEM] status of PRINT utility
 44048                                  VOLCHNG_FLAG:
 44049 00000AA1 00                      	db	0		; [SYSTEM] true if volume label created
 44050                                  VIRTUAL_OPEN:
 44051 00000AA2 00                      	db	0		; [SYSTEM] non-zero if we opened a virtual file
 44052                                   
 44053                                  ; Following 4 variables moved to MSDATA.asm from MSTABLE.asm (P4986)
 44054                                  
 44055                                  FSeek_drive:
 44056 00000AA3 00                      	db	0		;AN000; fastseek drive #
 44057                                  FSeek_firclus:
 44058 00000AA4 0000                    	dw	0		;AN000; fastseek first cluster #
 44059                                  FSeek_logclus:
 44060 00000AA6 0000                    	dw	0		;AN000; fastseek logical cluster #
 44061                                  FSeek_logsave:
 44062 00000AA8 0000                    	dw	0		;AN000; fastseek returned log clus #
 44063                                  
 44064                                  ; DOSDATA:0AAAh
 44065                                  
 44066                                  TEMP_DOSLOC:
 44067 00000AAA FFFF                    	dw	-1		;stores the temporary location of dos
 44068                                  				;at SYSINIT time.
 44069                                  SWAP_END:  ; LABEL   BYTE
 44070                                   
 44071                                  ; THE FOLLOWING BYTE MUST BE HERE, IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING SWAP_END. IT CANNOT
 44072                                  ; BE USED. If the size of the swap data area is ODD, it will be rounded up
 44073                                  ; to include this byte.
 44074                                   
 44075 00000AAC 00                      	db	0
 44076

 44078

 44080

 44233                                  
 44234                                  ; DOSDATA:0CF5h
 44235                                  
 44236                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44237                                  ;
 44238                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 44239                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 44240                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 44241                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 44242                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 44243                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44244                                  ; Example:
 44245                                  
 44246                                  MAP_CASE:
 44247                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 44248                                  
 44249 00000CF5 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 44250 00000CF7 7301                    	JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 44251 00000CF9 CB                      	RETF
 44252                                  Map1:
 44253 00000CFA 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 44254 00000CFC 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 44255 00000CFD 53                      	PUSH	BX
 44256 00000CFE BB[AF0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 44257                                  FINISH:
 44258 00000D01 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 44259 00000D02 1F                      	POP	DS
 44260 00000D03 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 44261 00000D04 5B                      	POP	BX
 44262 00000D05 1F                      	POP	DS
 44263                                  L_RET:	
 44264 00000D06 CB                      	RETF
 44265                                  
 44266                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 44267                                  
 44268                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44269

 44512                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 44513                                  ; 
 44514                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 44515                                  ;
 44516                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 44517                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 44518                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 44519                                  ;
 44520                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 44521                                  ;
 44522                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 44523                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 44524                                  ;
 44525                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 44526                                  ;
 44527                                  ;############################################################################
 44528                                  
 44529                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 44530                                  
 44531                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44532                                  
 44533                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44534                                  ;
 44535                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 44536                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 44537                                  ;
 44538                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 44539                                  ;
 44540                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 44541                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 44542                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 44543                                  ;
 44544                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44545                                  
 44546                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 44547                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 44548                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 44549                                  ;ELSE
 44550                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 44551                                  ;ENDIF
 44552                                  ;ENDM
 44553

 44832                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44833                                  ; 04/11/2022
 44834                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 44835                                  
 44836                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44837                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 44838                                  ;
 44839                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the 
 44840                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data) 
 44841                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 44842                                  ;
 44843                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 44844                                  ;
 44845                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 44846                                  ;
 44847                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44848                                  
 44849 00001044 36F6062003FF            	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 44850 0000104A 750C                    	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 44851 0000104C 36FF365803              	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 44852 00001051 CD28                    	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 44853                                  
 44854                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44855                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 44856                                  ;
 44857                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 44858                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in 
 44859                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 44860                                  ;
 44861                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44862                                  
 44863 00001053 803E200300              	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 44864 00001058 7537                    	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 44865 0000105A BCA00A                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
 44866                                  
 44867                                  ; DOSDATA:105Dh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44868                                  
 44869                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44870                                  
 44871                                  ;*** New FCB Implementation
 44872                                  ; This variable is used as a cache in the new FCB implementation to remember
 44873                                  ;the address of a local SFT that can be recycled for a regenerate operation
 44874                                  
 44875 0000105D 00000000                LocalSFT: dd	0		; 0 to indicate invalid pointer
 44876                                  
 44877                                  ;DOSDATA ENDS

 44887                                  ;	Low Memory Stub for DOS when DOS runs in HMA
