 44893 00001061 90                      align 2
 44894                                  
 44895                                  ; DOSDATA:1062h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44896                                  
 44897                                  DOSINTTABLE:	; LABEL	DWORD
 44898                                  
 44899                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:DIVOV 		, 0
 44900                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:QUIT 		, 0
 44901                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:COMMAND		, 0
 44902                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:ABSDRD		, 0
 44903                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:ABSDWRT		, 0
 44904                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:Stay_resident	, 0
 44905                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:INT2F		, 0
 44906                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:CALL_ENTRY	, 0
 44907                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:IRETT		, 0
 44908                                  	
 44909 00001062 [4853]0000              	dw	DIVOV 		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+0
 44910 00001066 [1B03]0000              	dw	QUIT 		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+4	
 44911 0000106A [4703]0000              	dw	COMMAND		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+8
 44912 0000106E [7A05]0000              	dw	ABSDRD		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+12
 44913 00001072 [0106]0000              	dw	ABSDWRT		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+16
 44914 00001076 [9662]0000              	dw	STAY_RESIDENT	, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+20
 44915 0000107A [5007]0000              	dw	INT2F		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+24
 44916 0000107E [2203]0000              	dw	CALL_ENTRY	, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+28
 44917 00001082 [2103]0000              	dw	IRETT		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+32
 44918                                  
 44919 00001086 0000                    SS_Save: dw	0		; save user's stack segment
 44920 00001088 0000                    SP_Save: dw	0		; save user's stack offset
 44921                                  
 44922                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44923                                  ;
 44924                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 44925                                  ;
 44926                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts 
 44927                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the 
 44928                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 44929                                  ;
 44930                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 44931                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 44932                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 44933                                  ;	   4. else 
 44934                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 44935                                  ;	   6. endif
 44936                                  ;	7. else
 44937                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 44938                                  ;	9. endif
 44939                                  ;
 44940                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44941                                  
 44942                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44943                                  
 44944                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44945                                  
 44946                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44947                                  ;
 44948                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 44949                                  ;
 44950                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44951                                  
 44952                                  ldivov:
 44953                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 44954                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 44955                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 44956                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 44957                                  i0patch:
 44958 0000108A EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont	
 44959                                  
 44960 0000108C E8E000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 44961                                  divov_cont:
 44962 0000108F 2EFF2E[6210]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 44963                                  
 44964                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44965                                  ;
 44966                                  ; INT 20 Handler
 44967                                  ;
 44968                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 44969                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 44970                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 44971                                  ; will be restored then.
 44972                                  ;
 44973                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44974                                  
 44975                                  lquit:
 44976                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 44977                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 44978                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 44979                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 44980                                  i20patch:
 44981 00001094 EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont	
 44982                                  
 44983 00001096 E8D600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 44984                                  quit_cont:
 44985 00001099 2EFF2E[6610]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 44986                                  
 44987                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44988                                  ;
 44989                                  ; INT 21 Handler
 44990                                  ;
 44991                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44992                                  
 44993                                  lcommand:
 44994                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 44995                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 44996                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 44997                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 44998                                  i21patch:
 44999 0000109E EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont	
 45000                                  
 45001 000010A0 E8CC00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45002                                  command_cont:
 45003 000010A3 2EFF2E[6A10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 45004                                  
 45005                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45006                                  ;
 45007                                  ; INT 25 
 45008                                  ;
 45009                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45010                                  
 45011                                  labsdrd:
 45012                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45013                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45014                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45015                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45016                                  i25patch:
 45017 000010A8 EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont	
 45018                                  
 45019 000010AA E8C200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45020                                  absdrd_cont:
 45021 000010AD 2EFF2E[6E10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 45022                                  
 45023                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45024                                  ;
 45025                                  ; INT 26
 45026                                  ;
 45027                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 45028                                  
 45029                                  labsdwrt:
 45030                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45031                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45032                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45033                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45034                                  i26patch:
 45035 000010B2 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont	
 45036                                  
 45037 000010B4 E8B800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45038                                  absdwrt_cont:
 45039 000010B7 2EFF2E[7210]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 45040                                  
 45041                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45042                                  ;
 45043                                  ; INT 27
 45044                                  ;
 45045                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 45046                                  
 45047                                  lstay_resident:
 45048                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45049                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45050                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45051                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45052                                  i27patch:
 45053 000010BC EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont	
 45054                                  
 45055 000010BE E8AE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45056                                  sr_cont:
 45057 000010C1 2EFF2E[7610]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 45058                                  
 45059                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45060                                  ;
 45061                                  ; INT 2f
 45062                                  ;
 45063                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45064                                  
 45065                                  lint2f:
 45066                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45067                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45068                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45069                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45070                                  i2fpatch:
 45071 000010C6 EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont	
 45072                                  
 45073 000010C8 E8A400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45074                                  int2f_cont:
 45075 000010CB 2EFF2E[7A10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+24]	; jmp to DOS
 45076                                  
 45077                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45078                                  ;
 45079                                  ; CPM entry
 45080                                  ;
 45081                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45082                                  
 45083                                  lcall_entry:
 45084                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45085                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45086                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45087                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45088                                  cpmpatch:
 45089 000010D0 EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont	
 45090                                  
 45091 000010D2 E89A00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45092                                  callentry_cont:
 45093 000010D5 2EFF2E[7E10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 45094                                  
 45095                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45096                                  
 45097                                  lirett:
 45098 000010DA CF                      	iret
 45099                                  
 45100                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45101                                  ;
 45102                                  ; LowIntXX:
 45103                                  ;
 45104                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 45105                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 45106                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 45107                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 45108                                  ;
 45109                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 45110                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 45111                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 45112                                  ;
 45113                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 45114                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 45115                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 45116                                  ;
 45117                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45118                                  
 45119 000010DB 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 45120 000010DF 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 45121 000010E3 00000000                DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 45122                                  
 45123                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 45124                                  LowInt23:
 45125                                  					; save the return address that is on
 45126                                  					; the stack
 45127 000010E7 2E8F06[DB10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 45128 000010EC 2E8F06[DD10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 45129                                  
 45130 000010F1 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 45131                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45132                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45133                                  
 45134 000010F3 E87900                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF 
 45135                                  
 45136 000010F6 2EFF2E[DB10]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 45137                                  
 45138                                  
 45139                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 45140                                  LowInt24:
 45141                                  					; save the return address that is on
 45142                                  					; the stack
 45143 000010FB 2E8F06[DF10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 45144 00001100 2E8F06[E110]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 45145                                  
 45146 00001105 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 45147                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45148                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45149                                  
 45150 00001107 E86500                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45151                                  
 45152 0000110A 2EFF2E[DF10]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 45153                                  
 45154                                  
 45155                                   
 45156                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 45157                                  LowInt28:
 45158 0000110F CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 45159                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45160                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45161                                  
 45162 00001111 E85B00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45163                                  
 45164 00001114 CB                      	retf
 45165                                  
 45166                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45167                                  
 45168                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45169                                  ;
 45170                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 45171                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 45172                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 45173                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 45174                                  ;
 45175                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 45176                                  
 45177                                  disa20_xfer:
 45178 00001115 E83F00                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 45179                                  
 45180                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 45181                                  
 45182                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 45183                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 45184                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 45185                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 45186                                  
 45187 00001118 FA                      	cli
 45188 00001119 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 45189                                  
 45190 0000111F 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 45191 00001121 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 45192 00001123 FB                      	sti
 45193                                  
 45194 00001124 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 45195 00001125 56                      	push	SI
 45196 00001126 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 45197 00001128 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 45198 0000112A 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 45199 0000112C CB                      	retf
 45200                                  
 45201                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45202                                  ;
 45203                                  ; M003:
 45204                                  ;
 45205                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 45206                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning 
 45207                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 45208                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for 
 45209                                  ; more info.	
 45210                                  ;
 45211                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that 
 45212                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's 
 45213                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 45214                                  ;
 45215                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45216                                  
 45217                                  disa20_iret:
 45218 0000112D E82700                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 45219 00001130 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 45220 00001134 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 45221 00001138 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 45222 0000113C 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 45223                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 45224 0000113E 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 45225 00001141 A1[F205]                	mov	AX,[NSP]
 45226 00001144 A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 45227 00001147 A1[F005]                	mov	AX,[NSS]
 45228 0000114A A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 45229                                  
 45230 0000114D 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 45231 0000114E 5B                      	pop	BX
 45232 0000114F 59                      	pop	CX
 45233 00001150 5A                      	pop	DX
 45234 00001151 5E                      	pop	SI
 45235 00001152 5F                      	pop	DI
 45236 00001153 5D                      	pop	BP
 45237 00001154 1F                      	pop	DS
 45238 00001155 07                      	pop	ES
 45239 00001156 CF                      	iret
 45240                                  
 45241                                  ;**************************************************************************
 45242                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line			      
 45243                                  ;									      
 45244                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in 	      
 45245                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 45246                                  ;									      
 45247                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA				      
 45248                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled					      
 45249                                  ;	USES	NOTHING					      
 45250                                  ;									      
 45251                                  ;**************************************************************************
 45252                                  
 45253                                  XMMDisableA20:
 45254 00001157 53                      	push	bx
 45255 00001158 50                      	push	ax
 45256                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 45257 00001159 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 45258 0000115B 2EFF1E[6311]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 45259 00001160 58                      	pop	ax
 45260 00001161 5B                      	pop	bx
 45261 00001162 C3                      	retn
 45262                                  
 45263                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 45264                                  
 45265                                  XMMcontrol:
 45266 00001163 00000000                	dd	0
 45267                                  
 45268                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45269                                  ;
 45270                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 45271                                  ;									      
 45272                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in		 	      
 45273                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 45274                                  ;									      
 45275                                  ;	ENTRY: none		
 45276                                  ;
 45277                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 45278                                  ;		
 45279                                  ; 	USES : NONE								      
 45280                                  ;									      
 45281                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45282                                  
 45283                                  LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 45284 00001167 8000                    	dw	00080h
 45285 00001169 0000                    	dw	00000h
 45286                                  
 45287                                  HighMemory:	; label dword
 45288 0000116B 9000                    	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 45289 0000116D FFFF                    	dw	0FFFFh
 45290                                  
 45291                                  EnsureA20ON:
 45292 0000116F 9C                      	pushf
 45293 00001170 1E                      	push    ds
 45294 00001171 06                      	push	es
 45295 00001172 51                      	push	cx
 45296 00001173 56                      	push	si
 45297 00001174 57                      	push	di
 45298                                  
 45299 00001175 2EC536[6711]            	lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 45300 0000117A 2EC43E[6B11]            	les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 45301 0000117F B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 45302 00001182 FC                      	cld
 45303 00001183 F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 45304                                  
 45305 00001185 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 45306                                  EA20_RET:
 45307 00001187 5F                      	pop	di
 45308 00001188 5E                      	pop	si
 45309 00001189 59                      	pop	cx
 45310 0000118A 07                      	pop	es
 45311 0000118B 1F                      	pop	ds
 45312 0000118C 9D                      	popf
 45313 0000118D C3                      	retn
 45314                                  
 45315                                  EA20_OFF:
 45316                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 45317                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 45318                                  
 45319 0000118E 53                      	push	bx
 45320 0000118F 50                      	push	ax
 45321                                  
 45322 00001190 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 45323 00001192 2EA3[8610]              	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 45324 00001196 2E8926[8810]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 45325 0000119B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 45326 0000119D 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 45327 0000119F BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 45328                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 45329                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 45330 000011A2 B405                    	mov	ah,5
 45331 000011A4 2EFF1E[6311]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 45332 000011A9 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 45333 000011AB 740F                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 45334                                  
 45335 000011AD 2EA1[8610]              	mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 45336 000011B1 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 45337 000011B3 2E8B26[8810]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 45338                                  
 45339 000011B8 58                      	pop	ax
 45340 000011B9 5B                      	pop	bx
 45341                                  
 45342 000011BA EBCB                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 45343                                  
 45344                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 45345 000011BC B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 45346 000011BE CD10                    	int	10h
 45347 000011C0 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 45348 000011C2 7406                    	je	short XMMcont			; Y: do not change mode
 45349 000011C4 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0			; set video mode
 45350 000011C6 B002                    	mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 45351 000011C8 CD10                    	int	10h
 45352                                  XMMcont:
 45353 000011CA B405                    	mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 45354 000011CC 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; page 0
 45355 000011CE CD10                    	int	10h
 45356                                  	
 45357 000011D0 BE[B812]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 45358 000011D3 0E                      	push	cs
 45359 000011D4 1F                      	pop	ds
 45360 000011D5 FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 45361                                  XMMprnt:
 45362 000011D6 AC                      	lodsb
 45363 000011D7 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 45364 000011D9 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh	
 45365 000011DB B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 45366 000011DD BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 45367 000011E0 CD10                    	int	10h
 45368 000011E2 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 45369                                  
 45370                                  XMMStall:
 45371 000011E4 FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 45372 000011E5 EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 45373                                  
 45374                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45375                                  
 45376                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45377                                  
 45378                                  ; retrodos4.s ; offset 0Ch in BIOS segment (0070h)
 45379                                  ALTAH	equ 0Ch
 45380                                  
 45381                                  ;This has been put in for WIN386 2.XX support. The format of the instance 
 45382                                  ;table was different for this. Segments will be patched in at init time.
 45383                                  
 45384                                  OldInstanceJunk:
 45385 000011E7 7000                    	dw	70h	;segment of BIOS
 45386 000011E9 0000                    	dw	0	;indicate stacks in SYSINIT area
 45387 000011EB 0600                    	dw	6	;5 instance items
 45388                                  
 45389                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:contpos, 2
 45390                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:bcon, 4
 45391                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:carpos,106h
 45392                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:charco, 1
 45393                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:exec_init_sp, 34               ;M032
 45394                                  	;dw	070h,offset BData:altah, 1	 ; altah byte in bios
 45395                                  
 45396 000011ED 0000[2200]0200          	dw	0,CONTPOS,2
 45397 000011F3 0000[3200]0400          	dw	0,BCON,4
 45398 000011F9 0000[F901]0601          	dw	0,CARPOS,106h
 45399 000011FF 0000[0003]0100          	dw	0,CHARCO,1
 45400 00001205 0000[C00F]2200          	dw	0,exec_init_SP,34
 45401 0000120B 70000C000100            	dw	70h,ALTAH,1	; altah byte in bios
 45402

 45404                                  
 45405                                  ; M021-
 45406                                  ;
 45407                                  ; DosHasHMA - This flag is set by seg_reinit when the DOS actually
 45408                                  ; 	takes control of the HMA. When running, this word is a reliable
 45409                                  ;	indicator that the DOS is actually using HMA. You can't just use
 45410                                  ;	CS, because ROMDOS uses HMA with CS < F000.
 45411                                  
 45412                                  DosHasHMA:
 45413 00001211 00                      	db	0
 45414                                  FixExePatch:
 45415 00001212 0000                    	dw	0		; M012
 45416                                  RationalPatchPtr:
 45417 00001214 0000                    	dw	0		; M012
 45418

 45428                                  rbc_loop:
 45429                                  	;loop	$

 45431 0000121D 59                      	pop	cx
 45432 0000121E CB                      	retf

 45454                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 45455                                  ;
 45456                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 45457                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 45458                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 45459                                  ;
 45460                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH 
 45461                                  ;
 45462                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!
 45463                                  ;
 45464                                  ;############################################################################

 45466                                  	;ORG	0122Ah
 45467                                  
 45468                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45469                                  
 45470                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 45471                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 45472                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 45473                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 45474                                  
 45475                                  ; country and code page information
 45476                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45477                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 45478 0000122A 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 45479 00001232 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 45479 0000123B 53595300           
 45480                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 45481 0000123F 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 45482                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45483                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 45484                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 45485                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 45486                                  ;  endif
 45487                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 45488                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 45489                                  ;  endif
 45490                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 45491                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 45492                                  ;  endif
 45493                                  ;else
 45494 00001272 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 45495                                  ;endif
 45496                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45497 00001274 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 45498 00001276 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 45499 00001277 [AD0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 45500 00001279 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45501 0000127B 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 45502 0000127C [2F0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 45503 0000127E 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45504 00001280 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 45505 00001281 [B10B]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 45506 00001283 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45507 00001285 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 45508 00001286 [E10B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 45509 00001288 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45510 0000128A 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 45511 0000128B [E30C]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 45512 0000128D 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 45513 0000128F 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 45514 00001290 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size
 45515                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45516                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 45517                                  ;	...... 
 45518                                  ;else
 45519 00001292 0100                    	dw   1				; USA country id
 45520 00001294 B501                    	dw   437			; USA system code page id
 45521 00001296 0000                    	dw   0 				; date format
 45522 00001298 2400000000              	db   '$',0,0,0,0		; currency symbol
 45523 0000129D 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator
 45524 0000129F 2E00                    	db   '.',0			; decimal separator
 45525 000012A1 2D00                    	db   '-',0			; date separator
 45526 000012A3 3A00                    	db   ':',0			; time separator
 45527 000012A5 00                      	db   0				; currency format flag
 45528 000012A6 02                      	db   2				; # of digits in currency
 45529 000012A7 00                      	db   0 				; time format
 45530 000012A8 [F50C]                  	dw   MAP_CASE			; mono case routine entry point
 45531 000012AA 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of entry point
 45532 000012AC 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; data list separator

 45533 000012B7 00

 45630                                  ;

 45674                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 45675                                  
 45676                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 45677                                  ;
 45678                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 45679                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 45680                                  ;
 45681                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 45682                                  ;
 45683                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 45684                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 45685                                  ;	    POP     DS
 45686                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 45687                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 45688                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 45689                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 45690                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 45691                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 45692                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 45693                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 45694                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 45695                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 45696                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 45697                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 45698                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 45699                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 45700                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 45701                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 45702                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 45703                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 45704                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 45705                                  ;	    POP     DS
 45706                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 45707                                  ;
 45708                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 45709                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 45710                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 45711                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 45712                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 45713                                  ;
 45714                                  ;   CRDROK:
 45715                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 45716                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 45717                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 45718                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 45719                                  
 45720 00001314 061F                    DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 45721                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 45722 00001316 8BDF                    DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 45723                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 45724 00001318 33C08BD0E8              			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 45725                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 45726 0000131D DF0E                    			db	0DFH,00EH
 45727                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC

 45729 00001328 8BD7B486368B3E          			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH

 45733 0000133A 8BFA0AC074103C0374-     			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H

 45743                                  
 45744                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 45745                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 45746                                  ;
 45747                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.

 45784                                  ;============================================================================
 45785                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 45786                                  ;============================================================================
 45787                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 45788                                  
 45789                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 45790                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 45791                                  ;
 45792                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 45793                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 45794                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 45795                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 45796                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 45797                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 45798                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 45799                                  ; to call out here.
 45800                                  ;
 45801                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 45802                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 45803                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 45804                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 45805                                  ;       
 45806                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 45807                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 45808                                  ;
 45809                                  ;Exported Functions
 45810                                  ;==================
 45811                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 45812                                  
 45813                                  ; DosData Segment
 45814                                  
 45815                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45816                                  
 45817                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45818                                  
 45819                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 45820                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 45821                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 45822                                  ; 'patch' related.
 45823                                  
 45824                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 45825                                  	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 45826                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45827                                  
 45828                                  MagicPatch:
 45829                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 45830                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 45831                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 45832                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 45833                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 45834                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 45835                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 45836                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 45837                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 45838                                  
 45839                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45840                                  
 45841                                  ;DosData Ends
 45842                                  
 45843                                  ; DOSDATA:136Ah
 45844                                  
 45845                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45846                                  
 45847                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 45848                                  
 45849                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45850                                  
 45851                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45852                                  ; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 Modification (paragraph alignment)
 45853                                  
 45854                                  db 0,1,12,64,19,0 ; ! Magic numbers !
 45855                                  
 45856                                  ;align 16
 45857                                  
 45858                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!
 45859                                  
 45860                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45862                                  %endif	; 05/11/2022
